854.description: Providing an exemption under the sales and use tax for the sale of a right to occupy a room or lodgings as a transient guest at a dormitory or other lodging facility that is operated solely in support of specified facilities or campuses, that provides lodging solely for employees, contractors, vendors, and other invitees of the corporation that owns the dormitory or lodging facility, and that does not offer lodging services to the general public.

855.title: Election Law - Montgomery County Republican and Democratic Party Central
855.description: Repealing provisions of law that specify the membership and govern the election of the Montgomery County Republican Party Central Committee; altering membership criteria for the Montgomery County Democratic Party Central Committee; requiring Democratic Party Central Committee members to be elected in a specified manner and limiting the number of members elected at large that may reside in the same legislative district; applying the Act to the election for Montgomery County Republican and Democratic Party Central committees; etc.

856.title: Montgomery County Board of Education - Student Member - Voting
856.description: Authorizing the student member of the Montgomery County Board of Education to vote on specified matters.

857.last_action: Special Order later today (Senator Colburn) Adopted
857.title: Montgomery County - Leghold or Body-Gripping Traps - Prohibition
857.description: Expanding the application of the prohibition against the use, setting, placement, or maintenance of a leghold or body-gripping trap in Montgomery County.

858.title: Election Law - Montgomery County Democratic Party Central Committee -
858.description: Altering the membership criteria for the Montgomery County Democratic Party Central Committee; specifying that specified central committee members are elected in a specified manner; limiting the number of members elected at large that may reside in the same legislative district; making the Act applicable commencing with a specified election; etc.

859.title: Montgomery County - Tenant Credit Check Restriction Act
859.description: Authorizing the owner or landlord of rental housing to conduct a credit check of a tenant applicant who qualifies under the federal Housing Choice Voucher Program for a 100% monthly housing assistance payment from the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County; and prohibiting an owner or landlord of rental housing from rejecting a tenant applicant on specified grounds.

860.title: Montgomery County - Enterprise Zones - Tax Credits
860.description: Requiring a lessor of real property in Montgomery County eligible for specified property tax credits to reduce by a specified amount the amount of tax for which the tenant is contractually liable under the lease under specified circumstances; authorizing the governing body of Montgomery County or of a municipal corporation in Montgomery County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on specified property located in specified enterprise zones; etc.

861.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
861.title: Statewide Advisory Commission on Immunizations - Membership and Sunset Repeal
861.description: Requiring the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene, in consultation with Med Chi, the Maryland State Medical Society, to appoint the chair of the Statewide Advisory Commission on Immunizations; establishing the terms of the members of the Commission; repealing a provision that requires the Commission to study and make recommendations about immunizations required by children entering schools in times of vaccine shortage; etc.

862.title: Maryland Professional Counselors and Therapists Act - Corrections
862.description: Requiring applicants for a license to practice clinical marriage and family therapy to hold a master's or doctoral degree in a specified field from an accredited educational institution that is approved by the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists; and altering the number of credit hours in alcohol and drug counselor training that are required for qualification as a certified professional counselor-alcohol and drug or certified association counselor-alcohol and drug.

863.title: Jessica's Law Part II - Truth in Sentencing
863.description: Prohibiting the earning of diminution credits to reduce the term of confinement of an inmate who is serving a sentence in a State or local correctional facility for committing first degree rape, second degree rape, first degree sexual offense, or second degree sexual offense against a child under the age of 13 years.

864.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
864.title: Baltimore County - English Language - Formal Recognition
864.description: Designating the English language as the official language of Baltimore County; making provisions of the Act applicable to specified Baltimore County functions and agencies; providing for specified exceptions; providing that the Act may not be construed to require the translation into English of any official motto or slogan; and making provisions of the Act severable.

865.title: Public Safety - Enforcement of Federal Immigration Law by Law Enforcement
865.description: Requiring each law enforcement agency in the State to enter into a memorandum of understanding to enforce federal immigration law; requiring each law enforcement agency in the State to provide training in federal immigration law to a law enforcement officer that will be performing immigration enforcement under a memorandum of understanding; and defining the terms "law enforcement agency" and "memorandum of understanding".

866.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
866.title: State Units - Contracts - Reporting Requirements - Reports
866.description: Requiring units that contract with community-based residential programs, residential child care programs, or group homes to collect data concerning certification as a minority-owned, woman-owned, or disability-owned business and suspensions or revocations of licensure within 10 years before the date of the contract; and requiring units to submit a specified annual report to the Governor's Office of Minority Affairs.

867.title: State Board of Pharmacy - Wholesale Distributor Permitting and Prescription
867.description: Authorizing the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to purchase and distribute specified drugs and devices for specified purposes; requiring the Department to adopt regulations, in consultation with the State Board of Pharmacy, for specified purposes; altering the circumstances under which the Board may grant "deemed status" to wholesale distributors; requiring wholesale distributors that receive a permit by reciprocity to comply with specified requirements; etc.

868.title: Real Property - Affordable Housing Land Trusts
868.description: Exempting a specified affordable housing land trust agreement from the application of the common law rule against perpetuities; authorizing an affordable housing land trust agreement to be recorded in the land records; exempting an affordable housing land trust agreement from specified provisions relating to a possibility of reverter and right of entry and the creation and redemption of reversionary interests; requiring the Department to maintain an online list of registered affordable housing land trusts; etc.

869.title: State Board of Physicians - Offices or Facilities for Performing Cosmetic
869.description: Authorizing the State Board of Physicians to discipline specified licensees that perform cosmetic surgical procedures in offices or facilities that are not accredited by specified associations or organizations or certified to participate in a specified program.

870.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters Withdrawn
870.title: Vehicle Laws - Registration of Vehicles - New Residents
870.description: Reducing from 60 days to 45 days the period of time during which a vehicle owned by a new resident of the State and displaying valid registration issued by the jurisdiction of the resident's former domicile is not subject to the requirement that specified vehicles driven on a highway be registered in accordance with specified provisions of law.

871.title: Higher Education - Private Career Schools - Financial Guarantee Requirements
871.description: Requiring specified private career schools to maintain specified financial guarantees under specified circumstances; and requiring the financial guarantees to be in specified forms and in specified amounts.

872.title: Business Occupations and Professions - Individual Tax Preparers - Examination
872.description: Repealing specified requirements relating to the examination to be given by the State Board of Individual Tax Preparers to an applicant for registration to provide individual tax preparation services.

873.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations Withdrawn
873.title: Oversight Committee on Monitoring and Quality of Care in Group Homes
873.description: Creating the Oversight Committee on Monitoring and Quality of Care in Group Homes; providing for the composition, chair, and staffing of the Oversight Committee; providing that a member of the Oversight Committee may not receive compensation but may be reimbursed for specified expenses; requiring the Oversight Committee to evaluate the progress in improving the monitoring and quality of care in group homes and develop recommendations; etc.

874.title: Vehicle Laws - Parking Spaces for Individuals with Disabilities - Professional
874.description: Requiring at least 4% of the parking spaces in the portion of the parking lot of a professional sports stadium that is open to the public or to general ticket holders to be designated for the use of individuals with disabilities and to conform to specified standards.

875.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters Withdrawn
875.title: Department of Natural Resources - Deer Hunting Licenses and Permits - Crossbow
875.description: Prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from requiring a person who holds a specified license or permit to hunt deer with a bow and arrow during bow season to obtain a separate license or permit to hunt deer with a crossbow during bow season.

876.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters Withdrawn
876.title: Baltimore County - Deer Hunting on Private Property - Sundays
876.description: Authorizing a person in Baltimore County to hunt deer on private property with a bow and arrow during open season on the last three Sundays in October and the second Sunday in November; and removing Baltimore County from a list of counties in which specified Sunday deer hunting privileges do not apply.

877.title: Health Insurance - Annual Preventive Care
877.description: Requiring specified insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for specified annual preventive care including an annual child wellness visit, a routine gynecological visit, and annual vision visit including a vision examination, and specified health screenings if specified conditions are met; etc.

878.title: Assisted Living and Nursing Home Residents Protection Act of 2010
878.description: Expanding the duties of the Sexual Offender Advisory Board to include reviewing specified policies, procedures, impacts, and laws and making recommendations relating to protecting residents and employees of nursing homes and assisted living facilities and the family members of residents from sexual offenders; requiring the Sexual Offender Advisory Board to submit a report to the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2011; etc.

879.title: Telephone Bills - Third-Party Vendor Billing
879.description: Prohibiting a third-party vendor or billing agent from submitting charges to a specified telephone company or reseller for third-party vendor billing without express authorization from an ordering customer; requiring the authorization to be separate from other documents and to include specified information; requiring a third- party vendor or billing agent to retain a specified copy of the express authorization for 2 years after authorization; etc.

880.title: Libraries - Collective Bargaining
880.description: Establishing a process for collective bargaining between county library employees and library system employers; authorizing employees to perform specified acts related to collective bargaining; authorizing an exclusive representative to enforce specified collective bargaining agreement provisions; prohibiting an employer and an employer's agents from performing specified acts related to collective bargaining; etc.

881.title: Insurance Producers - Use of Senior or Retiree Credential or Designation
881.description: Prohibiting an insurance producer from using a senior or retiree credential or designation in a way that is or would be misleading in connection with the offer, sale, or purchase of life insurance, health insurance, or annuities; requiring the Maryland Insurance Commissioner, in consultation with the Securities Commissioner of the Division of Securities in the Office of the Attorney General, to adopt regulations; providing for specified exemptions; etc.

882.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 - Prince George's County -
882.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 to remove the requirement that the Mayor and Town Council of the Town of Forest Heights provide a specified matching fund.

883.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - Daughter for the Day
883.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $100,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of Daughter for the Day, Inc. for the acquisition, planning, and design of the Daughter for a Day facility, located in Fort Washington; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

884.title: Video Lottery Terminal Revenues - School Construction and Improvement
884.description: Repealing a provision under the video lottery terminals gaming law that establishes a Purse Dedication Account; altering the distribution of revenues from video lottery terminals to provide that a specified percentage of those revenues is to be used for school construction and improvement in accordance with specified provisions of law; authorizing the State to borrow money, through the sale of bonds, in anticipation of video lottery revenues; etc.

885.title: Cigarette Business Licenses - Sale of Single Cigarettes - Investigation and
885.description: Authorizing the Comptroller of the State to investigate the sale of single cigarettes; prohibiting a person from selling, offering for sale, giving away, or delivering single cigarettes from a vending machine or in a retail establishment; and establishing specified penalties.

886.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
886.title: General Assembly - Fiscal Notes - Analysis of Long-Term Savings
886.description: Requiring a fiscal note for a bill to include an analysis of any potential long-term reduction in the expenditures of State government and of local governments and other long-term savings that could result from the bill; and requiring the analysis to project the potential long-term savings for a 5-year period beginning 1 year after the effective date of the bill.

887.title: Land Use - Community Benefit Agreements
887.description: Authorizing governing bodies that have zoning authority under Article 66B of the Code to recommend that a developer negotiate and enter into a community benefit agreement as part of a review of a site plan or development permit required by law; requiring, with a specified exception, that the governing body be a party to a community benefit agreement; authorizing the governing body to seek to enforce the terms of a community benefit agreement; and providing that the Act applies to charter counties and Baltimore City.

888.title: Montgomery County - Election Law - Days of Early Voting
888.description: Altering the required days for early voting before the 2010 gubernatorial primary and general elections in Montgomery County; and making the Act an emergency measure.

889.title: Creation of a State Debt - Montgomery County - RCI Group Home Renovations
889.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $100,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of Residential Continuum, Inc. for the renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of group homes for autistic individuals, located in Montgomery Village; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

890.title: Montgomery County - Investment Authority
890.description: Authorizing Montgomery County to make an equity investment through a specified fund in a company that is located in the county or that agrees to relocate their business to the county; providing that the proceeds of an equity investment made under the Act may be used for specified purposes; providing that the county may not acquire an ownership interest exceeding a specified percentage of any enterprise; etc.

891.title: Property Taxes - Bicounty Commissions
891.description: Providing that the homestead property tax credit applies to any State, county, or municipal corporation property tax and specified taxes imposed for specified bicounty commissions; specifying the applicable homestead credit percentage for specified taxes imposed for specified bicounty commissions; applying the Act to tax years beginning after June 30, 2010; etc.

892.title: Public Safety - Handgun Permits - Victims of Domestic Violence
892.description: Authorizing the Secretary of State Police, in determining whether a handgun permit is necessary as a reasonable precaution against apprehended danger, to consider whether the applicant is a person eligible for relief for whose benefit a court has issued a final protective order under the domestic violence law; etc.

893.title: Natural Resources - Hand-Launched Vessels - Statewide Pass
893.description: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish a statewide pass for hand-launched vessels; requiring the Department to issue a pass to persons who apply and pay a specified fee to the Department; authorizing a holder of a pass to use specified boating access facilities subject to specified requirements; requiring a pass to be displayed in a specified manner; and requiring specified fees to be distributed to a special fund for a specified purpose.

895.title: Income Tax - Standard Deduction
895.description: Repealing the computation under the Maryland income tax of the standard deduction based on 15% of an individual's Maryland adjusted gross income; setting the amount of the standard deduction to be $2,000 for an individual and $4,000 for spouses filing a joint return, a head of household, or a surviving spouse; and applying the Act to tax years after 2009.

896.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
896.title: Health - Task Force on Alzheimer's Disease
896.description: Establishing a Task Force on Alzheimer's Disease; providing for the membership of the Task Force; requiring the Task Force to survey specified research, practices, and approaches regarding Alzheimer's disease; requiring the Task Force to make specified recommendations; requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly on or before September 30, 2012; terminating the Act after September 30, 2012; etc.

897.title: Hometown Heroes Act of 2010 - Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for
897.description: Providing, under specified circumstances, a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for retirement income of residents who are at least 50 years old and are retired law enforcement officers or fire, rescue, or emergency services personnel; applying the Act to tax years beginning after 2009; etc.

898.title: Nursing Facility Residents - Home-Based and Community Services - Access
898.description: Requiring social workers to provide nursing facility residents with specified information about services under the home- and community- based waiver programs on admission and discharge from the nursing facility; requiring specified employees or representatives of designated protection and advocacy systems agencies to have access to specified residents; providing for the confidentiality of information; etc.

899.title: Developmental Disabilities Administration - Recipient Appeals
899.description: Requiring the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene to provide notice and an opportunity for a Medicaid fair hearing under specified circumstances; requiring the Secretary to provide specified notice within 30 days after the denial of Medicaid-waiver services to a recipient under a plan of habilitation; authorizing an individual who receives written notice of a denial to appeal the decision; etc.

900.title: Juvenile Law - Truancy Reduction Pilot Program - Caroline County and Talbot
900.description: Authorizing the Circuit Administrative Judge of the Second Circuit to establish a Truancy Reduction Pilot Program in Caroline County and Talbot County; and making provisions relating to Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs applicable to Caroline County and Talbot County.

901.title: Energy Companies - Net Energy Metering - Credit Transfers
901.description: Authorizing specified not-for-profit customers to transfer specified generation credits accrued from electricity produced from specified renewable sources to specified properties.

902.title: Transportation - Road Salt Management - Best Practices Guidance
902.description: Requiring the State Highway Administration, in consultation with the Department of the Environment, to develop a best practices road salt management document on or before October 1, 2011, for use by local jurisdictions and the State to minimize the adverse environmental impacts of road salt runoff in the State; requiring the Administration to update the guidance document annually and make it available to the public on the Administration's website; etc.

903.title: Civil Actions - Transmission of Altered Electronic Mail
903.description: Providing that a person who receives a communication through electronic mail and, after altering the communication, transmits the communication through electronic mail to a third party with the intent to defame, defraud, or otherwise harm the author of the communication is liable to the author in a civil action for specified damages; etc.

904.title: Criminal Law - Prohibitions on Wearing, Carrying, or Transporting Firearms -
904.description: Establishing an exception to the prohibition against wearing, carrying, or transporting a handgun or other regulated firearm for a person who is carrying a specified court order requiring the surrender of the handgun or other regulated firearm and who has notified a specified law enforcement unit that the handgun or regulated firearm is being transported in accordance with the court order, the handgun or regulated firearm is unloaded, and the respondent transports the handgun or regulated firearm directly to the law enforcement unit.

905.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations Withdrawn
905.title: Minority Business Enterprises - Signing Bids or Proposals - Submitting
905.description: Requiring specified bids or proposals to be signed by specified certified minority business enterprises; requiring specified contractors to submit specified subcontracts with minority business enterprises to specified units; and authorizing an extension of a specified requirement.

906.title: Civil Actions - Limitation of Actions - Land Surveyors
906.description: Altering the time period after which a person may not seek damages incurred as a result of an error in a land survey; applying the Act prospectively; etc.

907.title: Maryland Clean Energy Center - Miscellaneous Provisions
907.description: Altering the quorum requirement for the Maryland Clean Energy Center Board; altering the minimum vote required for the Board to act; designating employees and officials of the Maryland Clean Energy Center as State personnel under the Maryland Tort Claims Act; subjecting the Maryland Clean Energy Center to the procurement procedures relating to minority business participation; etc.

908.title: Baltimore City - Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights - Hearing Boards
908.description: Excepting a law enforcement officer who is a member of a Baltimore City law enforcement agency from the applicability of requirements relating to the membership of a hearing board that may conduct a hearing regarding charges against an officer; providing that a hearing board that may conduct a hearing regarding charges against a law enforcement officer who is a member of a Baltimore City law enforcement agency shall consist of one retired judge, rotated from a pool selected by a committee composed of specified individuals; etc.

909.title: State Government - Commemorative Days - Fire, Rescue, and Emergency Services
909.description: Requiring the Governor to proclaim the first Sunday in June each year as the day to honor fire, rescue, and emergency services workers who made the ultimate sacrifice in the performance of their duties; requiring the Governor to order the State flag to be flown at half-staff on a specified day each year; and requiring, on the first Sunday in June each year, specified memorial plaques to be placed by the Maryland Fire-Rescue Services Memorial Foundation, Inc., on the Maryland Fire-Rescue Services Memorial in the City of Annapolis.

910.title: Education - Tween/Teen Dating Violence (Kristin Marie Mitchell Law)
910.description: Requiring the State Board of Education to adopt in the public schools a specified program on dating violence on or before a specified date; altering the definition of "victim of domestic violence"; requiring the Governor to proclaim the first week in February each year "Tween/Teen Dating Violence Education and Awareness Week"; etc.

911.title: Public Safety - Regulation of Demolition - Demolition Contractors
911.description: Requiring a demolition contractor to obtain a demolition permit from the local designated authority before beginning demolition in the State; requiring a demolition contractor to provide specified information, specified evidence, and, under specified circumstances, a specified plan to the local designated authority in order to obtain a demolition permit; requiring a demolition contractor to comply with any other requirements established by the local designated authority in law, regulation, or ordinance; etc.

912.title: Consumer Protection - Prohibition on Placement of Unsolicited Commercial
912.description: Prohibiting specified publishers from placing or causing to be placed specified unsolicited commercial advertisements on a motor vehicle.

913.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Ways and Means
913.title: Cecil County Property Tax Rate - Constant Yield Tax Rate
913.description: Prohibiting the County Commissioners of Cecil County from setting a county property tax rate that exceeds the constant yield tax rate, excluding revenue from real property appearing for the 1st time on the assessment roll; and applying the Act to tax years beginning after June 30, 2010.

914.title: African American Heritage Preservation Program
914.description: Establishing the African American Heritage Preservation Program in the Maryland Historical Trust to identify and preserve buildings, communities, and sites of historical and cultural importance to the African American experience; requiring the Trust to develop and administer the Program in partnership with the Commission on African American History and Culture; requiring the Governor to include $1,000,000 in the annual capital budget submission for the Program for fiscal year 2012 and each fiscal year thereafter; etc.

915.title: Cecil County - Collective Bargaining - Representation of Deputy Sheriffs -
915.description: Authorizing the representatives of specified full-time sworn law enforcement deputy sheriffs in Cecil County to bargain collectively with the Sheriff and the County Commissioners of Cecil County on specified issues; authorizing sworn law enforcement deputy sheriffs to take or refrain from taking specified actions in connection with labor organizations with regard to specified collective bargaining activities; etc.

916.title: Elections - Campaign Finance - Prohibition of Contributions by Business
916.description: Prohibiting a business entity from making a contribution to a campaign finance entity; and defining the term "business entity" to mean a corporation, a general or limited partnership, a limited liability corporation, or a real estate investment trust.

917.title: Prescription Drug Monitoring Program
917.description: Establishing the Prescription Drug Monitoring Program in the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene; establishing the mission of the Program; requiring the Program to carry out its mission by monitoring the prescribing and dispensing of specified substances by prescribers and dispensers; establishing the powers and duties of the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene under the Program; requiring dispensers to submit specified information to the Program electronically except in specified circumstances; etc.

918.title: Criminal Procedure - Petition for Writ of Actual Innocence - Newly Discovered
918.description: Altering specified provisions relating to the filing of a petition for a writ of actual innocence; providing that a person may file a petition for a writ of actual innocence only if the person is convicted of a felony, an attempt to commit a felony, or a solicitation to commit a felony and the person entered a plea of not guilty to the charges; establishing that a person may file a petition if newly discovered evidence creates a substantial possibility that a result would have been different; etc.

919.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations Withdrawn
919.title: Commission to Study Streamlining and Increasing the Efficiency of the
919.description: Establishing a Commission to Study Streamlining and Increasing the Efficiency of the Procurement Process; providing for the membership, purposes, and staffing of the Commission; requiring the Commission to study specified matters; requiring the Commission to report to specified persons by a specified date; providing for the termination of the Act; etc.

920.last_action: First Reading Education Health and Environmental Affairs
920.title: Maryland Winery Modernization Act
920.description: Authorizing the Comptroller to issue a farmer's market permit to specified alcoholic beverages license holders; specifying that a permit may be used only at a specified time and place and for specified purposes; requiring the licensee to notify the local licensing board of the issuance of a farmer's market permit; limiting the number of permits that the Comptroller may issue; altering the scope of the Class 4 limited winery license; authorizing a licensee to exercise specified privileges; etc.

921.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Economic Matters Withdrawn
921.title: The Renewables First Act
921.description: Declaring specified findings and policies of the General Assembly; stating specified energy policy goals for the State; declaring that it is the policy of the State that specified policy goals should be prioritized in a specified manner; requiring a specified person to submit a specified statement when applying for a certificate of public convenience and necessity; requiring a specified person to submit a specified statement when applying for permission to construct a specified generating station under specified circumstances; etc.

922.title: Procurement - Minority Business Enterprises - Review of Application for
922.description: Requiring the Board of Public Works to adopt regulations that require the agency designated to certify minority business enterprises to complete its review and provide notice of its decision to the applicant within a specified period of time; and authorizing the agency to extend a specified notification requirement for a specified period of time if the agency provides the applicant with a specified notice and explanation.

923.title: State Personnel - Land Records Employees - Salaries and Benefits
923.description: Requiring that the operating expenses for the salaries and benefits of the employees of the land records office of the clerk of the circuit court for each county and Baltimore City be paid from the General Fund of the State, instead of the Circuit Court Real Property Records Improvement Fund, beginning with the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2010.

924.title: Family Law - Child Custody Determinations
924.description: Creating a rebuttable presumption that specified custodial arrangements are in the best interest of the child in specified child custody proceedings.

925.title: State Retirement and Pension System - Retiree Organization - Direct Mailings
925.description: Providing that a specified retiree organization may make only one request in April and one in October of each year to the Board of Trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System for retiree information that is necessary for direct mailings by the retiree organization; prohibiting a retiree organization from including specified political information in specified direct mailings; requiring the Board of Trustees to provide mail processing centers with retiree data subject to secure data share agreements; etc.

926.title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Out-of-State Applicants - Licensure
926.description: Exempting out-of-state applicants for licensure as a certified social worker or a certified social worker-clinical from specified requirements for licensure if the applicant is licensed or registered to practice social work in the other state at a specified level of licensure, has performed a specified number of hours of compensated practice over a specified period of time, and has passed an examination as a condition of licensure in that state; etc.

927.title: Punitive Damages - High-Risk Drunk Drivers
927.description: Authorizing a finder of fact to determine that a person with a specified alcohol concentration in the blood or breath of the person who causes personal injury or wrongful death while driving or attempting to drive a motor vehicle was acting with malice and award punitive damages under specified circumstances; etc.

928.title: Patient Centered Medical Home Program
928.description: Requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to establish a Maryland Patient Centered Medical Home Program under specified circumstances; requiring specified health insurance carriers to participate in the Program; requiring the Department to ensure that participation in the Program of managed care organizations and specified enrollees will support specified standards; authorizing the Commission to authorize a health insurance carrier to implement a specified single carrier patient centered medical home program; etc.

929.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters Withdrawn
929.title: Agriculture - Fertilizers and Pesticides - Release Reporting
929.description: Requiring the Department of Agriculture to adopt specified regulations regarding reporting on the release of fertilizers and pesticides; declaring specified findings of the General Assembly; requiring a person that releases fertilizers and pesticides to submit a specified report to the Department; requiring the report to contain specified information; requiring the report to cover the preceding calendar year and be submitted annually beginning on March 1, 2012; requiring the Department to establish the format of the report; etc.

930.title: Public Safety - Sexual Offender Advisory Board
930.description: Altering the composition of the Sexual Offender Advisory Board; requiring specified members of the Board to have specified expertise; providing for the terms of the appointed members of the Board to be staggered in a specified manner; altering the duties of the Board; requiring the Board to make a specified report by a specified date; and repealing a requirement that the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene provide staff to the Board.

931.title: Public Schools - New Construction or Renovation - Children's Environmental
931.description: Requiring each county board of education to adopt an environmental health plan for school construction or renovation projects that includes specified standards; requiring a plan adopted under the Act to include specified additional provisions for school construction or renovation that will be conducted while the public school is occupied; requiring specified hazardous substance removal standards adopted under the Act to include specified provisions; etc.

932.title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance and Debt Collection
932.description: Requiring chronic care hospitals to develop a financial assistance policy for free and reduced-cost care to patients; requiring a hospital financial assistance policy to provide reduced-cost medically necessary care to patients who have a financial hardship; requiring a hospital to apply a reduction that is most favorable to a patient; establishing requirements for continued eligibility for reduced-cost care due to a financial hardship; altering the requirements for a notice that a hospital must post; etc.

933.title: Vehicle Laws - Commercial Vehicles - Handheld Telephones Utilizing Push-to-Talk
933.description: Creating an exception to the use of a handheld telephone utilizing push-to-talk technology by an individual operating a commercial vehicle to specified prohibitions against using a handheld telephone while driving a motor vehicle; making the Act contingent on the taking effect of a specified Act of the General Assembly of 2010; etc.

934.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - South County Community
934.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $300,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the South County Outreach Ministries, Inc. for the construction of the South County Community Center, located in Prince George's County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

935.title: Crimes - Sex Offenders - Notification, Registration, and Penalties
935.description: Increasing the maximum and mandatory minimum penalties for a person convicted of rape in the second degree of a child under the age of 13 years; increasing the maximum and mandatory minimum penalties for a person convicted of a sexual offense in the second degree against a child under the age of 13 years; altering requirements relating to the registration on a specified registry of individuals who have committed specified sex offenses; etc.

936.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Economic Matters Withdrawn
936.title: Telephone Companies - Acquisitions and Franchises
936.description: Requiring specified telephone companies to provide the Public Service Commission with copies of specified documents at specified times under specified circumstances; requiring the Commission to provide the telephone companies with specified confidentiality and other protections under specified circumstances; prohibiting specified persons from acquiring the power to exercise specified influence over the policies and actions of a telephone company under specified circumstances without prior authorization from the Commission; etc.

937.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
937.title: Developmental Disabilities Administration - Waiting List Equity Fund
937.description: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill a specified appropriation to the Waiting List Equity Fund for providing community-based services to individuals eligible for those services from the Developmental Disabilities Administration; and prohibiting specified individuals from being denied access to community-based services from the Developmental Disabilities Administration within a specified period of time.

938.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
938.title: General Assembly Members - Use of Funds - Grant Writers
938.description: Authorizing a member of the General Assembly to use funds allocated to the member for the purpose of maintaining a district office to finance grant writers for nonprofit organizations if the nonprofit organizations and grant writers meet specified requirements; and allowing two or more members to combine funds to finance grant writers under specified circumstances.

939.title: Inmates - Life Imprisonment - Parole Approval and In Banc Review
939.description: Repealing provisions that provide that an individual who is serving a term of life imprisonment may be paroled only with the Governor's approval; and authorizing, with an exception, an individual serving a term of life imprisonment to have a judgment or determination of any point or question relating to the individual's conviction or sentence reviewed by a three-judge panel sitting in banc by filing a notice for in banc review any time after the individual has served at least 20 continuous years of imprisonment without being released on parole.

940.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - La Vida Sana (Healthy
940.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $200,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Engaged Community Offshoots, Inc. for the acquisition, design, and construction of the Healthy Living Farm, located in Edmonston; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

941.title: Public Safety - Electronic Control Devices - Training Program and Permit
941.description: Prohibiting a person from possessing or using an electronic control device unless the person has been issued a specified permit; prohibiting the sale or activation of an electronic control device in the State unless the purchaser provides valid proof to the seller that the purchaser has successfully completed an electronic control device training program approved by the Maryland Police and Correctional Training Commission; defining the term "electronic control device"; etc.

942.title: Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program
942.description: Establishing the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program; providing for the purposes of the Corps Program; establishing a Corps Board, with specified membership, officers, duties, staff, and terms; providing for the purpose of the Corps Board; requiring the Chesapeake Bay Trust, in consultation with the Corps Board, to make grants to qualified organizations for the creation or expansion of full- and part-time Corps Programs that involve State citizens of all ages in environmental and energy conservation projects; etc.

943.title: Recycling - Bars and Restaurants - Beverage Containers
943.description: Requiring specified distributors, on or before January 1, 2012, to establish a program for the collection and recycling of specified beverage containers; requiring specified owners and managers of bars and restaurants, beginning January 1, 2012, to separate, store, and arrange for the collection and recycling of specified beverage containers; requiring the Department of the Environment to provide specified financial assistance to distributors for establishing a specified recycling program; etc.

944.title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 1-Day Licenses - Applications and Notice
944.description: Requiring an applicant for a specified 1-day license in Baltimore City to submit an application to the Board of License Commissioners at least 10 days before the license takes effect; requiring the Board to post notice on its website of specified licenses the Board approves for issuance at least 5 days before they take effect; and requiring a notice to include specified information.

945.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Ways and Means
945.title: Building Opportunities for All Students and Teachers (BOAST) in Maryland Tax
945.description: Providing a tax credit against the State income tax for contributions made to an eligible educational scholarship organization or an eligible innovative educational organization; requiring the State Department of Education to administer the tax credit; requiring specified entities to submit an application to be an eligible organization by January 1 of each year; establishing the Building Opportunities for All Students and Teachers Reserve Fund; etc.

946.title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Tasting Licenses
946.description: Creating in Anne Arundel County a BWST beer, wine and spirits tasting (on-premises) license; specifying that the BWST license may be issued to specified persons; creating a license fee schedule for a BWST license and altering the fee schedule for a BWT beer and wine (on- premises) tasting license; and specifying limitations on the amount of alcoholic beverages that may be offered for on-premises consumption.

947.title: Baltimore County - Bargaining Unit for Public School Employees
947.description: Altering provisions of law relating to the designation of the exclusive representative for specified public school employees in Baltimore County; repealing provisions of law that authorized Baltimore County to designate as a separate bargaining unit only specified registered nurses in specified schools in the county; prohibiting more than two bargaining units in Baltimore County and requiring each unit to consist of specified employees; etc.

948.title: Creation of a State Debt - Anne Arundel County - Coordinating Center for Home
948.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $3,475,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Coordinating Center for Home and Community Care, Inc. for the acquisition, planning, design, capital equipping, and build-out of the building facilities for the Coordinating Center for Home and Community Care, located in Millersville; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; etc.

949.title: Children - Joint Legal Custody and Equal Parenting Time - Preference
949.description: Requiring a court in specified child custody proceedings to first consider an award of joint legal custody and physical custody for approximately equal periods of time for each parent; authorizing a court that does not find that award appropriate to order a disposition it finds appropriate for the circumstances; and providing that the Act does not preclude the court's consideration of other provisions of law, including provisions providing protection from domestic violence.

950.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
950.title: Health Insurance Carriers - Declinations of Applications for Coverage -
950.description: Altering the information that health insurance carriers are required to submit to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner in a specified report to include the reason that an application for individual health insurance coverage was declined; requiring the Commissioner to post specified information on the Maryland Insurance Administration's website; requiring the Commissioner to compile a summary report of specified information and to make the report available to the public; etc.

951.title: Great Preschools Tax Credit Program
951.description: Allowing an individual or a corporation a credit against the State income tax for contributions to specified scholarship-granting organizations; providing for the carryover of unused credits for 3 years; requiring scholarship-granting organizations to take specified actions to be eligible for donations for which a tax credit may be claimed; requiring the Comptroller to administer the Great Preschools Tax Credit Program; applying the Act to taxable years after 2009; etc.

952.title: Agriculture - Commercial Feed - Arsenic Prohibition
952.description: Prohibiting a person from using, selling, or distributing commercial feed intended for use as poultry feed that contains roxarsone or any other additive that contains arsenic.

953.title: Vehicle Laws - Parking Violations - Administrative Enforcement by Counties and
953.description: Authorizing a county or a municipal corporation, by ordinance, to establish an alternative enforcement program for the issuance of civil parking citations for violations of specified restrictions on the stopping, standing, or parking of vehicles; establishing requirements for an ordinance adopted under the Act; requiring an ordinance adopted under the Act to provide for a specified judicial review in the District Court; etc.

954.title: State Personnel - Accrual of Annual Leave - Local Government Service
954.description: Including specified service by specified former employees of counties and municipal corporations in the definition of "total State service" for purposes of determining the accrual of annual leave for specified State employees.

955.title: Electricians, Gas Fitters, HVAC Contractors, and Plumbers - Display of Licenses
955.description: Prohibiting a county or municipal corporation, subject to an exception, from requiring a licensed plumber, gas fitter, or heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration (HVAC) contractor to display a specified certificate number, and from requiring a licensed master electrician to display a license number on a vehicle used for providing specified services; and requiring a specified master electrician to display a State license number on specified vehicles used for providing specified services.

956.title: Tobacco-Related Products - Definitions and Distribution to Minors
956.description: Altering the definition of "cigarette" in connection with tobacco taxes, the regulation of cigarette business, the sale of cigarettes below cost, and specified fire safety standards to include specified tobacco products that are wrapped in specified substances and weigh less than a specified amount; prohibiting the distribution of tobacco- related products to minors; requiring specified persons to inspect a customer's driver's license before distributing specified tobacco- related products; etc.

957.title: Estates and Trusts - Minor Child or Incapacitated Child - Forced Shares
957.description: Establishing that a specified minor child or incapacitated child may not be deprived of a specified share of the estate of a parent of the child unless the parent has just cause to disinherit the child; providing that a donor with a specified child may not make donations to certain specified persons beyond specified limitations; etc.

958.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
958.title: Procurement - Single Minority Business Enterprise Certification Agency for
958.description: Requiring the Board of Public Works to adopt regulations to designate one State agency as the certification agency for business entities seeking minority business enterprise status to participate in specified local government procurement.

959.title: Gaming - Video Lottery Terminals - Player Cards
959.description: Requiring that each video lottery terminal in a video lottery facility be operated only by the insertion of a video lottery player card; requiring an individual who seeks to obtain a video lottery player card to provide the video lottery operation licensee with specified proof of identification; requiring the licensee to use video lottery player cards to prohibit an individual from playing a video lottery terminal under specified conditions; and requiring the State Lottery Commission to adopt certain regulations.

960.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters Withdrawn
960.title: Environment - Yard Waste Composting - Plastic Bag Prohibition
960.description: Prohibiting a person from using a plastic bag for the final disposal of yard waste or natural wood waste under specified circumstances; and allowing a person to transport yard waste or natural wood waste in a plastic bag under specified circumstances.

961.title: Crimes - Child Endangerment
961.description: Prohibiting a parent or other person who has permanent or temporary care or custody or responsibility for supervision of a minor from recklessly failing to act in a specified manner with respect to the child; establishing the crime of child endangerment; specifying penalties; etc.

962.title: Child Support Enforcement - Interception of Abandoned Property
962.description: Adding abandoned property delivered to the State Comptroller under the laws relating to the disposition of abandoned property to provisions of law requiring the State Comptroller to withhold the amount of specified child support arrearages from payments due to obligors and to forward the amount withheld to the Child Support Enforcement Administration.

963.title: Environment - Stormwater Management - New Development and Redevelopment
963.description: Making specified stormwater management regulations adopted by the Department of the Environment applicable to all new development and redevelopment projects that do not have final approval for erosion and sediment control and stormwater management plans by May 4, 2020; and making the Act an emergency measure.

964.title: Real Property - Mechanics' Liens - Extent of Lien Applied to Tenant's Interest
964.description: Altering the percentage of value of a building erected, repaired, rebuilt, or improved by a tenant for life or years for purposes of determining the extent of a mechanics' lien on the building.

965.title: Washington County - Salary Study Process
965.description: Altering the method of selecting the at large member of the Washington County Salary Study Commission; repealing the requirement that the Commission study the salary of the Washington County State's Attorney; requiring the County Commissioners for Washington County to set specified salaries within a specified period of time; establishing that a specified requirement does not apply to the County Commissioners for Washington County or the Washington County Sheriff; etc.

966.title: Washington County - Local Forest Conservation Fund - Fee-in-Lieu Rates
966.description: Providing that the standard fee-in-lieu rate that a person is required to pay into a local forest conservation fund under specified circumstances does not apply in Washington County; requiring Washington County, in consultation with the Department of Natural Resources and the Washington County Soil Conservation District, to establish fee-in-lieu rates to be paid into the Washington County Forest Conservation Fund under specified circumstances based on specified criteria; etc.

967.title: Workers' Compensation - Appeals - Evidence
967.description: Authorizing the introduction of specified health care records as evidence in an appeal from a decision of the Workers' Compensation Commission under specified circumstances; requiring a specified notice to be served to all parties within a specified time period; establishing a specified limit on a judgment; requiring a court to alter a specified award under specified circumstances; providing that the Act does not apply to specified determinations, awards, or claims; etc.

968.title: Motor Fuel Tax - Adjustments
968.description: Altering the motor fuel tax rates for specified motor fuel; providing for increases in the motor fuel tax rates for specified motor fuel for specified periods; requiring the Comptroller to make specified determinations and announcements; and providing for the payment of taxes on specified tax-paid motor fuel.

969.title: Department of Assessments and Taxation - Processing Fees and Electronic
969.description: Establishing specified fees that the State Department of Assessments and Taxation must collect for processing specified business entity documents within specified time periods; and requiring the Department, contingent on the availability of funds, to develop and implement a system, accessible on the Department's website, for the electronic filing and processing of documents authorized or required by law to be submitted to the Department.

970.title: Maryland Statutory Trust Act
970.description: Clarifying and revising the Maryland Business Trust Act and renaming it to be the Maryland Statutory Trust Act; providing that a use of a specified designation or statement in a specified certificate of trust or governing instrument does not create a specified presumption or inference; clarifying that a statutory trust has specified general powers; etc.

971.title: Maryland General Corporation Law - Miscellaneous Provisions
971.description: Altering the manner in which specified charter documents of specified business entities must be executed by authorizing specified officers, agents, and persons to sign, acknowledge, witness, and attest the documents and to verify specified matters and facts; clarifying that a corporation may provide by its charter that holders of one or more classes or series of stock have specified voting rights; etc.

972.title: Public Schools - Maryland Youth Crisis Hotline - Distribution of Information
972.description: Requiring each county board of education to provide students in the 6th through 12th grades with the telephone number of the Maryland Youth Crisis Hotline in specified ways; providing that a county board is not required to reprint or reissue student handbooks or student identification cards in use on the effective date of the Act in order to comply with the Act; etc.

973.title: Nutrient Trading - Voluntary Agricultural Nutrient Credit Certification Program
973.description: Authorizing the State Department of Agriculture to establish requirements for the voluntary certification and registration of nutrient credits on agricultural land; establishing specified certification and registration requirements; authorizing the Secretary of Agriculture to suspend or revoke the approval or certification of credits under specified circumstances; declaring the intent of the General Assembly; etc.

974.title: Vehicle Laws - Maryland Transportation Authority - Highways
974.description: Altering and redesignating the definition of "vehicular crossing" for purposes of specified provisions of the Maryland Vehicle Law to include specified highways under the jurisdiction of the Maryland Transportation Authority, thereby applying specified provisions of law to highways under the jurisdiction of the Authority; etc.

975.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters Withdrawn
975.title: Reduction of Lead Risk in Housing
975.description: Repealing provisions of law relating to specified qualified offers in connection with the liability of an owner of specified rental property; repealing a provision of law relating to a specified window replacement program; repealing obsolete provisions of law relating to the reduction of lead risk in housing; etc.

976.title: Washington County - Local Government Tort Claims Act - Inclusion of Specified
976.description: Altering the definition of a "local government" under the Local Government Tort Claims Act to include a specified nonprofit corporation in Washington County; and providing that a specified notice requirement does not apply to specified actions against a specified nonprofit corporation in Washington County or its employees.

977.title: Harford County Board of Education - Student Member - Voting Rights
977.description: Providing that the student member of the Harford County Board of Education has specified voting rights; prohibiting the student member from voting on specified matters; altering procedures for the election of the student member; requiring the Harford County Regional Association of Student Councils to conduct a specified nominating convention; altering the qualifications of the student member; providing for the reimbursement of specified expenses of the student member under specified circumstances; etc.

978.title: Estates and Trusts - Relocation of Charitable Trust Administration Outside of
978.description: Prohibiting, except in specified circumstances, a trustee of a charitable trust from changing the location in which the trust administration takes place from a location in this State to a location outside this State; requiring a trustee that decides to change the location in which a charitable trust is administered from a location in this State to a location outside this State to take specified steps; requiring the Attorney General to review a specified submission by a trustee; etc.

979.title: Harford County - Casino Events
979.description: Creating in Harford County a permit that authorizes specified nonprofit organizations to conduct a casino event; specifying standards and requirements that organizations must meet to be issued a permit; limiting to four the number of events an organization may hold in a year; stating the location and hours for conducting a casino event; specifying that the maximum bet a single individual may place on a game is $10; etc.

980.title: St. Mary's County Board of Education - Inclusion of Employees in Bargaining
980.description: Including specified employees of the St. Mary's County Board of Education who do not hold a teaching certificate in a bargaining unit designated for teachers, administrators, and supervisors who do hold a teaching certificate.

981.title: Solid Waste Management - Recycling and Source Reduction - Study
981.description: Requiring the Department of the Environment, in consultation with specified persons, to conduct a specified study to evaluate solid waste processes that reduce the solid waste stream through specified methods and to submit reports to the General Assembly on or before December 15, 2010.

982.title: Public Schools - Law Enforcement Officers - Cultural Competency Model Training
982.description: Requiring the Maryland Police Training Commission, in consultation with the State Department of Education, to develop a cultural competency model training curriculum for specified law enforcement officers; providing for the contents of the cultural competency model training curriculum; and encouraging specified law enforcement officers assigned to public schools to complete the cultural competency model training curriculum before beginning an assignment in a public school.

983.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations Withdrawn
983.title: Employment - Applications for Employment - Prohibitions
983.description: Altering the employment policy of the State to provide fair employment practices to all citizens; prohibiting a person from failing or refusing to hire, or discharging a person because of the person's refusal to answer specified questions; prohibiting a person from requesting or requiring specified information from an applicant for employment on an employment application; etc.

984.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Economic Matters Withdrawn
984.title: Public and Commercial Buildings - Energy Benchmarking and Disclosure
984.description: Requiring gas or electric companies to maintain, in a specified format, gas or electric consumption records for nonresidential retail gas and electric customers; requiring a gas or electric company to upload to the EPA Portfolio Manager certain gas consumption records after receiving authorization from an owner or operator of a nonresidential building; requiring that certain commercial buildings be benchmarked annually, beginning in specified years, using the EPA Portfolio Manager; etc.

985.title: Corporations - Campaign Material - Stockholder Approval
985.description: Prohibiting a corporation from publishing or distributing campaign material in the State unless the campaign material is true, the board of directors has determined that the expenditure of funds is in the best interests of the corporation, and the content of the campaign material and the expenditure of funds has been approved by the stockholders by a specified vote; authorizing a direct stockholder action for an alleged violation of the Act; etc.

986.last_action: Re-referred Education Health and Environmental Affairs
986.title: Marine Contractors - Licensure and Regulation - Tidal Wetlands Licenses
986.description: Exempting specified licensed marine contractors from specified home improvement contractor licensing requirements; requiring the Department of the Environment to make specified notifications regarding specified wetlands license applications and delineations within 45 days of receipt; requiring the Department to grant, deny, or condition specified tidal wetlands license applications and delineations within 45 days of the time the application is complete under specified circumstances; requiring specified public notice; etc.

987.title: Department of Natural Resources - Regulation of For-Hire Water Carriers
987.description: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to require for-hire water carriers to show specified proof that the for-hire water carrier holds a specified insurance policy or bond in accordance with a specified regulation before vessel registration; altering the definition of common carrier to exclude for-hire water carriers from regulation by the Public Service Commission; etc.

988.title: State Personnel - Natural Resources Law Enforcement Officers - Appointment to
988.description: Authorizing the Secretary of Natural Resources to appoint a specified law enforcement officer to the rank of Major or Lieutenant Colonel without examination; establishing that a specified law enforcement officer continues to serve at the pleasure of the Secretary; providing that on termination of a specified appointment, the Secretary may return a law enforcement officer to a specified vacant position or promote the law enforcement officer to a specified higher rank; etc.

989.title: Financial Institutions - Credit Unions and Depository Institutions - Authority
989.description: Authorizing a credit union, subject to the approval of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation, to conduct a savings promotion raffle under specified conditions; authorizing a depository institution to conduct a savings promotion raffle for the exclusive benefit of eligible customers; exempting specified savings promotion raffles from specified provisions of law relating to the award of prizes by chance; authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to take specified actions relating to a savings promotion raffle; etc.

990.title: Criminal Law - Self-Defense - Immunity for Use of Physical Force in Defense of
990.description: Establishing that an occupant of a dwelling is justified in using any degree of physical force, including deadly physical force, against another person when that other person has made an unlawful entry into the dwelling, and when the occupant has a reasonable belief that the other person has committed a crime in the dwelling in addition to the unlawful entry, or is committing or intends to commit a crime against a person or property in addition to the unlawful entry; etc.

992.title: Vehicle Laws - Use of Wireless Communication Devices - Prohibition
992.description: Altering a specified provision of law prohibiting the use of a text messaging device while operating a motor vehicle in specified circumstances to prohibit the use of a wireless communication device while operating a motor vehicle in motion or in the travel portion of the roadway; and altering a specified exception to provide that the Act does not apply to the use of a wireless communication device to contact a 9-1-1 system.

993.title: Criminal Law - Death Penalty - Scientific Evidence
993.description: Including scientific evidence among the types of evidence that the State may present to the court or jury in order to sentence a defendant found guilty of murder in the first degree to death.

994.title: Regulation of Crematories
994.description: Requiring the Office of Cemetery Oversight and the State Board of Morticians and Funeral Directors to establish a specified process and adopt specified regulations for regulating crematories; providing that specified registration, permitting, and licensure requirements do not apply to crematories with specified ownership and crematories or incinerators located at specified medical facilities or educational institutions; prohibiting the Director of Cemetery Oversight from assessing a specified occurrence cremation fee; etc.

995.title: Subsequent Sexual Offenders - Reduced Diminution Credits, Parole Elimination,
995.description: Decreasing the number of days per month that an inmate who has been convicted of specified sexual offenses is allowed as a deduction in advance from the inmate's term of confinement; eliminating parole eligibility for specified sexual offenders; etc.

996.title: Maryland Transit Administration - Police Vehicles - Video Recording Devices
996.description: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to install and activate a video recording device in specified police vehicles; requiring the Administration to post a specified notice on each police vehicle equipped with a video recording device; limiting to specified persons and for specified purposes the review of any video recording that is made in police vehicles used by Administration police officers engaged in official duties; requiring the Administration, in cooperation with the Office of the Attorney General, to adopt regulations; etc.

997.title: Criminal Law - Juvenile Court Jurisdiction - Repeat Violent Offender
997.description: Establishing that the circuit court for a county sitting as the juvenile court does not have jurisdiction over a child at least 16 years old alleged to have committed a specified crime of violence after previously being adjudicated and found to have committed at least three crimes of violence unless a specified order removing the proceeding to the court has been filed.

998.title: Watershed Protection and Restoration Act
998.description: Requiring counties and municipalities to adopt laws or ordinances to establish a stormwater remediation fee and a local watershed protection fund on or before July 1, 2011; requiring counties and municipalities to collect the fees and administer the funds in accordance with the Act; requiring counties and municipalities to set the amount of the fee and assess the fee in a specified manner; requiring counties and municipalities to report specified information to the Department of the Environment; etc.

999.title: Vehicle Laws - Police Vehicles Engaged in Traffic Stops - Video Recording
999.description: Requiring that, on or after a specified date, a motor vehicle of a law enforcement agency used to initiate a traffic stop shall be equipped with an in-car video recording system that activates on the activation of the vehicle's emergency lights and makes a video recording of any activity occurring immediately in front of the vehicle during the traffic stop; etc.

1000.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Ways and Means Withdrawn
1000.title: Baltimore City - Tax Credit - Use of City Recycling Bins
1000.description: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax on specified dwellings if the occupant of the dwelling uses specified recycling bins; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to provide by law for the provisions of the tax credit; applying the Act to tax years beginning after June 30, 2010.

1001.title: Baltimore City - Police Vehicles Engaged in Traffic Stops - Video Recording
1001.description: Requiring that, on or after a specified date, a motor vehicle of a specified law enforcement agency in Baltimore City used to initiate a traffic stop shall be equipped with an in-car video recording system that activates on the activation of the vehicle's emergency lights and makes a video recording of any activity occurring immediately in front of the vehicle during a traffic stop; requiring that the video recording be retained by the law enforcement agency for 1 year; and defining terms.

1002.title: Marriage Ceremonies - Performance by Tax Court Judges
1002.description: Requiring a judge of the United States Tax Court who is authorized to perform a marriage ceremony in the State to be a resident of the State.

1003.title: Credit Regulation - Application Fees for Credit Cards and Loans - Prohibited
1003.description: Prohibiting a person who offers a credit card or a consumer, business, or mortgage loan from charging an application, administrative, or processing fee to a person applying for the credit card or loan.

1004.title: Parole Elimination and Restrictions on Pretrial Release - Cases Involving
1004.description: Eliminating parole eligibility for an inmate who is serving a term of imprisonment for a crime of violence involving a victim who was at least 35 years older than the inmate; prohibiting a District Court commissioner from authorizing the pretrial release of a defendant charged with a crime of violence involving a victim who is at least 35 years older than the defendant; etc.

1006.title: Highway Electronic Toll and Fee Consolidation Act
1006.description: Providing that the Maryland Transportation Authority may send only one notice each month to a vehicle owner regarding unpaid tolls owed for the use of specified toll facilities; requiring the Authority to consolidate all tolls owed in the monthly notice; authorizing the Authority to assess one service fee in the monthly notice and limiting the amount of the fee; requiring the Authority to develop a website that allows specified vehicle owners to access information regarding tolls due; etc.

1007.title: Injured Workers' Insurance Fund - Status and Renaming
1007.description: Renaming the Injured Workers' Insurance Fund as the Chesapeake Employers' Mutual Insurance Company; requiring the Company to be a specified authorized mutual insurer; altering the provisions of law that apply to the Company that applied to the Fund; specifying that the Company is a statutorily created nonprofit insurer that is not a unit of State government; providing that an employee of the Company is not an employee of the State and is not subject to specified laws; etc.

1008.title: Corporations - Benefit Corporation
1008.description: Authorizing a corporation to elect to be a specified benefit corporation by amending or including in the charter of the corporation a statement that the corporation is a benefit corporation; requiring the election to be approved by the stockholders in a specified manner; authorizing a corporation to terminate status as a benefit corporation in a specified manner; requiring that clear reference to the fact that a corporation is a benefit corporation appear prominently in a specified charter document; etc.

1009.title: Juvenile Law - Transfer of Case at Sentencing - Expungement of Criminal Charge
1009.description: Establishing that, if a court exercising criminal jurisdiction in a case involving a child transfers its jurisdiction to the juvenile court at sentencing under a specified provision of law, the court shall enter a written order transferring its jurisdiction and ordering that the child be subject to the jurisdiction and procedures of the juvenile court; repealing a provision concerning the transfer of a specified record to the juvenile court; authorizing the Court of Appeals to adopt specified rules; etc.

1010.title: Juvenile Law - Lead Testing - Authorized
1010.description: Authorizing the juvenile court to order a child to undergo blood lead level testing after a petition has been filed but before an adjudication; authorizing a court exercising criminal jurisdiction in a case involving a child to order the child to undergo blood level testing before trial; and requiring a copy of the blood lead level test results to be provided to the child, the child's parent or guardian, the child's counsel, and the State's Attorney.

1011.title: Report and Record Immigration Status - Division of Correction and Division of
1011.description: Requiring the Division of Correction and the Division of Parole and Probation to forward specified information from a specified case record and presentence investigation report, respectively, to the United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement Agency if the case record or presentence investigation report indicates that the inmate or the individual has an immigration status; etc.

1012.title: Wind-Powered Electric Generating Facilities - Decommissioning and Restoration -
1012.description: Requiring the Public Service Commission to establish a surcharge on wind-powered electric generating facilities in the State with a generating capacity that does not exceed 70 megawatts; requiring the Comptroller to collect the revenue from the surcharge and deposit it into the Maryland Wind-Powered Electric Generating Facility Decommissioning and Restoration Fund; authorizing a wind-powered electric generating facility to post a bond or other security acceptable to the Commission in lieu of the surcharge; etc.

1013.title: Clean Energy Loan Programs
1013.description: Altering the requirements of a specified Clean Energy Loan Program adopted by a political subdivision under specified circumstances; requiring that a specified energy audit required to be performed before a political subdivision approves a specified loan identify specified cost-effective energy efficiency projects and renewable energy projects that would generate a specified projected yearly energy cost savings; etc.

1014.title: Health Insurance - Purchasing Out of State - Feasibility Study
1014.description: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to study the feasibility and desirability of allowing State residents to purchase health insurance out of state and of establishing an Interstate Health Insurance Compact; requiring the study to examine specified items and issues; and requiring the Administration to report its findings and any recommendations.

1015.title: Baltimore County - Public School Employees - Collective Bargaining and
1015.description: Requiring the Board of Education of Baltimore County to negotiate specified fees with specified employee organizations representing specified certificated and noncertificated employees to be charged to specified nonmembers for specified representation; etc.

1016.title: Health Insurance - Child Wellness Benefits
