1513.title: Real Property - Condominiums - Cancellation of Insurance
1513.description: Altering the procedure for cancellation of specified property and casualty insurance that must be maintained by the council of unit owners of a condominium.

1514.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1514.title: Business Regulation - Motor Fuel - Sales Below Cost - Meeting Competition
1514.description: Providing that a retail service station dealer may sell motor fuel below cost if the sale is made in good faith to meet lawful competition.

1515.title: Vehicle Laws - Accidents Involving Self-Insured Vehicles - Required Information
1515.description: Requiring the driver of a self-insured vehicle involved in an accident to give evidence of self-insurance in the form required by the Motor Vehicle Administration to specified persons; requiring the Administration to adopt specified regulations; and requiring the evidence of self-insurance to include specified information.

1516.title: Standardbred Recovery Act of 2010
1516.description: Abolishing the State Racing Commission and establishing the Thoroughbred Racing Commission and the Standardbred Racing Commission; providing for the memberships, qualifications for members, terms, chairs, quorums, meetings, compensation, executive directors, staffs, specified employees, specified powers, and testing laboratories of the Thoroughbred Racing Commission and of the Standardbred Racing Commission; altering allocations of funds from specified accounts; etc.

1517.title: Natural Resources - Deer Hunting - Sundays
1517.description: Repealing provisions of law authorizing deer hunting on private property on specified Sundays in specified counties; and authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to allow a person to hunt deer on private property on specified Sundays.

1518.title: Creation of a State Debt - Anne Arundel County - Southern and Broadneck High
1518.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $500,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to Anne Arundel County Public Schools for the acquisition, construction, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of field lights at Southern and Broadneck High Schools; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1519.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Ways and Means Withdrawn
1519.title: Tax Credit for New or Expanded Business Facilities
1519.description: Providing a credit against the State income tax under specified circumstances for a qualified business entity that establishes or expands a business facility in the State that will create at least 10 qualified positions; requiring the Secretary of Business and Economic Development to certify persons as eligible for the tax credit and certify the maximum amount of credit for which a person is eligible; limiting the total amount of credits that may be approved to $10,000,000; etc.

1520.title: Criminal Law - Mistreated Animals - Seizure Requirements and Procedures
1520.description: Requiring the owner or custodian of an animal that is removed from a place because of mistreatment to complete an administrative remedy offered by a local animal control agency or humane society officer; authorizing the officer to petition the District Court for a specified disposition of the animal; authorizing the seizure and removal of an animal from specified property or impoundment on the property if there is probable cause to believe the animal is being mistreated; etc.

1521.title: Creation of a State Debt - Baltimore County - Little Sisters of the Poor
1521.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $500,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Little Sisters of the Poor of Baltimore, Inc. for the acquisition, repair, and capital equipping of an HVAC unit for the Little Sisters of the Poor facility, located in Catonsville; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; and providing generally for the issuance and sale of bonds evidencing the loan.

1522.title: Elevator Safety - Elevator Units in Places of Worship - Exemption from
1522.description: Requiring a State inspector to make periodic annual inspections of elevator units in any building used primarily for public religious worship that has a single level platform lift or stairway chairlift; and altering a requirement that third-party qualified elevator inspectors be hired to conduct specified periodic annual inspections required by the Safety Code.

1523.title: Health Insurance - Ambulance Service Providers - Direct Reimbursement
1523.description: Requiring health insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to reimburse an ambulance service provider directly for covered services; and providing that an ambulance service provider is entitled to direct reimbursement under specified circumstances.

1524.title: Natural Resources - Oysters - Fishery Management Plan and Sanctuaries
1524.description: Requiring the fishery management plan for oysters to include specified additional objectives and conservation and management measures and to recognize and adjust for specified factors; requiring, on or before a specified date, the Department of Natural Resources to prohibit by regulation the harvest or attempted harvest of oysters from specified waters of the State until the Department has adopted a specified fishery management plan that meets specified requirements and specified regulations; etc.

1525.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - Henson Valley Montessori
1525.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $100,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Trustees of the Henson Valley Montessori School, Inc. for the planning, design, construction, and capital equipping of the Henson Valley Montessori School, located in Upper Marlboro; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1526.title: Heating Oil - Sulfur Content
1526.description: Prohibiting, on or after July 1, 2014, a person from selling number 2 heating oil with a sulfur content exceeding 500 parts per million in the State to a consumer for end use.

1527.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters Withdrawn
1527.title: Motor Vehicle Administration - Online Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance
1527.description: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to study the feasibility and desirability of establishing an online Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance Verification System to verify the compliance of a motor vehicle owner or operator with motor vehicle liability insurance requirements and proof of security requirements; requiring the study to examine specified matters; and requiring the Administration to report its findings on or before a specified date.

1528.title: Creation of a State Debt - St. Mary's County - St. Mary's County Fairgrounds
1528.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $50,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the St. Mary's County Fair Association, Inc. for the construction, repair, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of a building on the St. Mary's Fairgrounds, located in Leonardtown; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1529.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2008 and 2009 - Montgomery County -
1529.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2008 and 2009 to alter the matching fund requirement of specified grants to include funds expended on or after January 1, 2002; and extending the deadline under specified grants to present evidence that a specified matching fund will be provided.

1530.title: City of Annapolis - Alcoholic Beverages - Renewal of Licenses
1530.description: Authorizing the Mayor, Counselor, and Aldermen of the City of Annapolis to determine a periodic basis on which payments for the renewal of alcoholic beverages licenses may be made; etc.

1531.title: Recognition of Out-of-State Same-Sex Marriages - Changes in Governmental
1531.description: Prohibiting, until the issue of the recognition by this State of same- sex marriages legally performed in other jurisdictions is decided by the Court of Appeals or addressed by the General Assembly of Maryland through the enactment of a law, a unit of State or local government from altering a specified policy, procedure, rule, or regulation on the basis of specified legal advice of the Attorney General; providing for the retroactive application of the Act; making the Act an emergency measure; etc.

1532.title: Deficit Reduction Financing Act of 2010
1532.description: Altering specified State funding requirements; repealing inflation adjustments for the calculation of specified State funding requirements; altering the calculation of specified State aid; altering the distribution of specified revenues; altering the distribution of highway user revenues for fiscal year 2011; stating the intent of the General Assembly regarding constraining spending in the fiscal 2011 State budget by implementation of specified actions; etc.

1533.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Economic Matters Withdrawn
1533.title: Electric Companies - Renewable Energy Portfolio Standard for Solar Energy
1533.description: Providing that the renewable energy portfolio standard for solar energy applies to all retail electricity delivered in the State and that the responsibility for meeting the solar renewable energy portfolio standard shall be fulfilled only by electric companies; altering the eligibility criteria for inclusion in meeting the renewable energy portfolio standard for specified energy from a specified Tier 1 source; etc.

1534.title: Electric Companies - Overhead Transmission Lines - Requirements
1534.description: Prohibiting an electric company from beginning construction on an overhead transmission line that is designed to carry a voltage in excess of 69,000 volts or exercising a right of condemnation in connection with the construction unless the electric company first meets specified conditions and has an ownership that meets specified criteria; etc.

1535.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Economic Matters Withdrawn
1535.title: Junk Dealers and Scrap Metal Processors - Required Records and Reporting
1535.description: Altering the requirements for records that specified junk dealers and scrap metal processors must keep for each acquisition of specified junk or scrap metal in the State; providing that specified provisions of law do not apply to specified transactions; providing that specified provisions of law do not preempt or supersede a county or municipal government from enacting and enforcing specified measures; providing for the applicability of the record keeping requirements; providing for the form and contents of the records; etc.

1536.title: Renewable Energy Portfolio Standard - Renewable Energy Credits - Solar Water
1536.description: Providing that energy from a specified solar water heating system is eligible for inclusion in meeting the renewable energy portfolio standard; providing that a person that owns and operates a specified solar water heating system shall receive a specified renewable energy credit under specified circumstances; requiring the total amount of energy generated and consumed by a commercial solar water heating system to be measured by a specified meter; etc.

1537.title: Firehouses - New Construction or Major Renovation - Fire Sprinkler Systems and
1537.description: Requiring a county to install a fire sprinkler system when constructing a new firehouse or conducting a major renovation of an existing firehouse; requiring a county to conduct a feasibility study on or before a specified date on the installation of fire sprinkler systems or other fire suppression systems in existing firehouses; and requiring each county and Baltimore City to report to the General Assembly on or before a specified date.

1538.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Ways and Means Withdrawn
1538.title: Baltimore City - Property Taxes - Limitation
1538.description: Limiting the rate of increase of specified property taxes in Baltimore City to a specified amount; providing for exceptions to the limitation; submitting the Act to a referendum of the legally qualified voters of Baltimore City; etc.

1539.title: Early Voting - Number of Early Voting Centers - Determination
1539.description: Requiring active and inactive voters to be included in the number of voters used to determine the number of early voting centers to be established in a county; retroactively applying the provisions of the Act to any election held after January 1, 2010; and making the Act an emergency measure.

1540.title: Real Property - Prohibition Against Entering
1540.description: Beginning on June 1, 2010, and ending on June 1, 2013, prohibiting an employee of the State or local government from entering the property located at 1104 Old Philadelphia Road; providing an exception to the Act for law enforcement officers or emergency responders acting within the scope of the person's official duties and for persons expressly invited onto the property by the owner of the property; and making the Act an emergency measure.

1541.title: Baltimore County - Use of Public School Facilities - Games of Chance
1541.description: Authorizing the use of public school facilities in Baltimore County for games of chance such as raffles and bingo that do not award cash money prizes; providing that the Act may not be construed to prohibit specified entities from charging a cash money admission fee to an event at which games of chance are played or a cash money fee in order to participate in games of chance; etc.

1542.title: State Retirement and Health Benefits Reporting Transparency Act
1542.description: Requiring the Board of Trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System to prepare quarterly reports that include information concerning the investments and the total fund balance of the several systems of the State Retirement and Pension System; requiring the Board of Trustees to prepare quarterly reports that include the market value of the assets of the several systems, compared to the market value of the assets of the several systems reported on June 30 of the previous fiscal year; etc.

1543.title: Court Costs - Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund
1543.description: Increasing a cost from $3 to $10 that the court imposes on an individual convicted of specified crimes that, in part, is deposited in the Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund; increasing to $2,000,000 the total amount of specified court costs collected from specified individuals of which half the amount collected is deposited in the Fund; and increasing to $2,000,000 the total amount of specified court costs collected from specified individuals of which the entire amount collected is deposited in the Fund.

1544.last_action: Referred House Rules and Executive Nominations
1544.title: Vehicle Laws - Driving Instructors - Licensing Qualifications
1544.description: Establishing that a person may not be licensed as a driving instructor and the Motor Vehicle Administration shall refuse to grant a driving instructor license to a person or shall suspend, revoke, or refuse to renew a person's license if the person has been convicted of, or has charges pending for, an offense that would constitute a crime for which specified registration is required.

1545.title: Courts - Jury Selection - Clerk of Circuit Court
1545.description: Requiring the jury plan of each circuit court to designate a jury commissioner that is either the clerk of the circuit court or another individual designated by the clerk of the circuit court; requiring the clerk of the circuit court to maintain the source pool list; and requiring the Administrative Office of the Courts to provide technical assistance to the clerk of the circuit court as needed to implement the jury plan.

1546.title: Creation of a State Debt - Montgomery County - Miracle League Baseball Field
1546.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $250,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Miracle League of Montgomery County Maryland, Inc. for the acquisition, planning, design, construction, and capital equipping of the Miracle League Baseball Field; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1547.title: Creation of a State Debt - Cecil County - Lower Susquehanna Heritage Greenway
1547.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $125,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Lower Susquehanna Heritage Greenway, Inc. for the construction, repair, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of the Lower Susquehanna Heritage Greenway, located in Perryville; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; etc.

1548.last_action: Referred House Rules and Executive Nominations
1548.title: Local Government - Street Lighting Equipment
1548.description: Requiring a local government to pay a specified electric company the fair market value of specified street lighting equipment as agreed on by the local government and the electric company or as awarded by a jury in a condemnation proceeding under specified circumstances; authorizing a local government to include all street lighting equipment that the local government seeks to acquire in its jurisdiction that is owned by one electric company in a single petition of condemnation under specified circumstances; etc.

1549.title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Review of Duplicative Academic Programs
1549.description: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to make specified determinations concerning specified programs approved or implemented after January 1, 2009, under specified circumstances; authorizing the Commission to take specified actions; providing that specified decisions of the Commission concerning specified duplication of academic programs are subject to judicial review in the circuit court; etc.

1550.title: Maryland Organic Transition Investment Pilot Program - Extension of Sunset
1550.description: Extending the termination date of the Maryland Organic Transition Investment Pilot Program.

1551.title: Construction and Development Projects - Expedited Approval of State Permits
1551.description: Requiring the Department of the Environment and the State Highway Administration to develop and implement processes to expedite the approval of State permits for construction and development projects that have received "fast track" or similar status from a county in the State or that will create a significant number of jobs and have a positive economic impact on the State; requiring a specified report to the General Assembly; and making the Act an emergency measure.

1552.title: Agriculture - Honey - Standards
1552.description: Requiring the Department of Agriculture to adopt regulations to establish specified standards for products sold as honey; requiring the State standards for products sold as honey to be consistent with a specified standard for honey under the Codex Alimentarius of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and the World Health Organization; and defining the term "honey".

1553.title: Frederick County - Religious Corporations - Retention of Assets by Local
1553.description: Providing that, as to any local church in Frederick County that is or formerly was affiliated with the Sunnyside United Methodist Church and that withdraws from the United Methodist Conference, specified provisions of law do not prevent the local church from retaining title to any assets controlled by the local church.

1554.title: Fire, Rescue, and Ambulance Funds - Distribution of Money to Companies Outside
1554.description: Altering the entities to which money from the Senator William H. Amoss Fire, Rescue, and Ambulance Fund may be distributed to include fire, rescue, and ambulance companies located outside the State under specified circumstances; altering the volunteer fire, rescue, and ambulance companies to which grants or loans may be awarded under the Volunteer Company Assistance Fund to include companies located outside the State under specified circumstances; and making the Act an emergency measure.

1555.title: Courts - Veterans' Treatment Court Pilot Program - Establishment
1555.description: Authorizing the establishment of a Veterans' Treatment Court Pilot Program in Wicomico County, Frederick County, and Prince George's County under specified circumstances; authorizing the Chief Judge of the Court of Appeals to accept a gift or grant for the Veterans' Treatment Court Pilot Program; and providing that a defendant charged with a nonviolent crime who is a veteran and who exhibits substance abuse or mental health problems is eligible for diversion to a veterans' treatment court.

1556.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
1556.title: Health Insurance - Coverage for Treatment of Spinal Muscular Atrophy
1556.description: Requiring insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for specified recommended hours of private duty nursing services for the treatment of spinal muscular atrophy; authorizing coverage for additional hours of private duty nursing services; etc.

1557.title: Commercial Law - Sales of Unpackaged Cigarettes - Prohibitions and Penalties
1557.description: Prohibiting specified persons from purchasing, selling, reselling, distributing, dispensing, or giving away to any person in the State specified unpackaged cigarettes; prohibiting a person from making available for use by another person a tobacco product rolling machine to produce an unpackaged cigarette; providing that a person who possesses, sells, or attempts to sell specified cigarettes is in violation of a specified provision of law; establishing penalties for a violation of specified provisions of the Act; etc.

1558.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2006 - Montgomery County - Our House
1558.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2006 to extend the date by which the Board of Directors of Our House Youth Home, Inc. must present evidence that a specified matching fund will be provided.

1559.title: Consumer Protection - Sales of Previously Sold Underwear - Prohibited
1559.description: Requiring that the sale of unpackaged underwear or an unsealed package of multiple pairs of underwear at a retail establishment be a final sale except under specified circumstances; allowing a retail establishment to accept specified underwear for return and a refund or exchange; prohibiting a retail establishment from selling underwear that has been previously sold and returned to the retail establishment; providing for the application of the Act; etc.

1560.title: Natural Resources - Crab Pots - Requirements
1560.description: Requiring, on or after June 1, 2011, new crab pots placed in the waters of the State for commercial purposes to be biodegradable or to be outfitted with a biodegradable panel designed to allow crabs and other marine organisms to escape from the crab pot if the crab pot is lost or abandoned.

1561.title: General Assembly Compensation Commission - Legislative Pension Plan
1561.description: Requiring the General Assembly Compensation Commission to establish a Legislative Pension Plan for members of the General Assembly that provides retirement benefits that are equal to retirement benefits received by State employees; and submitting this amendment to the qualified voters of the State of Maryland for their adoption or rejection.

1562.last_action: Referred House Rules and Executive Nominations
1562.title: Maryland's Health Insurance Freedom Act
1562.description: Establishing that, notwithstanding specified provisions of law, a person has the right to choose to participate in a private health insurance system or plan; establishing that, notwithstanding specified provisions of law and subject to a specified exception, a person has the right to pay for lawful medical services without interference and a penalty, tax, fee, or fine may not be imposed on a person who declines to contract for health insurance coverage or to participate in a particular health insurance system or plan; etc.

1563.title: Maryland Health Insurance Plan - Administration of National High Risk Pool
1563.description: Authorizing the Board of Directors for the Maryland Health Insurance Plan to elect for the Plan to administer a specified national high risk pool program for the State; authorizing the Board to enter into any agreements necessary for the Board to administer the program; etc.

1564.last_action: Referred House Rules and Executive Nominations
1564.title: Juvenile Law - Child Welfare and Juvenile Justice - Co-Commitment and Study
1564.description: Requiring the juvenile court in a disposition hearing to make a specified determination regarding a specified child; requiring the court to co-commit a specified child to specified agencies under specified circumstances; requiring the Department of Juvenile Services to make a specified determination under specified circumstances; requiring the departments of Juvenile Services and Human Resources to conduct specified studies and develop a plan to address the link between the child welfare and juvenile justice systems; etc.

1566.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters Withdrawn
1566.title: State Highway Administrator - County Construction Projects - Duty to Provide
1566.description: Requiring the State Highway Administrator, on receipt of a request from a county for an engineering review or approval that is required for a construction project to receive federal funding, to notify the Secretary of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation and specified representatives of railroad employees and other persons of the request; etc.

1567.title: Board of Public Works - Licenses to Dredge and Fill on State Wetlands - Working
1567.description: Authorizing the Board of Public Works to issue a license to dredge and fill on State wetlands for a development project to expand a marina that historically operated as a working marina for the sole purpose of supporting aquaculture or seafood operations or to improve navigational access; etc.

1568.last_action: Referred House Rules and Executive Nominations
1568.title: Creation of a State Debt - Baltimore County - Lavender Avenue and Harford Road
1568.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $300,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Baltimore County Revenue Authority for the construction of a parking lot at Lavender Avenue and Harford Road, located in Parkville; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1569.last_action: Referred to interim study by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1569.title: The Open Government Modernization Fund Act
1569.description: Establishing the Maryland Government Modernization Fund; requiring the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House of Delegates to administer the fund; specifying that the fund may be used only to increase the ability of the public to observe and participate in the legislative process; requiring that the balance remaining in the Lobbyist Registration Fund at the end of a fiscal year be distributed to the Maryland Government Modernization Fund; increasing the lobbyist registration fee to $250; etc.

1570.title: Maryland Estate Tax - Pilot Program for Payment Deferral for Qualified
1570.description: Providing for a specified payment deferral under specified circumstances for Maryland estate tax imposed on specified agricultural property; providing that Maryland estate tax subject to a payment deferral shall become due immediately under specified circumstances; providing that specified Maryland estate tax subject to a payment deferral shall be paid without interest in accordance with a specified schedule over a specified period; etc.

1571.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1571.title: Turkish Treatment of the Ecumenical Patriarchate and the Ecumenical Patriarch
1571.description: Urging the government of the Republic of Turkey to uphold and safeguard religious and human rights, cease discrimination against the Ecumenical Patriarch of the Orthodox Christian Church, grant the Ecumenical Patriarch appropriate recognition, ecclesiastic succession, and the right to train specified clergy, and respect specified human and property rights; and providing that a copy of the resolution be forwarded by the Department of Legislative Services to specified individuals.

1572.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1572.title: Maryland Sovereignty Under the Tenth Amendment to the Constitution of the
1572.description: Demanding that the federal government halt its practice of assuming powers and imposing mandates on the states of the United States for purposes not enumerated under the Constitution of the United States.

1573.title: Governor's Salary Commission - Salary Recommendations for Governor and
1573.description: Rejecting specified recommendations of the Governor's Salary Commission in accordance with Article II, Section 21A of the Maryland Constitution for the 4-year term of office beginning January 19, 2011, that address the salaries to be paid to the Governor and Lieutenant Governor.

1574.title: Judicial Compensation Commission - Recommendations
1574.description: Establishing the compensation of the members of the Maryland Court of Appeals, Maryland Court of Special Appeals, the circuit courts, and the District Court of Maryland.

1575.title: General Assembly Compensation Commission - Recommendations
1575.description: Rejecting items included in the Resolution of the General Assembly Compensation Commission dated January 5, 2010, and transmitted to the General Assembly on January 12, 2010, that address proposed changes to salaries for the President of the Senate, the Speaker of the House of Delegates, and members of the General Assembly, in-district travel, out-of-state travel, and the Legislative Pension Plan for members of the General Assembly; etc.

1576.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1576.title: Comprehensive Federal Clean Energy Jobs and Climate Legislation
1576.description: Requesting that the United States Congress pass and the President of the United States sign comprehensive federal clean energy jobs and climate legislation that meets specified criteria.

1577.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1577.title: Wind Power Project at Greenbury Point
1577.description: Supporting the United States Navy's consideration of a wind power project at Greenbury Point.

1578.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1578.title: Secondary Schools - Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Instruction
1578.description: Urging each county board of education and the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners to make available American Red Cross Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) instruction, the American Heart Association's Heart Saver CPR curriculum, or an equivalent program to high school students in the county or Baltimore City.

1579.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1579.title: Earth Hour
1579.description: Recognizing the hour from 8:30 p.m to 9:30 p.m. on March 27, 2010, as Earth Hour; urging Marylanders to observe Earth Hour; and urging the Governor to order that the lights in the Government House and the State Capitol complex be turned off during Earth Hour.

1580.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1580.title: Targeted Interference with Wireless Communication Service Within Correctional
1580.description: Urging the United States Congress to pass legislation allowing targeted interference with wireless communication service within correctional facilities.

1581.title: General Assembly Compensation Commission - Recommendations - Optional
1581.description: Rejecting items included in the Resolution of the General Assembly Compensation Commission dated January 5, 2010, and transmitted to the General Assembly on January 12, 2010, that address specified proposed changes to salaries for the President of the Senate, the Speaker of the House, and members of the General Assembly, as well as addressing in-district travel, out-of-state travel, and the Legislative Pension Plan for members of the General Assembly; etc.

1582.title: General Assembly Compensation Commission - Recommendations - Employees' Pension
1582.description: Rejecting items included in the Resolution of the General Assembly Compensation Commission dated January 5, 2010, and transmitted to the General Assembly on January 12, 2010, that address specified proposed changes to salaries for the President of the Senate, the Speaker of the House of Delegates, and the members of the General Assembly, as well as addressing in-district travel, out-of-state travel, and the Legislative Pension Plan for members of the General Assembly; etc.

1583.last_action: Unfavorable Report by House Rules and Executive Nominations
1583.title: Climate Change
1583.description: Urging the United States Environmental Protection Agency to immediately halt its carbon dioxide reduction policies and programs and to withdraw its endangerment finding and related regulations until a full and independent investigation of the climate change conspiracy and science can be undertaken.

1584.title: Recognition of Captain Lambert Wickes of Maryland - Revolutionary War Naval
1584.description: Recognizing the contributions of Captain Lambert Wickes to the American Revolutionary War and America's legacy of national independence and honoring Captain Wickes' service and sacrifice as a member of the Continental Navy.

1589.title: Public Safety - Task Force on SWAT Team Activation and Deployment
1589.description: Establishing a Task Force on SWAT Team Activation and Deployment; requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Control and Prevention to report to the Task Force specified analyses and summaries relating to the activation and deployment of specified SWAT teams; requiring the Task Force to annually review the report and, based on the review, to make recommendations for and annually review regulations establishing qualifications, standards, and prerequisites for a law enforcement officer assigned to a SWAT team by a law enforcement agency; etc.

1591.title: Business Regulation - State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board - Membership
1591.description: Altering the membership of the State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board to remove one consumer member and add one representative of amusement ride rental operators; and requiring that the race and gender composition of the Board reflect the composition of the population of the State.

1598.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
1598.title: Criminal Procedure - Search Warrant Application - Copy Filed with State's
1598.description: Requiring a copy of an application for a search warrant to be filed with the State's Attorney or a deputy State's Attorney designated in writing by the State's Attorney for the county in which the search warrant is to be served prior to the execution of the search warrant.

1602.title: Vehicle Laws - Manufacturers, Distributors, and Factory Branches - Benefits to
1602.description: Repealing provisions relating to a manufacturer, distributor, or factory branch providing specified benefits, payments, or gifts to an employee of a vehicle dealer; providing that an incentive payment, a reimbursement payment, cash, a gift, or a thing of value to be given by a manufacturer, distributor, or factory branch to an employee of a dealer may be given directly to the employee or to the dealer to be distributed to the employee in a specified manner; making the Act an emergency measure; etc.

1605.title: Criminal Law - Animal Cruelty - Penalties and Conditions of Sentencing
1605.description: Increasing the penalties for specified violations concerning the abuse or neglect of animals; and authorizing a court, as a condition of sentencing, to prohibit a defendant convicted of violating specified animal abuse or neglect laws from owning, possessing, or residing with an animal for the life of the defendant or for a specified period of time; etc.

1609.title: Estates and Trusts - Property Held as Tenants by the Entireties - Transfer to
1609.description: Establishing that specified property of a husband and wife that is held as tenants by the entirety and conveyed to a trustee or trustees, and the proceeds of that property, shall retain its immunity from the claims of separate creditors under specified circumstances; providing that specified property continues to have specified immunity from the claims of specified creditors after the death of a specified individual; etc.

1610.title: Maryland Constitutional Convention - Sense of the Voters
1610.description: Providing, at the general election to be held in November 2010, for the taking of the sense of the voters of the State as to the calling of a convention for altering the Maryland Constitution or for framing a new one under Article XIV, Section 2 of the Maryland Constitution.

1611.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
1611.title: Health Insurance - Benefits for In Vitro Fertilization - Donor Sperm
1611.description: Prohibiting insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from excluding benefits for expenses arising from in vitro fertilization procedures when the patient's oocytes are fertilized with donor sperm under specified circumstances.

1613.title: Department of Natural Resources - Preparation of Fishery Management Plans -
1613.description: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to prepare fishery management plans for any species of fish under specified circumstances; requiring the Department to include information relating to overfishing and sustainable harvests in a fishery management plan; etc.

1614.title: Criminal Procedure - Search Warrant - Deployment of SWAT Team
1614.description: Establishing the requirements for a search warrant to be executed in the deployment of a SWAT team; establishing that a judge may issue a search warrant to deploy a SWAT team if there is probable cause to believe a felony is being committed by a person or in a specified location; requiring an application for a search warrant to deploy a SWAT team be reviewed, signed, and sworn to by a State's Attorney; etc.

1615.title: Maryland Communities for a Lifetime Commission
1615.description: Reestablishing the Statewide Empowerment Zones for Seniors Commission as the Maryland Communities for a Lifetime Commission to continue the work of the Statewide Empowerment Zones for Seniors Commission; authorizing the Commission to consult with specified individuals and entities; requiring the Secretary of Aging to perform specified duties; requiring the Commission to be funded with federal funds; prohibiting the use of specified funding to pay any costs of the Commission; etc.

1617.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
1617.title: Natural Resources - Right to Hunt, Fish, and Harvest Wild Game
1617.description: Proposing an amendment to the Maryland Constitution that establishes the right of every person to hunt, fish, or harvest wild game, subject to State law; and submitting the amendment to the qualified voters of the State of Maryland for their adoption or rejection.

1621.title: Department of Natural Resources - Oysters - Patent Tongs and Power Dredges
1621.description: Prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from prohibiting the use of patent tongs and power dredges to catch oysters in the waters of the State; providing for the application of a specified provision of the Act; and making stylistic changes.

1622.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
1622.title: State Finance and Procurement - Maryland Environmental Service - Small Business
1622.description: Adding the Maryland Environmental Service as a designated procurement unit under the Small Business Reserve Program.

1623.title: State Government - Meetings of Governing Bodies - Actions Before Convening
1623.description: Requiring that during the time before the actual call to order or convening of business of a governing body, any expression by a member of the governing body or a member of the public shall be held consistent with the member's First Amendment right of freedom of speech.

1627.title: Public Safety - Board of Boiler Rules - Membership
1627.description: Altering the membership of the Board of Boiler Rules in the Division of Labor and Industry in the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation to include a representative of owners of agricultural, model, or historical steam engine equipment rather than a representative of owners and users of heating boilers.

1629.title: Motor Vehicles - Registration Plates - "Home of Our National Anthem"
1629.description: Requiring that registration plates for a vehicle, except for specified special registration plates, display the words "Home of Our National Anthem"; and applying the Act to registration plates manufactured on or after October 1, 2010.

1630.title: Vehicle Laws - Registration and Driver's License Renewal Fees - No Charge for
1630.description: Prohibiting the Motor Vehicle Administration from charging a recipient of the Medal of Honor a fee for the renewal of the registration of a vehicle or the renewal of a noncommercial driver's license.

1633.title: Vehicle Laws - Vehicle Approaching Emergency or Police Vehicle - Duty to Change
1633.description: Requiring drivers approaching emergency or police vehicles stopped, standing, or parked on a highway and using any visual signals, except when otherwise directed by a police officer, to vacate the lane closest to the emergency or police vehicle under specified circumstances or to reduce the speed of the vehicle to a speed that is sufficient to ensure the safety of police officers or emergency services personnel in the vicinity of the emergency or the police vehicle under specified circumstances.

1634.title: Electric Companies - Net Energy Metering
1634.description: Repealing a limitation on the period of time that a specified eligible customer-generator may accrue specified generation credit; repealing a limitation on the time that a specified electric company is required to carry forward a generation credit or a negative kilowatt-hour reading; requiring a specified electric company to carry forward a specified generation credit until specified events occur; etc.

1636.title: Department of Disabilities - Maryland Commission on Disabilities - Duties and
1636.description: Requiring the Secretary of Disabilities to request that the Interagency Disabilities Board revise the State Disabilities Plan at least once every 4 years; clarifying the duties of the members of the Commission to include serving on one or more subcommittees established by the Secretary to provide specified guidance to the Department of Disabilities on matters affecting individuals with disabilities; eliminating the Personal Assistance Services Advisory Committee; etc.

1637.title: Workers' Compensation - Average Weekly Wage - Militia
1637.description: Authorizing, for the purpose of computing the average weekly wage for workers' compensation benefits for specified members of the organized militia, the use of actual wages earned by the member in the member's civilian employment at the time of entry into State active duty.

1638.title: Business and Economic Development - Maryland Economic Adjustment Fund
1638.description: Repealing the Maryland Economic Adjustment Financing Committee; authorizing the Secretary of Business and Economic Development, or the Secretary's designee, to approve financial assistance from the Maryland Economic Adjustment Fund; altering the permissible uses of the Fund; altering specified priorities for specified loan applicants; altering requirements for information to be included on a loan application; etc.

1639.title: Business and Economic Development - Maryland Military Installation Council -
1639.description: Altering the membership of the Maryland Military Installation Council; altering the length and spacing of the terms of specified Council members; repealing a requirement that the Council issue a final report to the Governor and the General Assembly; and repealing the termination date of specified provisions of law related to the Council.

1640.title: Health Insurance - Medicare Supplement Policies - Repeal of Requirement to
1640.description: Repealing the requirement that specified carriers make available a Medicare supplement policy plan I to specified individuals if an application for a Medicare supplement policy or certificate is submitted during specified time periods; etc.

1641.title: Health Insurance - Conformity with Federal Law - Mental Health Benefits,
1641.description: Providing that it is not discriminatory, under provisions of law prohibiting specified health insurance policies, contracts, or certificates from discriminating against a person with a mental illness or an emotional, drug, or alcohol abuse disorder, if the benefits for partial hospitalization and outpatient expenses under group contracts covering employees of one or more large employers are covered in a specified manner; etc.

1642.title: Workers' Compensation - Division of Rehabilitation Services - Unpaid Work-Based
1642.description: Providing that an individual in an unpaid work-based learning experience provided by the Division of Rehabilitation Services in the State Department of Education is a covered employee for the purpose of the State workers' compensation laws; requiring a participating employer to secure workers' compensation coverage for the individual; requiring the State Department of Education to reimburse a participating employer for specified costs; etc.

1643.title: Agricultural Land Transfer Tax - Distribution and Use of Revenue
1643.description: Altering the distribution of revenues attributable to the agricultural land transfer tax; repealing a provision altering the distribution of State transfer tax revenues under specified circumstances; altering the authorized uses of specified revenues from the agricultural land transfer tax; etc.

1644.title: Commission on Environmental Justice and Sustainable Communities - Membership
1644.description: Increasing the membership of the Commission on Environmental Justice and Sustainable Communities from 15 to 20 members; providing for the inclusion of representatives from specified State agencies; and requiring that at least two of the twelve members appointed by the Governor be from affected communities concerned with environmental justice.

1645.title: Family Law - Criminal History Records Checks - Employees and Employers in
1645.description: Authorizing the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to approve other locations for specified criminal history records checks; requiring a nongovernmental agency, organization, or employer primarily serving minors and specified home health or residential service agencies that provide health services for minors to require employees and employers to obtain a specified criminal history records check; authorizing the Department to waive a specified fingerprint requirement under specified circumstances; etc.

1646.title: Maryland Horse Industry Fund - Fees
1646.description: Requiring that all funds collected by the Maryland Horse Industry Board be paid into the Maryland Horse Industry Fund; establishing a fee for a license; and altering specified fees relating to licensure renewal and inspection of horse riding stables.

1647.title: Transit-Oriented Development - Pledge and Use of Tax Increment Revenues -
1647.description: Authorizing the governing body of a political subdivision to use a specified special fund for a development district for direct payment of operation and maintenance costs for specified improvements located in or supporting a transit-oriented development or for specified payments under a specified agreement; authorizing a political subdivision that has created a specified special fund for a development district to use the fund for specified purposes; etc.

1648.title: Maryland Research and Development Tax Credit - Sunset Extension
1648.description: Extending the applicability of the Maryland Research and Development Tax Credit to taxable years beginning before January 1, 2020; and extending the termination date for the Maryland Research and Development Tax Credit to June 30, 2021.

1649.title: Maryland Veterans Trust Fund - Income Tax Checkoff
1649.description: Establishing an income tax checkoff system for voluntary contributions to the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund; requiring the net proceeds of contributions from the checkoff system to be distributed to the Fund; requiring the checkoff to meet specified requirements; requiring the Comptroller to collect and distribute checkoff contributions in a specified manner; etc.

1650.title: Vehicle Laws - Length of Vehicles - Saddle-Mount and Full-Mount Combinations
1650.description: Providing that a specified truck tractor or unloaded truck towing one or more other truck tractors or unloaded trucks in combination may not exceed 97 feet in length.

1651.title: Vehicle Laws - Issuance of Temporary Registration Plates by Dealers -
1651.description: Requiring a vehicle dealer to electronically transmit to the Motor Vehicle Administration the vehicle, owner, insurance, and temporary registration information contained on the temporary registration plate application on the same day that the dealer issues a temporary registration plate for a vehicle; and requiring a dealer who has applied for temporary registration plates to keep specified temporary registration plate records for 3 years.

1653.title: Woodland Incentives Program - Prohibition on Use of Federal Funds - Repeal
1653.description: Repealing the prohibition on the use of federal funds administered by the Woodland Incentives Program for long-range timber growing in conjunction with State funds; prohibiting an owner from receiving a total of State and federal cost share assistance in an amount that exceeds 100% of the actual cost of the approved practice; etc.

1654.title: Department of Natural Resources - Vessel Noise - Limitation
1654.description: Altering the maximum allowable noise level from 90dB(a) to 88dB(a) for a vessel on the waters of the State with an engine manufactured on or after a specified date; prohibiting a person from owning or operating a vessel in State waters unless the vessel meets specified requirements and regulations for noise suppression; and requiring the Department of Natural Resources to issue a warning for a first violation of provisions of the Act.

1655.title: Procurement - Small Business Reserve Program - Sunset Extension
1655.description: Extending the termination date for the Small Business Reserve Program to September 30, 2016.

1656.title: Maryland Militia - Membership
1656.description: Altering the composition of the Maryland militia to include citizens of the United States who take an oath of allegiance to the State.

1657.title: Maryland Emergency Management Agency - Director
1657.description: Altering provisions of law so as to require the Governor to appoint directly the Director of the Maryland Emergency Management Agency (MEMA); and requiring the Director of MEMA to be responsible to the Governor for carrying out the State emergency management program, to develop specified mutual aid agreements without specified approval, and to employ personnel in a specified manner that is not subject to a specified authority.

1658.title: Education - Comprehensive Master Plans
1658.description: Requiring a local board of education to submit updates to the local board's comprehensive master plan on or before October 15, 2010, and October 15, 2011; altering the dates by which a local board is required to submit a comprehensive master plan and an annual update; etc.

1659.title: Education - Nonpublic School Employees - Criminal Convictions
1659.description: Requiring the State Board of Education, instead of the State Department of Education, to revoke the certificate of approval or letter of tentative approval of a nonpublic school that is in violation of specified provisions of law prohibiting the employment of specified employees who have been convicted of specified crimes.

1660.title: Education - Disruptive Youth - Funding
1660.description: Repealing the requirement that the State appropriate specified funds to local education agencies for special programs for disruptive youth; and repealing specified reporting requirements relating to special programs for disruptive youth.

1661.title: Health General - Disease Prevention and Testing - Inmates of Correctional
1661.description: Adding a buccal (cheek) swab to the type of sample an inmate is required to furnish to the correctional institution to be tested for the presence of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) under specified circumstances; altering the definition of "health care provider" to include an employee's private physician; etc.

1662.title: Washington Cemetery Board of Trustees
1662.description: Abolishing the Washington Cemetery Board of Trustees; providing for the supervision of the Washington Cemetery by the Department of Veterans Affairs; etc.

1663.title: Office of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing - Responsibilities
1663.description: Altering the duties of the Office of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing to include promoting the general welfare of individuals who are deafblind; altering the name and the membership of the Maryland Advisory Council on the Deaf and Hard of Hearing to include the Secretary of Aging or the Secretary's designee and a member of the general public who is a person with special knowledge or expertise relating to services to individuals who are deafblind; etc.

1664.title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Office of Student Financial Assistance
1664.description: Revising and clarifying specified provisions of law relating to student financial assistance administered by the Office of Student Financial Assistance in the Maryland Higher Education Commission; repealing specified provisions relating to the enforcement of bonds given by scholarship recipients; authorizing rules or regulations adopted by the Office to include specified provisions relating to performance of a service obligation by a recipient of student financial assistance; etc.

1665.title: State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners - License Suspensions and
1665.description: Providing that in lieu of or in addition to suspension of the license, a maximum monetary penalty of $5,000 may be imposed by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners for a first offense; and providing that in addition to suspension or revocation of the license, the board may impose a maximum penalty of not more than $10,000 for a second or subsequent offense.

1666.title: Maryland Commercial Feed Law - Definitions - Prohibition on Sale
1666.description: Prohibiting a person from adulterating or misbranding a commercial feed, or from distributing, removing, or disposing of commercial feed in violation of a specified stop sale order, or from detaching, altering, defacing, or destroying a specified label; and altering definitions.

1667.title: Department of Housing and Community Development - Group Home Financing Program
1667.description: Authorizing the Department of Housing and Community Development to modify specified loan terms if a Program loan is at risk of being in default; authorizing the Department to finance the refinancing of an existing mortgage loan or closing costs associated with the refinance of a group home; etc.

1668.title: Tidal Fisheries Advisory Commission - Sport Fisheries Advisory Commission -
1668.description: Expanding from 12 to 15 the number of members of the Tidal Fisheries Advisory Commission; requiring that the composition of the Advisory Commission reflect the geographic regions of the State where the commercial fishing industry is operating; staggering the terms of members of the Tidal Fisheries Advisory Commission and the Sport Fisheries Advisory Commission beginning on July 1, 2010; expanding from 12 to 15 the number of members of the Sport Fisheries Advisory Commission; etc.

1669.title: Vehicle Laws - Electronic Transmission of Title Information by Dealers
1669.description: Providing that a licensed vehicle dealer transferring a vehicle may electronically transmit specified taxes, fees, and other required titling documents or data to the Motor Vehicle Administration within 30 days of the date of delivery of the vehicle; etc.

1670.title: Correctional Services - Medication for Chronic or Acute Medical Condition -
1670.description: Authorizing the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and local correctional facilities to issue medication and prescriptions under specified circumstances to inmates of a correctional facility as a component of the inmate release process; prohibiting the Department, local correctional facilities, and specified persons from being held liable for issuing medication or a prescription on an inmate's release under specified circumstances; etc.

1671.title: Education - Physical Education and Athletic Programs for Students with
1671.description: Altering the reporting date for county boards of education to report on specified requirements relating to physical education and athletic programs for students with disabilities to the State Department of Education from February 1 of each year to May 15 of each year; and altering the reporting date for the Department to issue a report relating to physical education and athletic programs for students with disabilities to the General Assembly from May 1 of each year to August 1 of each year.

1672.title: Environment - Controlled Hazardous Substance Advisory Council
1672.description: Providing that the Controlled Hazardous Substance Advisory Council is required to meet only at the request of the Secretary of the Environment; altering the membership of the Council; altering the term of a member from 6 to 10 years; repealing specified obsolete language; repealing a requirement that the Council elect a chairperson annually; and repealing a requirement that the Council determine the times and places of its meetings.

1673.title: Maryland Commission on Human Relations - Name Change
1673.description: Changing the name of the Maryland Commission on Human Relations to the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights.

1674.title: Secretary of Agriculture - Farm Quarantine
1674.description: Authorizing the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a farm quarantine and to issue appropriate orders necessary to control or restrict the use of specified farmland, crops, livestock, poultry, or farm products; requiring the Secretary to consult with the Governor, the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene, and the Secretary of the Environment before establishing a quarantine; requiring the Secretary to give specified notice of a quarantine and to provide procedures to alter or remove a quarantine; etc.

1675.title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Exempt Institutions
1675.description: Prohibiting a person from making a specified statement that an institution operating without a certificate of approval is approved by or has a certificate of approval from the Maryland Higher Education Commission; prohibiting a person from enrolling a student in an institution operating without a certificate of approval unless the person gives specified notice to the student and obtains a specified written acknowledgment from the student; requiring the written acknowledgment to be permanently retained in the student's file; etc.

1676.title: Department of Natural Resources - Boating Safety Requirements
1676.description: Altering the definition of a child so that the prohibition on a person from operating a vessel unless a child on board is wearing a personal flotation device applies based solely on the age of the child; altering the required age for a child to wear a personal flotation device from under the age of 7 to under the age of 13; requiring individuals under the age of 16 to possess a certificate of boating safety education or comply with other requirements; making the Act an emergency measure; etc.

1677.title: Agriculture - Pest Control - Fees and Registration
1677.description: Clarifying the authority of the Department of Agriculture to charge a fee for a pest control examination retaken after the initial examination; requiring a person who operates a pest control business to register annually specified employees with the Department of Agriculture; establishing specified employee registration and renewal fees; and requiring the payment of a specified late fee under specified circumstances.

1678.title: Department of Agriculture - Weights and Measures - Registration Fees
1678.description: Altering the cap on specified fees for registering specified weights and measures used for commercial purposes.

1679.title: Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation - Farmland Preservation
1679.description: Authorizing the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation to establish a Farmland Preservation Partnership Program to preserve productive agricultural and forested lands; authorizing the Foundation to form partnerships to purchase easements on specified qualifying properties; requiring the Foundation's partners to cover specified costs associated with the purchase of easements; requiring properties that qualify for the Partnership Program to meet specified criteria developed by the Foundation; etc.

1680.title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
1680.description: Adding a new division to the Public Utility Companies Article of the Annotated Code of Maryland, to be designated and known as "Division II. Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission"; revising, restating, and recodifying specified laws relating to the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including laws relating to the members and staff of the Commission and the powers and duties of the Commission; etc.

1682.title: Income Tax - Film Production Activity Credit
1682.description: Allowing a qualified film production entity to claim a credit against the State income tax for specified costs incurred for film production activities; repealing the Film Production Rebate Program; requiring the Department of Business and Economic Development to administer the credit; requiring that to be eligible for the rebate, the film production company must incur total direct costs exceeding $500,000; providing that the total direct costs may not include individual wages that exceed $1,000,000; etc.

1685.title: Public Health - Peanut Warning - Vending Machines
1685.description: Requiring the operator of a vending machine that contains a food that contains peanuts to post a warning label on the exterior of the vending machine that informs consumers that some foods contained within the vending machine may contain peanuts; etc.

1691.title: Unemployment Insurance - Tax Deferment, Trust Fund Solvency, and Cost-Neutral
1691.description: Providing for an alternative method to determine the base period for unemployment insurance purposes under specified circumstances; altering provisions relating to benefit eligibility of specified part- time workers; creating an additional training benefit for specified individuals; providing that specified training benefits may not be charged to employers; providing for the calculation and limit for the additional training benefits; altering the wage requirements for a specified claimant to be eligible for unemployment benefits; etc.

1694.title: Labor and Employment - Job and Financial Privacy Protection Act
1694.description: Prohibiting an employer from requesting a credit report from an applicant for employment or an employee unless the request has a bona fide work-related purpose or the employer is required to request the credit report under federal or State law; requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to adopt regulations specifying what is a bona fide work-related purpose; and authorizing specified civil actions under specified circumstances.

1695.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
1695.title: District Court - Locations
1695.description: Repealing a requirement that a District Court facility is required to be physically located in the Catonsville area of District 8 of the District Court.

1707.title: Criminal Procedure - Victim's Compensation - Temporary Lodging for Domestic
1707.description: Making victims of domestic violence who are eligible for an award as the result of an injury resulting from a specified domestic violence incident and who sought temporary lodging to avoid further injury eligible to receive an award from the Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund for reasonable costs of up to 14 days of temporary lodging.

1710.title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multiple Special Licenses
1710.description: Prohibiting the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue multiple special licenses at the same time to the same person; and authorizing the Board to issue a second or subsequent special license to an applicant only after the completion of the event for which the previous special license was issued.

1712.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs Withdrawn
1712.title: Education - High School Diploma - GED Options Program
1712.description: Requiring the State Board of Education to establish a GED Options Program that provides specified students with an alternative course for obtaining a high school diploma beginning August 1, 2010; providing for specified Program requirements; requiring students enrolled in the GED Options Program to be counted in the average daily attendance of a local school system; and requiring the State Board to adopt specified regulations.

1720.title: Creation of a State Debt - St. Mary's County - United States Colored Troops
1720.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $250,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Unified Committee for Afro-American Contributions, Inc. for the acquisition, planning, design, construction, and capital equipping of the United States Colored Troops Memorial Monument, located in Lexington Park; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; etc.

1721.title: Family Law - Permanency Planning and Guardianship Review Hearings -
1721.description: Requiring the juvenile court, in permanency planning and guardianship review hearings, to place on the record an age-appropriate consultation with the child at least every 12 months.

1722.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2006 - Baltimore City - Peale Museum
1722.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2006 to change the name of a specified grantee from the Board of Directors of the Baltimore City Historical Society, Inc. to the Board of Directors of the Baltimore History Center at the Peale, Inc.; extending the deadline by which the grantee may present evidence to the Board of Public Works that a matching fund will be provided; etc.

1723.title: Property Tax - Exemption for Disabled Public Health Service and NOAA Officers
1723.description: Altering the definition of "disabled veteran" for purposes of a property tax exemption for dwelling houses owned by disabled veterans or the surviving spouses of disabled veterans or individuals who died in line of duty in the active military, naval, or air service of the United States; applying the Act to tax years beginning after June 30, 2010; etc.

1735.title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B-AE (Arts and
1735.description: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue a Class B-AE (arts and entertainment) beer, wine and liquor license; specifying that the license may be issued only to an establishment in the arts and entertainment district as approved by the City Council; specifying that the license may be issued for consumption of alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises only; prohibiting a person from holding more than two licenses; providing for a $2,750 annual license fee; etc.

1736.title: Harford County - Sheriff's Office - Power to Enforce Noise Control Laws
1736.description: Authorizing the Secretary of the Environment to delegate enforcement of specified noise control provisions in Harford County to the Sheriff of Harford County, except for lawful hunting and specified trapshooting, skeetshooting, or other target shooting between specified hours.

1740.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
1740.title: Environment - Recycling - Apartment Buildings and Condominiums
1740.description: Requiring owners or managers of apartment buildings or condominiums that contain 10 or more dwelling units to provide for recycling for residents on or before October 1, 2014; requiring that the recycling required under the Act be done in accordance with specified recycling plans; providing for a civil penalty for a violation of the Act; and providing for disbursement of penalties collected under the Act to specified jurisdictions.

1742.title: Foreclosures - Unpaid Water and Sanitary Charges - Prohibition
1742.description: Prohibiting the forced sale or foreclosure of a property due to unpaid water, sewer, or other sanitary system bills; and repealing provisions rendered inconsistent with the Act.

1744.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Budget and Taxation
1744.title: Triple Tax Relief Act
1744.description: Allowing a subtraction modification under the State income tax for an individual's federal income tax liability, as reduced by specified credits; limiting the subtraction modification, for a taxpayer filing an individual return, to $500, $1,500, and $3,000 for tax years 2010, 2011, and 2012 and beyond, respectively; limiting the subtraction modification, for a taxpayer filing a joint return, to $1,000, $3,000, and $6,000 for tax years 2010, 2011, and 2012 and beyond, respectively; etc.

1751.title: Regulated Firearms - Application for Dealer's License - Record-Keeping and
1751.description: Requiring the Secretary of State Police or the Secretary's designee to disapprove an application for a State-regulated firearms dealer's license if the Secretary or designee determines that the applicant intends a specified person to participate or hold a specified interest in the management or operation of the business for which the license is sought; requiring licensed dealers to keep records of specified information; etc.

1759.title: Baltimore City - Highway User Revenues - Authorized Use
1759.description: Extending through fiscal year 2013 the authorization for Baltimore City to use local highway user revenues to pay for students' costs of discounted Maryland Transit Administration fares for eligible public school students in Baltimore City.

1760.title: Family Law - Family Day Care Homes and Child Care Centers - Inspections
1760.description: Requiring the State Department of Education to adopt regulations that provide for an announced inspection by the Department of each registered family day care home prior to issuance of a continuing registration; repealing a requirement that the Department inspect on an announced basis family day care homes and child care centers at least once every 2 years; etc.

1764.title: Business Regulation - Prepaid Mobile Phones and Prepaid Refill Cards - Retail
1764.description: Prohibiting sellers of prepaid mobile phones from selling more than three prepaid mobile phones to a person within a 24-hour period; requiring sellers at the time of sale to obtain and copy specified identification from the buyer of a prepaid mobile phone or prepaid refill card; establishing record-keeping requirements for sellers; providing that the records are not public and are confidential; authorizing State and local law enforcement officers to view the records at specified times under specified circumstances; etc.

1765.title: Health Insurance - Child Dependents - Qualifying Age Limit
1765.description: Increasing to age 30 the age limit for an individual to be considered a child dependent under policies of individual or group health insurance, contracts issued by a nonprofit health service plan, and contracts issued by a health maintenance organization.

1766.title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Drive-Through Purchase
1766.description: Prohibiting the Board of License Commissioners in Prince George's County from issuing a new alcoholic beverages license on or after July 1, 2010, for use in a drive-through purchase facility in which alcoholic beverages are sold at retail and dispensed through a door or window to purchasers in or on a motor vehicle; applying the Act prospectively; etc.

1771.title: Maryland False Claims Act
1771.description: Prohibiting specified actions constituting false claims against a governmental entity; providing specified penalties for making false claims against a governmental entity; requiring specified counsel to investigate specified violations; authorizing a person other than the governmental entity to file a civil action on behalf of the governmental entity against a person who makes a false claim against the governmental entity; providing for the procedures to be followed in a civil action; etc.

1775.title: Weapon-Free Higher Education Zones
1775.description: Prohibiting the carrying or possession of firearms, knives, and deadly weapons on the property of public institutions of higher education; providing for exceptions to this prohibition for law enforcement officers, a person hired for the purpose of guarding the institution's property, a person engaged in shooting activity for educational purposes, and a person who has a written invitation from the president of the institution to engage in a historical demonstration; etc.

1777.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Budget and Taxation
1777.title: Dorchester County - Electric Transmission Privilege Tax
1777.description: Authorizing the County Council of Dorchester County to impose a tax on the privilege of engaging in the transmission of electricity in the county using specified long distance, extra-high voltage electric transmission lines; providing that the tax is the product of multiplying the miles of specified electric transmission lines and a base rate and the voltage carrying capacity of specified electric transmission lines; authorizing the county council to set the base rate; providing for the use of the proceeds of the tax; etc.

1778.title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Pub-Brewery and Micro-Brewery
1778.description: Authorizing the State Comptroller to issue to a single applicant one Class 6 pub-brewery license or one Class 7 micro-brewery license, but not both, for a location in an enterprise zone in Dorchester County, if the applicant holds no more than three class B beer, wine and liquor licenses; and specifying that provisions of the Act do not limit the number of Class 6 pub-brewery licenses or Class 7 micro- brewery licenses that the State Comptroller may issue in Dorchester County.

1781.title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Community Emergency Response Team
1781.description: Providing a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax in the amount of $3,500 for qualifying members of a Community Emergency Response Team; providing that an individual may not qualify for the subtraction modification based on membership in a Community Emergency Response Team unless the Community Emergency Response Team maintains specified records and provides specified reports; applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2009; etc.

1782.title: Farmer's Markets - Agricultural Product Sales - Producer Mobile Farmer's Market
1782.description: Altering the definition of "food service facility" to exclude the sale of specified raw agricultural products at a farmer's market from regulation as a food service facility; prohibiting a local jurisdiction from requiring a license for the sale of raw agricultural products at a farmer's market; clarifying that a license is not required to deliver prepackaged food products; requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to establish a producer mobile farmer's market license; etc.

1785.title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Appeal of Order to Close Place
1785.description: Specifying that, in an appeal from a decision of the Board of License Commissioners of Prince George's County, the court may not stay an order of the Board to close a place of business that is licensed to sell alcoholic beverages.

1787.title: Family Education Savings Account Act - Subtraction Modification for
1787.description: Allowing a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for specified contributions to a family education savings account, subject to specified limitations; applying the Act to tax years after 2009; etc.

1793.title: Motor Vehicle Air Bags - Consumer Protection and Reporting Requirements
1793.description: Prohibiting specified acts related to the fraudulent sale or installation of motor vehicle air bags; requiring specified records to be maintained in connection with the sale or installation of motor vehicle air bags; requiring specified information to be provided or made available for inspection under specified circumstances; requiring a person who sells or installs salvaged air bags to disclose specified information to specified persons; requiring specified accident reports and forms to contain specified information; etc.

1796.title: Residential Property - Prohibited Restrictions on Exercise of Free Speech
