1796.description: Providing that, except under specified circumstances, homeowners in a common ownership community and residential tenants may not be prohibited from displaying noncommercial signs, posters, flags, or banners on their premises, peacefully assembling on their property or contacting their neighbors, engaging in constitutionally protected activity relating to an election or vote, or restricted from using common property based on protected beliefs, expression, or activities; etc.

1798.title: Notaries Public - Application - Recommendation and Approval
1798.description: Requiring the Secretary of State to review the qualifications of applicants to be notaries public; requiring the Secretary to make recommendations regarding the sufficiency of these qualifications to specified Senators; repealing the requirement that a Senator approve the application of an out-of-state individual as a notary public; etc.

1800.title: Campaign Finance - Affiliated Business Entities - Attribution of Contributions
1800.description: Requiring that campaign finance contributions by two or more business entities be attributed to one business entity if one is a wholly-owned subsidiary of another or if the business entities are owned or controlled by at least 80% of the same individuals; defining the term "business entity" to include a corporation, a general or limited partnership, a limited liability company, or a real estate investment trust; and applying the Act prospectively.

1801.title: Maryland Locksmiths Act - Exemptions - Repossession of Property
1801.description: Exempting the lawful repossession of tangible personal property from the Maryland Locksmiths Act.

1802.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
1802.title: State Government - Joint Committee on the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays
1802.description: Increasing the number of members of the Joint Committee on the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area from 10 to 14 members.

1804.title: Circuit Court Real Property Records Improvement Fund - Funding
1804.description: Increasing from $20 to $40 the surcharge on recordable instruments that the State Court Administrator is required to establish to fund the Circuit Court Real Property Records Improvement Fund.

1805.title: Tax Credits for Qualifying Employees with Disabilities - Sunset Extension
1805.description: Extending termination provisions and altering dates of applicability for specified tax credits for employers that hire qualifying individuals with disabilities.

1806.title: Oyster Sanctuaries - Authority to Designate
1806.description: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to designate the location of oyster sanctuaries in State waters by statute; prohibiting the Department from designating the location of oyster sanctuaries in State waters by regulation; and making the Act an emergency measure.

1807.title: Dorchester County - County Transfer Tax - Repeal of Sunset Provision
1807.description: Making the Dorchester County transfer tax provisions permanent by repealing the sunset provision.

1812.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
1812.title: Environment - Incinerator Permits - Conditions for Issuance
1812.description: Prohibiting the Department of the Environment from issuing a permit to construct an incinerator unless specified conditions are met; prohibiting local jurisdictions from issuing a building permit for an incinerator unless specified conditions are met; providing for the application of the Act; and providing that existing obligations or contract rights may not be impaired by the Act.

1816.title: Property Tax - Homestead Tax Credit - Extension to Second Property
1816.description: Extending the homestead property tax credit to a second dwelling under specified circumstances; and applying the Act to tax years beginning after a specified date.

1824.last_action: Favorable with Amendments Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
1824.title: Election Law - Petition Signatures
1824.description: Repealing provisions requiring an individual to sign the individual's name on a petition in a specified manner; providing that the petition signature of an individual shall be validated and counted if the identity of the individual reasonably can be determined in accordance with specified requirements; prohibiting an election authority from invalidating a petition signature under specified circumstances; requiring an individual's name on a petition to match exactly the individual's surname of registration; etc.

1827.title: Housing - Discrimination Based on Source of Income - Prohibitions
1827.description: Altering the housing policy of the State to provide for fair housing to all citizens regardless of source of income; prohibiting a person from refusing to sell or rent a dwelling to any person because of source of income; prohibiting a person from discriminating against any person in the terms, conditions, or privileges of sale or rental of a dwelling because of source of income; etc.

1833.title: Public Utilities and Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Cross-References
1833.description: Correcting specified cross-references to the Public Utility Companies Article in the Annotated Code of Maryland to reflect the renaming of the article to be the Public Utilities Article; correcting specified cross-references to Article 29 - Washington Suburban Sanitary District in the Annotated Code of Maryland to reflect the nonsubstantive revision of the article; correcting specified cross-references in the Public Utility Companies Article; and making stylistic changes.

1834.title: Health - Medical Procedures - Ultrasound Options
1834.description: Requiring physicians, under specified circumstances, to provide a pregnant woman the opportunity to view the active ultrasound image of the embryo or fetus and offer to provide the woman with a physical picture of the ultrasound image before the performance or inducement of an abortion; and requiring a physician to allow the pregnant woman to view the ultrasound image at no additional charge.

1838.title: Ethics - General Assembly - Governmental Employment
1838.description: Providing that the Joint Ethics Committee may exempt a member of the General Assembly, a filed candidate for election to the General Assembly, or a member-elect of the General Assembly from the prohibition on receiving earned income from the Executive Branch or a unit of a political subdivision of the State if the work for which the income would be received is consistent with the individual's qualifications, based on a specified evaluation by the joint committee.

1841.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
1841.title: Vehicle Laws - Disposition of Traffic Citations
1841.description: Requiring persons who receive traffic citations for offenses that are not punishable by incarceration to, within 30 days, waive the right to trial and pay the fine, request a specified hearing, or elect to stand trial; altering the traffic citations for which the District Court or a circuit court are required to issue a notice to appear; authorizing the District Court to notify the Motor Vehicle Administration of the failure of a person to comply with a citation; etc.

1842.title: Elections - Special Elections - Voting by Mail
1842.description: Authorizing special elections to be conducted by mail; applying specified provisions of law to ballots used for voting by mail; requiring the State Board to adopt regulations to govern voting by mail; requiring specified regulations to provide for specified elements regarding voting by mail; etc.

1849.title: Assisted Living Programs - Noncommercial Elevator Units - Installation and
1849.description: Authorizing the Commission of Labor and Industry to adopt regulations to authorize and regulate the installation and inspection of noncommercial elevator units in specified assisted living programs.

1857.title: Vehicle Laws - Leaving the Scene of an Accident Resulting in Death - Penalty
1857.description: Increasing to 20 years the maximum term of imprisonment for a person who was involved in a vehicular accident that resulted in the death of another person if the person left the scene of the accident in violation of a specified provision of law and knew or should have known that the accident might result in the death of another person.

1858.title: Criminal Law - Restrictions Against Possession of Firearms - Penalties
1858.description: Increasing the maximum term of imprisonment for a violation of the prohibition against a specified person possessing a specified regulated firearm; creating an exception regarding eligibility of a specified person for parole; prohibiting a person from possessing a rifle or a shotgun if the person was previously convicted of a specified crime of violence or drug-related crime; establishing penalties; etc.

1865.title: Motor Vehicle Excise Tax - Tax Credit for Electric Vehicles
1865.description: Allowing a tax credit against the motor vehicle excise tax for qualified plug-in electric drive vehicles; repealing an obsolete tax credit against the motor vehicle excise tax for qualified hybrid vehicles and electric vehicles; providing for the transfer of specified amounts from the Strategic Energy Investment Fund to the Transportation Trust Fund for specified fiscal years to offset a reduction in revenues from the vehicle excise tax credit for qualified plug-in electric drive vehicles; etc.

1874.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Budget and Taxation Withdrawn
1874.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 - Maryland Independent College
1874.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 to extend the date by which the Board of Trustees of Sojourner-Douglass College must present evidence that a matching fund will be provided to June 1, 2012.

1877.title: Elections - Permanent Absentee Ballot List
1877.description: Requiring the State Board of Elections to establish guidelines for a permanent absentee ballot list; authorizing an individual to apply for permanent absentee ballot status; requiring that an absentee ballot be sent to a voter on the permanent absentee ballot list for specified elections; requiring that a voter be removed from the permanent absentee ballot list under specified circumstances; requiring a voter that has permanent absentee ballot status to notify the local board with specified information; etc.

1881.title: Election Law - Notices to Candidates - Mailing
1881.description: Requiring the State Board of Elections or a local board of elections, if the State Board or the local board is required to mail a notice to a candidate under any provision of law, to mail the notice to a candidate's home address if the notice was not originally mailed to the candidate's home address and the notice was returned to the State Board or the local board as undeliverable.

1884.title: Unemployment Insurance - Contributions - Installment Payment Option
1884.description: Allowing specified employing units to pay to the Secretary of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation specified contributions in a specified manner during a specified period of time; requiring the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation to notify specified employing units of a specified option to pay specified contributions in a specified manner during a specified period of time; making the Act an emergency measure; etc.

1886.title: Commercial Law - Equipment Dealer Contract Act - Outdoor Power Sports Equipment
1886.description: Expanding the scope of the Equipment Dealer Contract Act to include outdoor power sports equipment.

1888.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2007 - Washington County -
1888.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2007 to remove the requirement that the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park grant and convey a specified easement.

1889.title: Public Safety - Emergency Medical Services Provider Killed in Performance of
1889.description: Requiring the Secretary of State to issue a State flag to the family of a professional or volunteer emergency medical services provider who is killed in the performance of duty; and requiring the flag to be presented to the family of the deceased by the State Senator of the legislative district in which the deceased resided or served.

1890.title: Worcester County - Liquor Control Board - Ethics
1890.description: Including the Liquor Control Board for Worcester County in the definition of "executive unit" as it relates to the Maryland Public Ethics Law to clarify that the Maryland Public Ethics Law applies to the Liquor Control Board.

1899.title: Public Ethics Laws - Elected Local Officials and Board of Education Members -
1899.description: Requiring local ethics commissions or other appropriate entities to certify to the State Ethics Commission compliance with specified provisions of law relating to elected local officials on or before a specified date each year; requiring conflict of interest and financial disclosure provisions for elected local officials enacted by a county or municipal corporation to be equivalent to or exceed requirements under specified provisions of law; etc.

1904.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Budget and Taxation Withdrawn
1904.title: Income Tax - Credit for Long-Term Care Premium
1904.description: Altering a limitation on claiming the income tax credit for eligible long-term care premiums for more than 1 year with respect to the same insured individual; applying the Act to tax years beginning after December 31, 2009; etc.

1905.title: The Delegate John Arnick Electronic Communications Traffic Safety Act of 2010
1905.description: Prohibiting a driver of a motor vehicle that is in motion from using the driver's hands to use a handheld telephone except to initiate or terminate a wireless call or to turn on or off the handheld phone; providing that a violation of the Act may be enforced only as a secondary violation; establishing penalties of $40 for a first offense and $100 for a second offense; prohibiting a driver of a school vehicle or a holder of an instructional permit or provisional driver's license from using a handheld phone while driving; etc.

1917.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
1917.title: Environment - Permits to Construct Incinerators - Limitation on Issuance near
1917.description: Prohibiting the Secretary of the Environment from issuing a permit to construct an incinerator within 1 mile of a battlefield, wildlife, or a recreational area in the National Park System; and exempting the Baltimore-Washington Parkway.

1918.title: Public Institutions of Higher Education - New Design and Substantial Exterior
1918.description: Requiring public institutions of higher education to make reasonable efforts to provide notice to communities located within 3 miles of a proposed construction site for new structures or for substantial exterior modifications to existing structures on any land owned, leased, or operated, wholly or partly, by the institution; requiring these institutions to make reasonable efforts to consult with these communities under specified circumstances; etc.

1919.title: Criminal Law - "Student Protection Act of 2010"
1919.description: Establishing penalties for the crime of sexual offense in the fourth degree between a person in a position of authority and a minor student; establishing increased penalties for a specified violation if the offender was previously convicted of a specified sexual offense; and requiring the State to comply with specified procedural rules relating to the indictment and trial of a subsequent offender under specified circumstances.

1926.title: Natural Resources - Oysters - Hearing for Poaching and Designation of
1926.description: Providing that a person who is cited for unlawfully catching oysters may have a specified license revoked under specified circumstances; establishing specified grounds for license revocation; requiring the Department of Natural Resources to hold a hearing under specified circumstances in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act; requiring the Department to revoke a person's license to catch oysters under specified circumstances; prohibiting the Department from designating a new oyster sanctuary before April 1, 2011; etc.

1927.title: Vehicle Laws - Accidents Resulting in Death - Appearance in Court for Traffic
1927.description: Requiring a person who receives a traffic citation for a violation that contributed to an accident that resulted in the death of another to comply with the notice to appear in court contained in the citation by appearance in person.

1928.title: Motor Vehicles - Limited Speed Vehicles - Requirements and Prohibitions
1928.description: Prohibiting a person from driving a specified vehicle with a limited speed capability on specified highways; prohibiting a person from driving a specified vehicle with a limited speed capability on a highway unless the vehicle displays a specified emblem; establishing standards for a specified emblem; prohibiting a motor vehicle dealer from selling a specified vehicle with a limited speed capability unless the dealer permanently affixes a specified emblem to the vehicle and informs the buyer that driving restrictions apply; etc.

1933.title: Local Correctional Facilities - Sentenced Inmates
1933.description: Reducing from 18 months to 12 months the period of time a judge may sentence an individual to a local correctional facility; etc.

1934.title: Maryland Transit Administration - Transit-Oriented Development - Expansion of
1934.description: Altering a specified definition to expand the geographic area within which a specified project could be constructed and yet qualify as a transit-oriented development.

1935.title: Prince George's County - Kettering Largo Boys & Girls Club Storage Facility
1935.description: Amending the Prince George's County - Kettering Largo Boys & Girls Club Storage Facility Loan of 2001 to extend the deadline by which the Board of Directors of Kettering Largo Boys & Girls Club may present evidence that a matching fund will be provided to June 1, 2012; requiring that the loan proceeds be encumbered by the Board or expended for specified purposes by June 1, 2012; etc.

1938.title: Corporate Income - Combined Reporting - Pension Sustainability Trust Fund
1938.description: Requiring specified corporations to compute Maryland taxable income using a specified method; requiring that, subject to specified regulation, specified groups of corporations file a combined income tax return; establishing the Pension Sustainability Trust Fund; specifying that the Trust Fund may be used only to transfer specified amounts to the General Fund for a specified purpose; applying the Act to tax years beginning after 2010; etc.

1942.title: Health Care Malpractice - Expression of Regret or Apology - Inadmissibility
1942.description: Repealing an exception to a provision of law that a specified expression of regret or apology made by a health care provider is inadmissible for specified purposes in a specified proceeding or civil action; etc.

1952.title: Department of Transportation - Repeal of Secretary's Authority to Abolish
1952.description: Repealing the authority of the Secretary of Transportation to abolish specified employee positions.

1953.title: Maryland Port Commission - Membership
1953.description: Altering the voting membership of the Maryland Port Commission by adding one member each to represent the Steamship Trade Association of Baltimore and the International Longshoremen's Association; altering the number of Commission voting members required to constitute a quorum; establishing initial staggered terms for Commission memberships created by the Act; and repealing an obsolete provision staggering the initial terms of Commission members.

1954.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs Withdrawn
1954.title: Pharmacies - Delivery of Controlled Dangerous Substances
1954.description: Requiring specified pharmacies to require an adult to sign for the delivery of a controlled dangerous substance to a residence.

1955.title: Fines for Parking Violations - Late Fees - Restrictions in Baltimore City
1955.description: Prohibiting Baltimore City from charging a person issued a citation for a parking violation who has failed either to pay the fine by a specified date or to file a notice of intent to stand trial by a specified date more than one late fee or a late fee exceeding $25.

1956.title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Notice to Foreclose Right of Redemption
1956.description: Altering specified notice provisions by requiring a holder of a certificate of sale to send specified notices by certified mail before the holder of a certificate of sale may file a complaint to foreclose the right of redemption; etc.

1957.title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Complaint to Foreclose Right of Redemption
1957.description: Authorizing the holder of a certificate of sale in Baltimore City for which there is no private purchaser to file a complaint at any time after the date of sale to foreclose all rights of redemption in abandoned property that is vacant or improved property cited as vacant and unfit for habitation on a housing or building violation notice; conforming a specified notice requirement to provisions of law establishing the types of expenses for which a holder of a certificate of sale may be reimbursed; making the Act an emergency measure; etc.

1958.title: Baltimore City - Video Lottery Facility - Local Development Council -
1958.description: Altering the membership of the local development council that would be formed if a video lottery facility is located in Baltimore City; and requiring that the local development council include one Delegate and one member of the Baltimore City Council who both represent areas where the communities surrounding the facility are located.

1959.title: Video Lottery Facilities - Local Impact Grants - Residential Parking Permit
1959.description: Adding the payment of specified costs related to parking permits for a specified parking permit area to the list of purposes for which local impact grants from the proceeds of video lottery terminals may be used; etc.

1961.title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C Licensees to Reimburse Board for
1961.description: Authorizing the Baltimore City Board of Liquor License Commissioners to collect reimbursement from a holder of a Class C special beer, wine and liquor license for costs the Board incurs while monitoring the event for which the Class C license is issued.

1962.title: Baltimore City - 46th District - Alcoholic Beverages - Issuance or Transfer of
1962.description: Prohibiting the issuance of alcoholic beverages licenses in, or the transfer of licenses into, precincts 7 through 16, inclusive, of the 25th ward in the 46th alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City; and lowering to 60% the percentage of average daily receipts derived from food sales required of specified licensed restaurants.

1964.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2007 and 2008 - Prince George's
1964.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2007 and 2008 to alter the purpose of specified grants to the Mayor and City Council of the City of Laurel; extending the deadline by which the grantee must present evidence that a matching fund will be provided; etc.

1978.title: Municipalities - Authority to Enter into Agreements with Other Municipalities
1978.description: Authorizing municipalities to enter into agreements with other municipalities for purposes that include the joint administration of the municipalities, procurement activities, the provision of municipal services, and the joint funding and management of projects that are centrally located to the municipalities.

1986.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
1986.title: Physicians - Professional Liability Insurance Coverage - Notification and
1986.description: Requiring physicians licensed to practice medicine in the State to notify patients in writing of information relating to professional liability insurance coverage; requiring that the notification be provided to a patient and signed by a patient at the time of the patient's first visit or at the first visit after the licensee's receipt of specified information and be retained by a physician as part of the physician's patient records; requiring specified physicians to post information in their place of practice; etc.

1987.title: Education - Maintenance of Effort - Penalty
1987.description: Altering the penalty provisions for a county governing body that fails to meet the maintenance of effort requirement for primary and secondary education.

1988.title: Criminal Law - Death Penalty - Evidence
1988.description: Providing that a defendant found guilty of murder in the first degree may be sentenced to death under specified circumstances in a case in which the State presents to the court or the jury fingerprint or photographic evidence; altering specified provisions of law to require that specified evidence presented by the State in a death penalty case conclusively links the defendant to the murder; etc.

1989.title: Criminal Procedure - Sexually Violent Offender in Need of Commitment
1989.description: Creating a procedure in which a person who has been convicted of or charged with a sexually violent offense and who suffers from a specified mental abnormality or personality disorder may be placed in the custody of the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene until the person meets specified criteria; etc.

1992.title: Public Health - Disposition of Remains - Armed Forces Members
1992.description: Authorizing the person designated on a United States Department of Defense Record of Emergency Data (DD Form 93) to arrange for the final disposition of the body of a member of the United States armed forces if the decedent died while serving in the United States armed forces and executed the Record of Emergency Data; and making the Act an emergency measure.

1995.title: Defense of Dwelling or Place of Business - Civil Immunity
1995.description: Providing that a person is not liable for damages for a personal injury or death of an individual who enters the person's dwelling or place of business under specified circumstances; authorizing the court to award costs and reasonable attorney's fees to a specified defendant; defining the term "person", as it is used in the Act, to not include a governmental entity; providing for the application of the Act; etc.

1996.title: Teacher Certification - Career Professionals
1996.description: Requiring the State Department of Education to establish teacher certification for career professionals in specialized fields; and requiring the Department to adopt specified regulations.

1997.title: Property Tax Credit - Replacement Home Purchased After Acquisition of Dwelling
1997.description: Altering specified limitations on an authorized property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax for specified property purchased by specified owners of specified property that is purchased for public use; etc.

2003.title: Labor and Employment - Maryland Wage and Hour Law - Criminal Penalties
2003.description: Increasing specified criminal penalties for violations of specified wage and hour laws; and establishing that every workweek for which an employer does not pay the wage required under specified law shall be considered a separate offense.

2012.title: Real Property Tax Assessments - Market Declines - Assessment Notices
2012.description: Requiring a supervisor of assessments to provide a written notice of assessment for owner-occupied residential real property in any year of the 3-year assessment cycle when the property is not valued or revalued, if the Department of Assessments and Taxation has determined that a specified market decline has occurred for homes in the county or assessment district or ward where the property is located; requiring a specified assessment notice to include specified information; etc.

2017.title: Baltimore County - Service Clubs and Fraternal Organizations - Slot Machines
2017.description: Authorizing service clubs and fraternal organizations in Baltimore County to own and operate not more than five slot machines for specified purposes and under specified circumstances.

2018.title: Sexual Offenders - Restrictions on Places of Residence and Entry onto
2018.description: Prohibiting a person who is required to register on a sexual offender registry for a term of life from residing within 2,000 feet of a public or nonpublic elementary or secondary school or a park or playground where children regularly gather; prohibiting a person who is required to register on a sexual offender registry from entering onto recreational areas where children regularly gather; etc.

2019.title: Criminal Procedure - Sexual Offenders - Tracking Device as Condition of
2019.description: Requiring a court to require specified convicted sexual offenders, as a condition of probation, to register for electronic tracking by the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; authorizing a court to specify geographic locations to which convicted sexual offenders may not travel as a condition of probation; requiring a person who has been convicted of a sexual offense for the second time or who is required to register as a sex offender for a term of life to register for electronic tracking for life with the Department; etc.

2033.title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Sales Hours
2033.description: Authorizing specified holders of off-sale alcoholic beverages licenses in Frederick County to start selling alcoholic beverages at 11 a.m. instead of 12 noon or 1 p.m. on Sundays; and allowing sales to continue until 2 a.m. on each day of the week.

2041.title: State Highway Administration - Speed Limits - Small Cities and Towns
2041.description: Authorizing the State Highway Administration to establish, for the portion of a specified State highway that is located within the boundaries of a municipal corporation with a population of not more than 1,000, a maximum speed limit that is lower than the maximum speed limit that is otherwise specified under specified provisions of law; declaring a specified policy of the State; and declaring the intent of the General Assembly.

2045.title: Criminal Law - Attempted Sexual Offense in the Third Degree - Penalties
2045.description: Prohibiting a person from attempting to commit a sexual offense in the third degree; and providing criminal penalties for a violation of the Act.

2052.title: Maryland Employment Opportunity Tax Credit
2052.description: Allowing a credit against the State income tax and insurance premium tax for specified wages paid and qualified child care or transportation expenses incurred by specified business entities with respect to qualified employment opportunity employees; providing for the calculation and use of the credit; providing for the administration of the tax credits; applying the Act to tax years after 2009; etc.

2053.title: Annual Curative Bill
2053.description: Curing previous Acts of the General Assembly with possible title defects.

2054.title: Annual Corrective Bill
2054.description: Correcting errors and omissions in the Annotated Code and in specified uncodified laws; clarifying language; correcting obsolete references; reorganizing specified provisions of the Annotated Code; ratifying specified corrections made by the publishers of the Annotated Code; providing that the Act is not intended to affect any law other than to correct technical errors; providing for the correction of specified errors and obsolete provisions by the publishers of the Annotated Code; etc.

2055.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs Withdrawn
2055.title: Private Career Schools - Definition and Regulation
2055.description: Altering the definition of private career school to include institutions of postsecondary education that furnish or offer to furnish programs, whether or not for a fee or tuition, that provide the knowledge and skills for individuals to engage in the practices of any business, trade, or occupation for personal or professional purposes; and requiring institutions of postsecondary education that become subject to regulation as private career schools to take specified actions on or before December 31, 2010.

2056.title: Possession of Visual Representation of Child Under 16 Engaged in Sexual Acts -
2056.description: Altering the definition of "offender" for purposes of inclusion on a specified offender registry to include a specified person convicted of knowingly possessing and intentionally retaining a film, videotape, photograph, or other visual representation showing an actual child under the age of 16 years engaged as a subject of sadomasochistic abuse, engaged in sexual conduct, or in a state of sexual excitement.

2057.title: Criminal Procedure - Indecent Exposure - Offender Registration
2057.description: Altering the definition of "offender" for purposes of provisions relating to a specified offender registry to include a person who is ordered by a court to register and who has been convicted of the offense of indecent exposure if the offense occurred in the presence of an individual under the age of 18 years.

2058.title: Criminal Procedure - Discharge from Commitment of Person Previously Found Not
2058.description: Authorizing a court on its own initiative or a motion of a party to hold a specified de novo hearing after receiving a report of recommendations from the Office of Administrative Hearings regarding discharge from commitment of a person previously found not criminally responsible; etc.

2063.last_action: Hearing 4/7 at 1:00 p.m. (Health and Government Operations)
2063.title: High Performance Buildings - Green Globes Program
2063.description: Requiring the membership of the Maryland Green Building Council to include specified members under specified circumstances; and altering the definition of "high performance building" to include a building that achieves a rating of at least two Green Globes according to the Green Globes Program as adopted by the Green Building Initiative.

2081.title: State Retirement and Pension System - Retiree Death Benefits
2081.description: Clarifying that specified death benefits are payable on behalf of members of specified State retirement or pension systems who die on or before the last day of the month of the retiree's effective date of retirement; requiring the Board of Trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System to pay a specified death benefit on behalf of specified retirees if the retirees die under specified circumstances; terminating the Act at the end of December 31, 2010; etc.

2087.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2087.title: Higher Education - Sergey Brin Scholarship Program
2087.description: Establishing the Sergey Brin Scholarship Program; authorizing the Maryland Higher Education Commission to make scholarship awards to specified recipients pursuing specified degrees; requiring a scholarship recipient to meet specified eligibility criteria to obtain and retain an award; requiring a recipient to meet specified criteria or else repay the State the amount of the scholarship award; etc.

2089.title: Pet Stores - Sale of Dogs Less than 9 Months of Age Prohibited
2089.description: Prohibiting a retail pet store from selling or taking specified other actions with a dog less than 9 months of age; exempting specified establishments from the requirements of the Act; establishing a specified civil penalty for a violation of the Act; and providing a specified exception to the requirements of the Act.

2091.last_action: Special Order later today (Delegate Davis) Adopted
2091.title: Injured Workers' Insurance Fund - Status, Renaming, and Study
2091.description: Renaming the Injured Workers' Insurance Fund as the Chesapeake Employers' Insurance Company; providing that employees are not subject to specified laws, regulations, or executive orders governing State compensation; providing that the Company is the successor of the Fund; authorizing the Company to trade under the name of the Fund until October 1, 2011; etc.

2095.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
2095.title: Vehicle Manufacturers - Advertising - Prohibiting Threats to Dealers
2095.description: Prohibiting a vehicle manufacturer, either directly or through an agent, employee, affiliate, or representative, from threatening a dealer with the loss of specified benefits for listing the manufacturer's invoice price for a vehicle in specified advertising if the advertisement contains a specified notice and is not in violation of the Maryland Consumer Protection Act; etc.

2097.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
2097.title: Natural Resources - No-Discharge Designation for Maryland Waters - Reports
2097.description: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to provide reports to the Governor and the General Assembly on the establishment of a no- discharge zone in all waters of the State; requiring a final report on or before December 1, 2011, that addresses the environmental impact of pollution from Type I and Type II marine sanitation devices, adequacy of pump-out facilities, enforcement recommendations, costs, and a review of federal law related to establishing a no-discharge zone.

2100.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
2100.title: Maryland Assault Weapons Ban of 2010
2100.description: Designating specified firearms as assault weapons; prohibiting with specified exceptions a person from transporting an assault weapon into the State or possessing, selling, offering to sell, transferring, or receiving an assault weapon; requiring the Handgun Roster Board to compile and maintain a roster of prohibited assault weapons; etc.

2102.title: Vehicle Laws - Special Registration Plates and Parking Placards for Dependents
2102.description: Authorizing the owner of a motor vehicle to apply to the Motor Vehicle Administration for a special disability registration number and special disability registration plates or a parking placard if a medical professional certifies that a dependent of the applicant has a disability that meets specified requirements; requiring an applicant to submit specified proof; authorizing the Administration to review the severity and permanency of the disability of a dependent of a motor vehicle owner; etc.

2106.title: Video Lottery Facility Commission - Financial Impact of Additional Games -
2106.description: Requiring the Video Lottery Facility Commission to conduct a study to assess the financial impact of offering specified games in video lottery facilities; and requiring the Commission to report to the General Assembly on or before January 1, 2011.

2110.title: Maryland Estate Tax - Unified Credit Effective Exemption Amount and Deduction
2110.description: Repealing a specified limit on the unified credit used for determining the Maryland estate tax; repealing a requirement that the Maryland estate tax be determined without regard to a specified deduction allowed under the federal estate tax; and applying the Act to decedents dying after December 31, 2009.

2112.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2112.title: Education - Development of Curriculum Content for Chess Instruction
2112.description: Authorizing the State Board of Education to develop curriculum content for a semester-long course in chess instruction; and authorizing county boards of education to implement chess instruction in specified schools.

2117.title: Property - Tax Sale - Statement of Taxes in Arrears and Notice of Sale
2117.description: Increasing the length of time before property is advertised for sale for unpaid property taxes that a collector is required to have mailed the Final Bill and Legal Notice to the person who last appears on the tax roll as owner of the property.

2118.title: Property Tax Credit - Fallen Security Guard
2118.description: Requiring the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City and the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant a property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on a dwelling that is owned by the surviving spouse of a specified fallen security guard; defining terms; applying the Act to tax years beginning after June 30, 2010; etc.

2119.title: Criminal Procedure - Postconviction Proceeding - Venue
2119.description: Altering the venue for a postconviction proceeding.

2129.last_action: Hearing 3/4 at 1:00 p.m. (Education Health and Environmental Affairs)
2129.title: Assisted Housing - Protected Actions - Extended Leases for Seniors
2129.description: Requiring an owner of an assisted project to offer a specified extended lease to a designated household if the designated household includes an individual who is at least 62 years old; etc.

2132.title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Fees
2132.description: Increasing specified 1-day alcoholic beverages license fees in Anne Arundel County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners to charge a late fee for filing a license renewal application after April 1; and authorizing the Board to charge a $200 fee and publication costs if a majority of the names on a license is changed or a majority interest in the licensed entity is transferred.

2140.title: Environment - Decabrominated Diphenyl Ether - Prohibitions
2140.description: Prohibiting, on or after specified dates, the manufacturing, leasing, selling, or distributing of specified products that contain decabrominated diphenyl ether; providing that the Act does not prohibit retailers from selling, recycling, or disposing of specified products that contain decabrominated diphenyl ether under specified circumstances; providing that the Act does not prohibit specified persons from recycling specified products that contain decabrominated diphenyl ether; etc.

2141.title: Education - Alternate Maryland School Assessment - Review
2141.description: Requiring the State Department of Education to review the Alternate Maryland School Assessment (ALT-MSA) on or before July 1, 2011; requiring the Department to survey specified teachers regarding satisfaction, or lack thereof, of the ALT-MSA, solicit recommendations, and consider courses of action as part of a specified review; etc.

2159.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2159.title: Juvenile Services - Maryland Rising Program - Volunteer Mentors
2159.description: Requiring the Maryland Rising Program in the Department of Juvenile Services to provide a volunteer mentor for each child in the State who has spent at least 30 days in a committed placement; and requiring the Department to adopt regulations to implement the Program.

2160.title: Residential Child and Youth Care Practitioners - Certification Requirement -
2160.description: Extending by 2 years the date by which an individual is required to receive a certificate by the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals to qualify as a residential child and youth care practitioner.

2161.title: Family Law - Grounds for Absolute Divorce - Time Requirements
2161.description: Altering specified grounds for divorce by reducing the amount of time required for the parties to have lived separate and apart without cohabitation.

2163.title: Criminal Law - Drug Schedules - Marijuana
2163.description: Making marijuana a Schedule II controlled dangerous substance.

2175.title: Maryland Estate Tax
2175.description: Altering a specified limit on the unified credit used for determining the Maryland estate tax; altering a specified limitation on the amount of the Maryland estate tax; and applying the Act to decedents dying after December 31, 2009.

2180.title: Maryland Prepaid College Trust - Student 2+2 Program - Out-of-County Costs
2180.description: Requiring specified prepaid college tuition contracts to allow the use of the contract benefits to pay specified tuition rates at community colleges; providing for the application of the Act; etc.

2185.title: Elections - Campaign Finance - Prohibition of Contributions and Expenditures by
2185.description: Prohibiting a business entity from making a contribution to a campaign finance entity; prohibiting a business entity from making an expenditure to support or oppose a candidate; clarifying that a business entity is not prohibited from making an expenditure to support or oppose a ballot question; and defining the term "business entity" to mean a corporation, a general or limited partnership, a limited liability corporation, or a real estate investment trust.

2188.title: College and Career Readiness Act of 2010
2188.description: Requiring specified State agencies, in consultation with institutions of higher education, to adopt a definition of college and career readiness; requiring the adoption of a common assessment and benchmarks to show progress toward college readiness; requiring strategies and curricula to be developed and implemented to ensure students are college ready and are successful in college; making specified provisions of the Act contingent on the receipt of specified funds; etc.

2190.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
2190.title: Motor Vehicle Registration - Exemption for Golf Carts Operated on Highway
2190.description: Exempting a golf cart operated on the shoulder of a highway on which the maximum posted speed limit does not exceed 35 miles per hour from registration requirements generally applicable to vehicles operated on highways in the State; etc.

2192.title: Workers' Compensation - Temporary Total Disability - Incarcerated Employees
2192.description: Providing that an employer or insurer is not liable for temporary total disability payments to a covered employee while the employee is incarcerated; providing for a specified exception; and applying the Act prospectively.

2194.title: Workers' Compensation - Jurisdiction Pending Appeal - Proposed Settlement
2194.description: Expanding the circumstances under which the Workers' Compensation Commission retains jurisdiction pending an appeal of a Commission order to include a request for approval of a proposed settlement of all or part of a claim.

2195.title: Insurers, Health Maintenance Organizations, and Managed Care Organizations -
2195.description: Requiring managed care organizations to report to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner on an annual basis on specified compensation of their officers and executives; requiring health maintenance organizations to include on an annual basis with a required rate filing made with the Commissioner a report of specified compensation of their officers and executives; etc.

2196.title: Unemployment Insurance - Filing for Benefits - Notification
2196.description: Requiring the Secretary of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation to adopt regulations regarding filing notices; providing for the content of the notices; establishing a minimum time requirement for an eligible individual to contact the Unemployment Insurance Division in specified circumstances; etc.

2200.title: Anti-Deficit and Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2010
2200.description: Increasing from 7.5% to 22.5% the minimum percentage of estimated General Fund revenues required in the Revenue Stabilization Account for purposes of determining whether the Governor is required to include a specified appropriation to the Account in the budget bill and the amount of the appropriation required; increasing from 5% to 22.5% the minimum percentage for purposes of determining the circumstances under which the Governor is authorized to transfer funds from the Account to General Fund revenues; etc.

2202.title: Criminal Procedure - Violation of Pretrial or Posttrial Release No Contact
2202.description: Authorizing a victim, a pretrial services representative, or a State's Attorney to request an expedited hearing before any District Court or circuit court judge of the county in which the case is pending if the alleged victim alleges that the defendant has violated a specified condition of pretrial or posttrial release; requiring a court to issue a bench warrant and schedule an expedited hearing under specified circumstances; requiring an expedited hearing to be held within 2 business days after the filing of a specified request; etc.

2203.title: Criminal Law - Elimination of Concurrent Sentencing for Child Sexual Offenses
2203.description: Establishing that a sentence imposed for a violation of a specified sexual offense in which the victim of the offense is a minor shall be consecutive to and not concurrent with any other sentence imposed for any crime based on the act establishing that violation.

2204.title: Correctional Services - Child Sexual Offenders - Diminution Credits and Parole
2204.description: Prohibiting the earning of diminution credits to reduce the term of confinement of an inmate who is serving a sentence in a State or local correctional facility for committing a specified sexual crime against a minor; and providing that an inmate who is serving a sentence for committing a specified sexual crime against a minor is not eligible for parole consideration and may not be granted parole at any time during the inmate's sentence.

2206.title: Crimes - Sexual Offenses Against Children - Penalties
2206.description: Increasing the maximum and mandatory minimum penalties for a person convicted of rape in the second degree of a child under the age of 13 years; and increasing the maximum and mandatory minimum penalties for a person convicted of sexual offense in the second degree against a child under the age of 13 years.

2207.title: Criminal Procedure - Child Sexual Offenders - Monitoring with Global
2207.description: Requiring that specified child sexual offenders be monitored constantly with global positioning satellite tracking technology during any periods of probation and parole; requiring that specified repeat child sexual offenders be monitored constantly with global positioning satellite tracking technology for life and pay the costs of the monitoring.

2209.title: Health Insurance - Payment and Fee Disclosure
2209.description: Requiring health insurance carriers to establish and implement a procedure for providing to an enrollee or a health care provider on behalf of an enrollee an estimate of specified payments for covered services; requiring the estimate to include specified payments and terms; requiring a carrier that uses a provider panel to provide an estimate of specified amounts, if a specified health care provider does not participate in the provider panel; requiring a carrier to provide on its website a specified explanation; etc.

2210.title: St. Mary's County - Noncertificated Public School Employees - Service Fee
2210.description: Authorizing the St. Mary's County Board of Education to negotiate with specified employee organizations for employees a reasonable service fee to be charged nonmember noncertificated employees for representing the employees in specified matters; and making the Act applicable only to specified employees hired on or after a specified date.

2212.title: Maryland Stem Cell Research Fund - Annual Report - Requirements
2212.description: Requiring the Maryland Technology Development Corporation and the Stem Cell Research Commission to include in the annual report on the Maryland Stem Cell Research Fund specified information on the number of patients treated under specified circumstances.

2214.title: Property Taxes - Homestead Property Tax Credit - Notification and Recoupment
2214.description: Requiring a specified form developed by the State Real Estate Commission to contain a specified notice; providing that under specified circumstances the homestead property tax credit may not be denied for specified real property; providing for the refund of specified property taxes paid under specified circumstances; etc.

2215.title: State Board of Dental Examiners - Dentists - Use of Dental Amalgam, Mercury,
2215.description: Requiring dentists to comply with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration Final Rule relating to the use of dental amalgam, mercury, and amalgam alloy as it relates to a dentist's treatment of the dentist's patients, including a determination of a patient's allergy status.

2218.title: Transportation - Maryland Emergency Medical System Operations Fund - Transport
2218.description: Adding reimbursement of operators of private helicopter companies for costs of emergency medical transport under specified circumstances as an authorized use of money in the Maryland Emergency Medical System Operations Fund; requiring the State Emergency Medical Services Board to adopt regulations and protocols; etc.

2223.title: Higher Education - Death of Police Officer or Firefighter - Edward T. Conroy
2223.description: Waiving the tuition for any child of a police officer or firefighter killed in the line of duty in the State; requiring the Governor to provide in the annual budget a specified amount for the Edward T. Conroy Memorial Scholarship Program under specified circumstances; requiring postsecondary institutions to allow specified students, upon acceptance, after meeting enrollment requirements, to enroll in specified programs and attend classes for credit; etc.

2225.title: Insurance - Premium Finance Companies - Acceptance of Consideration During Term
2225.description: Prohibiting an insurance producer, employee of an insurance producer, or any other person from accepting, directly or indirectly, any valuable consideration during the term of a premium finance agreement that was facilitated by the insurance producer, employee, or other person and finances premiums under a personal lines automobile insurance policy written through the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund.

2226.title: Insurance - Premium Finance Companies - Premium Finance Agreement Terms -
2226.description: Requiring a premium finance company that offers premium financing to individuals who are insured under a policy of personal lines automobile insurance written through the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund to disclose to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner specified rates, fees, and other terms and conditions applicable to the premium financing; etc.

2228.title: Insurance - Premium Finance Companies - Limitation on Referrals by Insurance
2228.description: Prohibiting, with respect to personal lines automobile insurance written through the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund, an insurance producer or an agent or employee of an insurance producer from directing or referring an insured to a premium finance company in which the insurance producer, agent, or employee has a specified beneficial interest or with which the insurance producer, agent, or employee has a specified compensation arrangement; etc.

2232.title: Transportation - Chesapeake Bay Bridge Crossing - Environmental Impact Study
2232.description: Explicitly stating the power of the Maryland Transportation Authority to conduct or coordinate a study of the environmental impact of a proposed transportation facility; requiring the Transportation Authority, in collaboration with specified other agencies, to commence the process, on or before a specified date, to conduct and complete an Environmental Impact Study for a third crossing of the Chesapeake Bay; and requiring that the Environmental Impact Study be for a span at a specified location.

2233.title: Chesapeake Bay Bridge - Inspection by Independent Entity Required
2233.description: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Authority to cause an inspection to be conducted of all elements of the superstructure and substructure of the William Preston Lane, Jr. Memorial Bridge (Chesapeake Bay Bridge) on or before December 31, 2010; requiring the Authority to retain the services of an entity independent of and not affiliated with the Authority to conduct the inspection; requiring the Authority to mandate that the entity conducting the inspection use the most exacting technology available; etc.

2234.title: Maryland Transportation Authority - Proposed Toll or Fee Charges - Public
2234.description: Requiring specified staff of the Maryland Transportation Authority to submit a specified report to the members of the Authority, make the report available to the public in a specified manner at a specified time, and make specified comments available to the members of the Authority on request.

2248.title: Environment - Dental Radiation Machines - Inspections
2248.description: Requiring a State inspector to provide a dental office or dental facility a specified written notice under specified circumstances; and prohibiting the Department of the Environment from imposing a fine on a dental office or dental facility for a specified violation under specified circumstances.

2255.title: Anne Arundel County - Drug-Free Zones Pilot Program - Public Parks and
2255.description: Prohibiting a person in Anne Arundel County from manufacturing, distributing, dispensing, or possessing with intent to distribute a controlled dangerous substance in violation of a specified provision, or conspiring to commit the offenses, in a public park or recreation area; establishing penalties for a violation of the Act; establishing that a specified mandatory minimum penalty may not be suspended; establishing the ineligibility for parole for a specified person except under specified circumstances; etc.

2258.title: Robert Kittleman Scholarship Reform Act
2258.description: Repealing specified laws relating to senatorial and delegate scholarships.

2259.title: Unemployment Insurance - Exemption from Covered Employment - Small Business
2259.description: Providing that work performed by an officer or director of a specified corporation or a member of a specified limited liability company under specified circumstances is not covered employment for purposes of unemployment insurance; etc.

2264.title: Criminal Law - Simulated Census Documents - Prohibition
2264.description: Prohibiting a person from using, sending, or delivering to another a document that simulates an official letter, survey, or questionnaire relating to the decennial census of the United States or implies a specified association with certain government entities for a specified purpose; prohibiting a person from using a logo, seal, insignia, envelope, or other form that simulates specified identifying information of any governmental unit; providing specified penalties for violations of the Act; etc.

2265.last_action: Hearing 3/11 at 1:00 p.m. (Education Health and Environmental Affairs)
2265.title: Public Funding and Small Donor Act for General Assembly Elections
2265.description: Creating a public financing system for General Assembly candidates; repealing the Public Financing Act for gubernatorial candidates; altering limits on contributions and transfers, as specified; providing that specified contributions be considered as being made by one contributor; authorizing the governing body of a county to enact laws to regulate public campaign finance activity for county elective offices and candidates for those offices, as specified; specifying expenditure limits for participating candidates; etc.

2266.title: Maryland Health System Act of 2010
2266.description: Establishing the Maryland Health System; requiring the Health System to provide health care services to all residents of the State under a single system that is not dependent on employment; authorizing a member of the Health System to choose any participating health care provider; requiring the Health System to reimburse a member who receives health care services from an out-of-state health care provider under specified circumstances; etc.

2286.title: Tuition Cap and College Opportunity Act of 2010
2286.description: Requiring the State to provide General Fund support for the University System of Maryland and Morgan State University to achieve 100% of the Maryland Higher Education Commission funding guidelines by 2021; providing for a phase-in of increased General Fund support for the University System of Maryland and Morgan State University; establishing a Tuition Stabilization Trust Account; limiting in-State tuition increases; etc.

2287.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
2287.title: Tobacco-Related Products - Distribution to Minors
2287.description: Prohibiting the distribution of tobacco-related products to minors; requiring specified persons to inspect a customer's driver's license before distributing specified tobacco-related products; repealing specified prohibitions, procedures, and dispositions relating to the possession or use of tobacco products by minors rendered inconsistent with the Act; etc.

2290.title: Mental Hygiene Administration - Placement of Individuals with Mental Illness -
2290.description: Requiring the Mental Hygiene Administration and the Office of the Attorney General, in consultation with interested stakeholders, to conduct a specified evaluation, make a specified report, and develop specified plans; requiring the Mental Hygiene Administration and the Office of the Attorney General to provide a specified report to the Governor and General Assembly on or before January 1, 2011; etc.

2292.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs Withdrawn
2292.title: Maryland Higher Education Business Coalition and Fund
2292.description: Establishing the Maryland Higher Education Business Coalition and the Maryland Higher Education Business Coalition Fund for specified purposes; providing for the uses and administration of the Fund; and requiring a specified audit of the Fund.

2293.title: State Retirement and Pension System - Disability Retirement Application -
2293.description: Authorizing a surviving beneficiary to submit an application for disability retirement under specified circumstances; requiring the Board of Trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System to accept an application for disability retirement from a surviving beneficiary under specified circumstances; requiring the medical board to review a specified application to make a determination under specified circumstances; etc.

2294.title: Elections - New Political Party - Petition Signatures
2294.description: Reducing the number of signatures required to be included in a petition to form a new political party from 10,000 to 5,000.

2295.title: Election Law - Qualification of Voters - Proof of Identity
2295.description: Requiring an election judge to establish a voter's identity and verify the voter's address if the voter seeks to vote a regular ballot; requiring an election judge to qualify a voter by requesting the voter to present a current and valid government-issued photo identification; requiring an election judge to authorize an individual to vote a regular ballot; allowing a voter who is unable to present a specified form of identification to vote by provisional ballot under specified circumstances; etc.

2296.title: Maryland Taxpayer Protection Act
2296.description: Proposing an addition to the Maryland Constitution to require the approval of three-fifths of the members elected to each House of the General Assembly to pass legislation to increase the rate of an existing tax or to impose a tax on an individual or entity not subject to the tax at the time of consideration of the legislation; and submitting this amendment to the qualified voters of the State of Maryland for their adoption or rejection.

2298.title: Family Law - Grounds for Divorce - Separation
2298.description: Altering the grounds for absolute divorce by authorizing a court to decree an absolute divorce on the grounds of separation if either party has filed an application for divorce, 12 months have passed since the filing, and there is no reasonable expectation of reconciliation; and repealing the 2-year separation when the parties have lived separate and apart without interruption as grounds for absolute divorce.

2300.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs Withdrawn
2300.title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Bottle Club Registrations
2300.description: Prohibiting the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City under specified conditions from approving an application for the registration of an establishment used as a bottle club; allowing a person to renew or extend the registration of a specified establishment used as a bottle club; and making the registration of a bottle club nontransferable.

2306.title: Public Service Commission - Proceedings and Orders
2306.description: Authorizing the Public Service Commission to conduct a specified proceeding for the purpose of issuing an order that affects more than one public service company; requiring the Commission to provide specified notice of a specified proceeding; requiring the notice to contain specified information; requiring the Commission to provide an affected person with an opportunity to explain why a specified proceeding should not be conducted; etc.

2308.title: Property Taxes - Assessments and Appeals - Expansion of Property Owner's Bill
2308.description: Requiring the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to hold specified public education sessions; requiring specified valuation records to be included in specified notices; altering the circumstances under which the Department provides specified worksheets and cards; altering the number of days in which an assessment notice may be appealed; providing that property owners have the right to record specified property tax assessment appeal hearings under specified circumstances; etc.

2310.title: Cecil County - Collective Bargaining - Representation of Deputy Sheriffs
2310.description: Authorizing the representatives of specified full-time sworn law enforcement deputy sheriffs in Cecil County to bargain collectively with the Sheriff and the County Commissioners of Cecil County on specified issues; authorizing sworn law enforcement deputy sheriffs to take or refrain from taking specified actions in connection with labor organizations with regard to specified collective bargaining activities; etc.

2317.title: Cecil County - Budget and Taxes
2317.description: Repealing a requirement that a specified public notice contain a copy of the proposed budget of Cecil County; requiring that a specified public notice indicate that the proposed budget of Cecil County will be available on the County website and shall be reproduced and made available to the public on request; repealing a specified provision relating to when specified taxes are in arrears and when specified interest shall be charged and collected; etc.

2319.title: Consumer Protection - Lifetime Warranties on Consumer Goods
2319.description: Providing that a manufacturer of a consumer good is liable to a consumer for the fulfillment of a lifetime warranty by the manufacturer on the consumer good under specified circumstances; and providing that a violation of the Act is an unfair or deceptive trade practice under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act and is subject to specified enforcement and penalty provisions.

2321.title: Creation of a State Debt - Montgomery County - Sandy Spring Museum Capacity
2321.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $140,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Trustees of the Sandy Spring Museum, located in Sandy Spring; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

2322.title: Education - Public Charter School Facilities - Financing
2322.description: Establishing the Public Charter School Facilities Debt Reserve Fund for specified purposes; providing for the uses and administration of the Fund; requiring the State Board of Education to adopt specified regulations; requiring the State Department of Education to examine and provide a report on the feasibility of and the mechanism for providing per-pupil facilities aid for public charter schools; etc.

2325.title: Charter Schools - Certificated Professional Employees - Exemption from
2325.description: Exempting charter schools and certificated professional employees of charter schools from provisions of law and regulation that govern other public schools and other public school employees under specified circumstances; authorizing these employees to be represented by the existing employee organization, or to form their own employee organization, for the purpose of collective bargaining; etc.

2326.title: Correctional Services - First Degree Murder - Minimum Sentence
2326.description: Requiring that a person convicted of murder in the first degree serve a minimum term of 25 years before being eligible for parole consideration; prohibiting the deduction in advance from a term of confinement of an inmate who has been convicted of murder in the first degree until the inmate has served a minimum term of 25 years; etc.

2327.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
2327.title: Criminal Law - Handguns - Transport in Motor Vehicle by Nonresident
2327.description: Establishing that a nonresident may transport an unloaded handgun in a motor vehicle only for specified purposes and uses allowed under law and only if the nonresident complies with specified requirements; etc.

2328.title: Commercial Law - Unfair or Deceptive Trade Practices - Disclosure of Prior
2328.description: Requiring a vehicle dealer who is required by law to make a specified disclosure to consumers regarding the prior use of a vehicle to make a reasonable inquiry about whether the vehicle formerly was used other than for specified purposes; requiring a dealer to disclose that the prior use of a vehicle is unknown under specified circumstances; establishing that a dealer may comply with the requirements of the Act by providing the consumer with a specified vehicle history report; etc.

2329.title: Health Insurance - Ambulance Service Providers - Assignment of Benefits
2329.description: Requiring health insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to reimburse an ambulance service provider directly for covered services under specified circumstances; providing that an ambulance service provider is entitled to direct reimbursement under specified circumstances; providing that an insured, a subscriber, or an enrollee of specified health insurance carriers may not be liable to specified ambulance service providers for specified services under specified circumstances; etc.

2330.title: Dorchester County - Land Acquisition - Approval Required
2330.description: Prohibiting the State from acquiring land for open space purposes in Dorchester County unless the County Council of Dorchester County approves the purchase.

2339.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
2339.title: Correctional Services - Diminution Credits - Limitations
2339.description: Providing that a specified provision of law limiting a specified deduction from a term of confinement that can be earned applies to a single sentence as well as a consecutive or concurrent sentence; providing that an inmate may not receive diminution credits for manifesting satisfactory progress in a vocational, educational, or training course in a calendar month if the inmate has already received a specified number of diminution credits for manifesting satisfactory performance of assigned work tasks for the same calendar month; etc.

2341.last_action: Recommit to Committee Judicial Proceedings (Senator Brochin)
2341.title: Crimes - Child Neglect - Penalties
2341.description: Prohibiting a parent or other person who has permanent or temporary care or custody or responsibility for supervision of a minor from neglecting the minor in a manner that causes substantial risk of physical injury to the minor, mental injury to the minor, or substantial risk of mental injury to the minor; providing penalties for a violation of the Act; providing for specified affirmative defenses, etc.

2347.title: Commercial Law - Sale of Cigarettes - Cost
2347.description: Altering the definitions of "basic cost of cigarettes" and "cost to the wholesaler" in the Cigarette Sales Below Cost Act.

2352.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
2352.title: Civil Actions - Health Care Malpractice Claims - Attesting Expert Report
2352.description: Establishing that discovery in a health care malpractice claim is available on the basis of a report of an attesting expert; specifying the contents of a specified report of an attesting expert under specified circumstances; providing that specified reports are not admissible into evidence in a hearing or a trial for a health care malpractice claim; allowing the assertion of specified claims and defenses; and authorizing an extension of time for filing a specified certificate or report under specified circumstances.

2357.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Budget and Taxation
2357.title: Corporate Income Tax - Repeal
2357.description: Repealing the State income tax on corporations; and terminating the Act at the end of December 31, 2013.

2367.title: Financial Crimes - Seizure and Forfeiture of Property
2367.description: Establishing seizure and forfeiture procedures for property obtained through or used in connection with specified financial crimes; establishing conditions that would exclude specified property from forfeiture; establishing how specified property subject to forfeiture may be seized, with exceptions; establishing circumstances that must be considered when determining whether to seize specified property; establishing a deadline for filing a complaint seeking forfeiture; etc.

2370.title: Public Schools - State Aid for School Construction - Planning and Design Costs
2370.description: Requiring the Board of Public Works to include the cost of planning and design as an approved public school construction or capital improvement cost; requiring the Board of Public Works, at the recommendation of the Interagency Committee on School Construction, to adopt specified regulations; providing for the termination of the Act; etc.

2371.title: Financial Institutions - Mortgage Lenders - Net Worth Requirements
2371.description: Establishing that for purposes of satisfying specified minimum net worth requirements, in addition to computing the net worth of a specified applicant for a new mortgage broker's license or for the renewal of a license according to generally accepted accounting principles, net worth may be computed according to any other recognized comprehensive basis of accounting approved by the Commissioner of Financial Regulation.

2374.title: Maryland Estate Tax - Exclusions for Family Farms Subject to Agricultural
2374.description: Altering the determination of the Maryland estate tax under specified circumstances to exclude from the value of the gross estate the value of qualified agricultural property subject to specified agricultural preservation easements; requiring a phased-in implementation of the exclusion for qualified agricultural property subject to specified agricultural preservation easements; etc.

2375.title: Procurement - Multi-Year Contracts for Renewable Energy - Termination Clauses
2375.description: Authorizing, on the recommendation of the Secretary of General Services, the Board of Public Works to waive a requirement to include an automatic termination clause in specified multi-year contracts for the procurement of energy generated from specified renewable sources; and requiring the Board to consider a specified factor in determining whether to grant a specified waiver.

2378.title: Unemployment Insurance - Exemption from Covered Employment - Passenger Motor
2378.description: Providing that work performed by a passenger motor vehicle driver under specified circumstances is not covered employment for the purposes of unemployment insurance.

2381.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
2381.title: Blue Ribbon Commission on Alzheimer's Disease and Related Disorders
2381.description: Establishing a Blue Ribbon Commission on Alzheimer's Disease and Related Disorders; providing for the membership of the Commission; requiring the Commission to examine specified population data, survey specified research, and assess existing services, resources, and capacity regarding Alzheimer's disease and related disorders; requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before September 30, 2012; etc.

2384.title: Common Ownership Communities - Fidelity Insurance - Exemption
2384.description: Limiting the applicability of a specified requirement that the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation, a condominium, or a homeowners association purchase fidelity insurance by exempting the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation, condominium, or homeowners association containing a specified number or fewer of units, or lot owners, and with less than a specified amount of common charges, assessments, or fees.

2387.title: Sewage Sludge Utilization Permits - Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays
2387.description: Applying specified standing requirements, legal processes for judicial review of environmental permits, and a specified prohibition against contested case hearings to specified sewage sludge utilization permits issued for land in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area.

2388.title: Ratepayer Relief Act of 2010
2388.description: Prohibiting an electricity supplier from recovering specified costs incurred in complying with the renewable energy portfolio standard, including costs resulting from specified compliance fees and from connecting wind-powered electric generation facilities to the grid; repealing a specified provision authorizing the recovery of specified compliance fees under specified conditions; and repealing a specified provision related to the waiver of the ability to recover specified compliance fees.

2390.title: Budget - Reductions of Appropriations
2390.description: Altering the maximum reduction that the Governor can make to an appropriation in the State budget from 25% to 10% of the appropriation; requiring the Governor to present proposed reductions to the budget committees of the General Assembly at least 1 week before seeking approval of the Board of Public Works; etc.

2391.title: Electricity Market - Goal of the State - Best Possible Price for Ratepayers
2391.description: Providing that, on and after July 1, 2010, the goal of the State is to return as soon as possible to a regulated electricity market for specified customer classes that results in a reliable electricity system at the best possible price for those ratepayers; providing that the purpose of a specified statute that establishes customer choice, competitive retail electricity markets, and deregulation of generation of electricity remains in effect only until the end of June 30, 2010; etc.

2393.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
