2393.title: Natural Resources - Designation of Oyster Sanctuaries - Prohibition
2393.description: Prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from designating a new oyster sanctuary in State waters before October 1, 2011; making the Act an emergency measure; and providing for the termination of the Act.

2396.title: End of Life Health Care Disclosure Act
2396.description: Requiring specified health care facilities to provide specified information concerning the right to make decisions about health care, request a copy of existing advance directives under specified circumstances, and inform specified individuals or proxy decision makers about facility procedures; requiring a health care facility to disclose the facility's policy on honoring advance directive provisions in a specified manner; etc.

2397.title: Maryland Communities for a Lifetime Act
2397.description: Establishing the Maryland Communities for a Lifetime Program within the Department of Aging; altering the membership of the Interagency Committee on Aging Services; requiring the Interagency Committee to plan for assisting Communities for a Lifetime annually; altering the composition of local interagency committees; etc.

2408.title: Sales and Use Tax - Online Sales Presumption
2408.description: Providing that for purposes of the definition of "engage in the business of an out-of-state vendor" under the sales and use tax law a seller shall be presumed under specified circumstances to have an agent, canvasser, representative, salesman, or solicitor operating in the State for the purpose of selling or taking orders; providing that the presumption may be rebutted by specified proof; etc.

2409.title: General Assembly - Start of Legislative Session and Presentation of Budget
2409.description: Proposing an amendment to the Maryland Constitution to require the General Assembly to meet on a day each year and for purposes, as specified, and then to recess for a period; altering the date for the commencement of the annual regular session of the General Assembly; altering the date on which the Governor shall present the annual Budget to the General Assembly after the commencement of the regular session; and submitting this amendment to the qualified voters of the State of Maryland for their adoption or rejection.

2410.title: State Finance - Presentation of Bills by Governor to the General Assembly and
2410.description: Altering the date by which the Governor shall present specified bond or revenue bills to the General Assembly after the commencement of the regular session; altering the date by which the Board of Public Works shall certify specified State tax rates on specified property to county governing bodies; and making the Act contingent on the passage and ratification of a specified constitutional amendment.

2411.title: Motor Fuel Tax - Index
2411.description: Providing for specified increases or decreases in the motor fuel tax rates for motor fuel other than aviation fuel under specified circumstances for specified periods; requiring the Comptroller to make specified determinations as to the average wholesale price per gallon of motor fuel; etc.

2412.title: Special Taxing Districts - Transportation Improvements - Exemption from County
2412.description: Exempting specified ad valorem and special taxes imposed only within a special taxing district for the purpose of financing the cost of State and county transportation improvements from county tax limitations; authorizing a county to issue, by law, specified bonds for specified infrastructure improvements; etc.

2413.title: Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment of Retirees - Retired
2413.description: Requiring that retired higher education faculty of the Teachers' Retirement System or Teachers' Pension System are subject to an earnings limitation based on specified final compensation, not including specified additional earnings, if they are reemployed by their former employer.

2416.title: Maryland Community Enhancement Transit-Oriented Development Fund
2416.description: Establishing the Maryland Community Enhancement Transit-Oriented Development Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund for specified purposes; providing for the contents and uses of the Fund; requiring that a portion of revenues from projects and other money, as specified, be paid into the Fund; requiring the Comptroller to pay specified money from the Fund to specified local governing bodies; authorizing local governing bodies to use or make awards of money received from the Fund for specified purposes; etc.

2419.title: Equity in State Aid to Counties Act of 2010
2419.description: Altering the calculation of specified distributions to counties based on per capita yield of county income taxes; altering the definition of "net taxable income" in the calculation of specified State aid for education by changing a specified date; etc.

2420.title: Education - Students Arrested for Reportable Offenses - Attending School or
2420.description: Requiring a local school superintendent and a school principal to consider prohibiting a student who is arrested for a reportable offense involving rape or a sexual offense from attending the same school or riding on the same school bus as the alleged victim under specified circumstances; prohibiting a student who is convicted of or adjudicated delinquent for a reportable offense involving rape or a sexual offense from attending the same school or riding the same school bus as the victim; etc.

2421.title: Utility Consumer Protection Act of 2010
2421.description: Prohibiting an electric company from passing on to customers costs associated with outreach, marketing, or otherwise publicizing customer choice in electric supply.

2422.title: Maryland Veterans - Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder - Death Benefits
2422.description: Providing that surviving beneficiaries of deceased veterans who are residents of Maryland and whose deaths are directly connected to post-traumatic stress disorder relating to service in the Afghanistan or Iraq conflict are entitled to specified death benefits.

2426.title: Regulated Firearms - License Issued by Another State to Current or Former
2426.description: Specifying that a license issued by another state to an individual who is a current or former member of the armed forces of the United States to carry a regulated firearm, including a concealed regulated firearm, is valid in Maryland.

2427.title: Prevailing Wage Rate - Public School Construction - Moratorium
2427.description: Placing a moratorium for a specified period of time on the application of the prevailing wage rate law to the construction of specified schools by or for specified public bodies in the State.

2428.last_action: Referred to interim study by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2428.title: State Procurement - Employment of Unauthorized Aliens and the Federal E-Verify
2428.description: Requiring an employer under a State procurement contract or State grant to verify through the E-verify program the employment eligibility of each employee hired under the contract; prohibiting an employer under a State procurement contract or State grant from knowingly hiring an alien who does not have the right to work in the United States; etc.

2430.title: State Government - Notary Public - Appointment
2430.description: Repealing a provision of law requiring a notary public applicant to receive approval from a specified State Senator; repealing a provision of law requiring an individual appointed as a notary public to be a resident of the senatorial district from which the individual is appointed; requiring a notary public applicant to receive approval from the Secretary of State; etc.

2431.title: Hunting Licenses - Exemption for Disabled Armed Forces Members
2431.description: Creating an exemption from the requirement to obtain a hunting license under specified circumstances for a person who serves in the armed forces and has a service-connected disability; providing that the exemption applies only to hunting on private property; and requiring a person who hunts under the exemption to possess valid military identification.

2432.title: Real Property - Recordation of Instruments and Foreclosure Procedures on
2432.description: Limiting specified recordation requirements for a mortgage, deed of trust, or other instrument securing a mortgage loan on residential property to owner-occupied residential property; limiting specified foreclosure procedures for residential property to owner-occupied residential property; and providing for the prospective application of the Act.

2433.title: Procurement - Minority Business Enterprise Program - Report
2433.description: Requiring a specified report to include specified information on all procurement contracts awarded by the State to minority business enterprises, including a description of the contract and specified additional information; and requiring a specified report to include information about certified minority business enterprises that participated as prime contractors or subcontractors on specified procurement contracts.

2435.title: Maryland Health Improvement and Disease Prevention Act
2435.description: Establishing a Blue Ribbon Commission on Health Improvement and Disease Prevention; providing for the membership, purpose, chair, staff, and reimbursement of the Commission; requiring the Commission to consider and make recommendations on specified incentives; requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly; etc.

2437.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Judicial Proceedings Withdrawn
2437.title: Landlord and Tenant - Stay of Eviction - Reasons for Nonpayment Beyond Tenant's
2437.description: Authorizing a judge, in an action for repossession of residential premises for failure to pay rent, to extend the time for the surrender of the premises for up to 30 days after the trial if the employer of the tenant who is the major wage earner certifies that the tenant was laid off or furloughed for reasons beyond the tenant's control; and authorizing an administrative judge of any district to stay the execution of a warrant of restitution of a residential property for up to 30 days under specified circumstances.

2446.title: Public Pension Fund Protection Act
2446.description: Prohibiting a fiduciary, an investment manager, a placement agent, or an actuary for the State Retirement and Pension System from contacting the Board of Trustees or any employee of the State Retirement Agency within 2 years after leaving that position with the intent to initiate specified actions; requiring the Board of Trustees to adopt regulations to require the disclosure of payments to placement agents with regard to the investment of the assets of the State Retirement and Pension System; etc.

2447.title: Credit Regulation - Loans Secured by Residential Real Property - Late or
2447.description: Requiring all payments or portions of payments made on a specified consumer loan during a grace period to be credited to principal and interest due on the scheduled payment; prohibiting a late or delinquency charge from being charged on a specified consumer loan unless a scheduled payment is not paid in full during the grace period; altering the contents of a notice of intent to foreclose on residential property; etc.

2457.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2007 - Charles County - Old Waldorf
2457.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2007 to permit the Board of Directors of the Friends of Old Waldorf School Foundation, Inc. to include funds expended on or after January 1, 2002, in the matching fund; extending the deadline by which the grantee must present evidence that a matching fund will be provided; etc.

2458.title: Judgeships - Circuit Courts and District Court - Creation in Areas of Greatest
2458.description: Increasing the number of circuit court judgeships in Baltimore City and in Baltimore, Montgomery, and Prince George's counties; and increasing the number of District Court judgeships in Baltimore City and in Charles, Harford, Montgomery, Prince George's, and Washington counties.

2459.title: Criminal Procedure - Sexual Offender Registry - Written Notice of New
2459.description: Requiring a sexual offender registrant who establishes specified new electronic identity information to provide written notice to the sexual offender registry within 3 days; prohibiting a registrant from knowingly failing to provide a specified notice as required under the Act; and providing criminal penalties for a violation of the Act.

2460.title: St. Mary's County - Certificated Public School Employees - Service or
2460.description: Authorizing the St. Mary's County Board of Education to negotiate with the employee organization designated as the exclusive representative for a unit of specified certificated employees as to a service or representation fee for representing nonmember certificated employees in the unit in specified matters; and making the Act applicable only to employees hired on or after July 1, 2010.

2461.title: Property Tax Assessments - Exterior Physical Inspection of Property - Waiver
2461.description: Authorizing a waiver, under specified circumstances, of the requirement that all real property be valued based on an exterior physical inspection during every 3-year cycle; providing for assessments based on any available resources without doing an exterior physical inspection during the period of any waiver; etc.

2463.title: Public Safety - Pool Personnel - Regulation (Connor's Law)
2463.description: Requiring the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene to adopt regulations requiring the owners of specified types of swimming pools to have on the premises when the pool is in operation one lifeguard and one adult who holds current certificates in specified first aid training.

2464.title: Department of Juvenile Services - Redirection Pilot Program and Plan
2464.description: Establishing the Redirection Pilot Program in the Department of Juvenile Services; providing for the purpose of the Pilot Program; requiring the Department to use an appropriate assessment tool to determine eligibility for specified services for children; requiring the Department to seek approval from the juvenile court in specified circumstances; requiring the Department to establish an advisory council; etc.

2479.title: Employees' Retirement and Pension Systems - Employer Contributions - Baltimore
2479.description: Requiring Baltimore City to pay the employer contributions for employees of the Baltimore City Sheriff's Department who are members of the Employees' Retirement System or Employees' Pension System.

2484.title: Title Insurers - Required Reserves, Capital Stock, and Surplus
2484.description: Requiring a title insurer domiciled in the State to have and maintain a specified paid-in capital stock with a fixed nominal or par value in a specified amount as of specified dates; altering a specified percentage of risk premiums for title insurance that specified title insurers must originally assign to specified reserves; altering the dates as of which specified reserves shall be calculated in a specified manner; altering the portions and timing of release of specified excess reserves; etc.

2486.title: State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program - Attorney
2486.description: Authorizing specified employees and retirees of the Attorney Grievance Commission and the Client Protection Fund of the Bar of Maryland to enroll and participate in specified benefit options under the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program under specified circumstances; requiring the Attorney Grievance Commission and the Client Protection Fund of the Bar of Maryland to make specified payments to the State for specified costs; etc.

2488.title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class A Off-Sale License Quota
2488.description: Prohibiting the Board of License Commissioners of St. Mary's County from issuing more than one Class A license with an off-sale privilege for each unit of 1,350 people in each election district in the county; requiring the Board to maintain the license quota by using the population figures of a specified report; and prohibiting the transfer of a license from one election district to another unless the transfer can be made without exceeding a specified license quota; etc.

2489.title: Alcoholic Beverages - Maximum Alcohol Content
2489.description: Prohibiting a person from selling at retail an alcoholic beverage with an alcohol content of 95% (190 proof) or more; and providing for a specified penalty.

2490.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
2490.title: Homeowner's Insurance - Coverage for Loss Caused by Discharge of Water - Study
2490.description: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to conduct a specified study relating to coverage for loss that is caused by or results from a discharge of water from a specified system or source; requiring the Administration to consult with specified stakeholders; requiring the Administration to report its findings and recommendations on or before December 1, 2010, to specified committees of the General Assembly; etc.

2493.title: Correctional Services - Repeat Violent Offenders - Diminution Credits and
2493.description: Prohibiting the earning of diminution credits to reduce the term of confinement of an inmate who has been convicted of a specified second or subsequent crime of violence; eliminating parole eligibility for an inmate who is serving a term of confinement for specified crimes of violence committed on or after a specified date; and providing that the Act does not restrict the authority of the Governor to pardon or remit a specified sentence.

2494.title: Comprehensive Energy Plan
2494.description: Requiring the Department of Planning to submit a specified interim report to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before a specified date; requiring the Department to submit a specified Comprehensive Energy Plan to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before a specified date; requiring the Department to solicit and consider input from specified parties in developing the Plan; requiring the Plan to contain specified information and make a specified recommendation; etc.

2497.title: Income Tax - Surcharge - Extension
2497.description: Extending to tax year 2014 the applicability of the 6.25% income tax rate on Maryland taxable income of an individual in excess of $1,000,000; etc.

2506.title: Carroll County - Property Tax Credit for Housing Units at Independent Living
2506.description: Authorizing the governing body of Carroll County or of a municipal corporation in Carroll County to grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on specified housing units at independent living retirement communities; etc.

2513.title: Estates and Trusts - Transfers - Recordation and Transfer Taxes
2513.description: Altering a prohibition on the imposition of taxes on property transfers by a personal representative without consideration or the recordation of instruments effecting those transfers; prohibiting the imposition of specified taxes on specified transfers of real property to or from specified trusts or the recordation of instruments effecting those transfers; providing exemptions under the recordation tax and State transfer tax relating to specified transfers from an estate and specified transfers to or from specified trusts; etc.

2514.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Education Health and Environmental Affairs
2514.title: State Government - Silver-Haired Legislature
2514.description: Establishing the Silver-Haired Legislature; requiring the legislature to be a bicameral legislature with each house made up of specified members and modeled after the General Assembly; requiring the legislature to work with the Department of Aging to adopt specified bylaws and procedures, meet once a year to conduct a specified model legislative session, and advise and work with the Governor and the General Assembly regarding the legislature's legislative priorities; etc.

2517.title: Criminal Procedure - Sexual Offender Registry - Failure to Provide Required
2517.description: Prohibiting a person required to register as a sexual offender from knowingly failing to provide any information required to be included in a registration statement; and providing criminal penalties for a violation of the Act.

2518.title: Criminal Procedure - Sexual Offender Registrants - Internet Posting
2518.description: Requiring rather than authorizing the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to post on the Internet a current listing of each sexual offender registrant; requiring specified information about each sexual offender registrant to be posted on the Internet; etc.

2521.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 - Montgomery County - Button
2521.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 to extend the date by which the Board of Directors of The Menare Foundation, Inc. must present evidence that a matching fund will be provided.

2529.title: Condominiums and Homeowners Associations - Governing Documents - Overriding
2529.description: Establishing that a provision in a specified governing document of a condominium or a homeowners association that restricts the right of a unit owner in a condominium or a homeowner in a homeowners association from renting their residential property is null and void until June 30, 2013; stating the intent of the General Assembly; providing for the termination of the Act; and making the Act an emergency measure.

2530.title: State Retirement and Pension System - Deceased Retiree's Retirement Application
2530.description: Requiring a medical board for the State Retirement and Pension System to authenticate an application submitted by a surviving spouse of a retiree to determine mental incapacity of a retiree of the State Retirement and Pension System; authorizing a surviving spouse of a retiree to submit an application to the Board of Trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System for a return of the retiree's remaining employee contributions plus interest; etc.

2535.title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Orthodontic Care - Reimbursement
2535.description: Requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to adopt a specified reimbursement procedure for orthodontic care that involves installation and maintenance of orthodontic braces for specified Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients.

2537.title: Workers' Compensation - Benefits - Dependency
2537.description: Altering the authority of the Workers' Compensation Commission to make specified determinations of dependency; altering the provisions relating to calculation of death benefits for individuals who are wholly or partly dependent; providing the amount of death benefits to specified dependents who are neither a dependent spouse nor a dependent child; specifying that the Commission has continuing jurisdiction under specified circumstances; etc.

2543.title: State Retirement and Pension System - Local Employer Contributions - Educators
2543.description: Providing for the calculation of a payment of a portion of the employer contributions for local school board employees and community college employees who are members of the Teachers' Retirement System or the Teachers' Pension System; requiring counties to pay a portion of the employer contributions for local school board employees and community college employees who are members of the Teachers' Retirement System or the Teachers' Pension System; etc.

2550.title: Education - High School Diploma by Examination
2550.description: Altering the eligibility requirements to obtain a high school diploma by examination by repealing the 3-month waiting period from the date of withdrawal from the high school; and repealing the authority of the Secretary of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation to waive a specified withdrawal requirement if the Secretary considers the waiver justifiable.

2557.title: Criminal Law - Flavored Cigars - Prohibition on Sale
2557.description: Prohibiting a person from selling or distributing or offering to sell or distribute a cigar or component part of a cigar that contains a natural or artificial constituent that imparts a characterizing flavor to the tobacco or the smoke of the cigar; establishing penalties; etc.

2558.title: Optional Retirement Program - State and Participating Governmental Unit
2558.description: Providing that only individuals serving as Governor on or before January 18, 2011, are eligible for a defined benefit retirement allowance; providing that, on or after July 1, 2010, specified individuals are not eligible to join the Employees' Pension System, the Teachers' Pension System, the State Police Retirement System, the Correctional Officers' Retirement System, the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, or the Judges' Retirement System; etc.

2559.title: Task Force to Study Erosion in Areas of Puritan Tiger Beetle Habitat
2559.description: Establishing the Task Force to Study Erosion in Areas of Puritan Tiger Beetle Habitat; providing for the membership and duties of the Task Force; designating a chair of the Task Force; providing for the staffing of the Task Force; requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor, the Senate Education, Health, and Environmental Affairs Committee, and the House Environmental Matters Committee by December 31, 2010; and terminating the Act on December 31, 2010.

2564.title: Family Law - Protective Orders - Expungement
2564.description: Authorizing a person to file a petition for expungement of a specified protective order under specified circumstances; and requiring a court to grant a petition for expungement of a specified protective order under specified circumstances.

2566.title: Baltimore County - Board of Education - Elected Members
2566.description: Establishing a procedure for the election of specified members of the Baltimore County Board of Education; requiring specified members of the County Board to reside in and be elected from specified districts; establishing a specified term of office for the elected members; providing for the removal of members under specified circumstances; providing a procedure for the filling of a vacancy for an elected member; providing for the election of the chair and vice chair of the County Board; etc.

2569.title: Alexander L. Booker Child Protection Construction Site Safety Act
2569.description: Requiring that specified signs indicating dangers on a construction site be prominently displayed at the construction site at all times; requiring the signs to include specified information; requiring a construction site to have barricades enclosing specified dangers on a construction site under specified circumstances; and requiring specified construction equipment to be equipped with specified safety equipment.

2571.title: Natural Resources - Conservation Law Enforcement Act of 2010
2571.description: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to include recommendations on specified reports and to submit specified reports to the Governor and the General Assembly; stating findings of the General Assembly; establishing specified responsibilities of the Natural Resources Police Force; establishing and providing for a commemorative lifetime hunting license; etc.

2573.title: Health - Clean Indoor Air Act - Electronic Smoking Devices
2573.description: Prohibiting a person from smoking an electronic smoking device in specified places; requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to adopt regulations that prohibit smoke from an electronic smoking device in specified indoor areas; and specifying that provisions of law do not preempt a county or municipal government from adopting specified measures regarding involuntary exposure to smoke from an electronic smoking device; etc.

2575.title: Maryland Transportation Authority - Chesapeake Bay Bridge - Tolls
2575.description: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Authority to temporarily stop collecting tolls for the William Preston Lane, Jr. Memorial Bridge (Chesapeake Bay Bridge) under specified congested traffic conditions; requiring the Authority to resume collecting tolls when specified congested traffic conditions no longer exist; requiring the Authority to take specified action to obtain a necessary modification of a specified trust agreement; etc.

2576.title: Applications for Certificates of Need - Notice to and Involvement of Bordering
2576.description: Requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to give notice of the filing of specified applications for a certificate of need that relates to a hospital to members of the governing body of each county that borders on the county where the action is planned; and requiring the Commission to adopt regulations to make participating entity status available to specified local health departments; etc.

2577.title: Nuclear Power Transparency Act of 2010
2577.description: Prohibiting a person from operating a nuclear generating facility until the person discloses specified information to the Public Service Commission in writing.

2582.title: State Budget
2582.description: Authorizing the General Assembly to increase or add Executive Department items in the Budget Bill, subject to a specified limitation; providing for the veto of specified Budget Bill items; providing for the reversion to original appropriations of specified vetoed items in the Budget Bill; authorizing the General Assembly to override Budget Bill item vetoes; establishing the manner in which and the time at which Budget Bill items become law; and submitting the amendment to the qualified voters for adoption or rejection.

2586.last_action: Recommit to Committee Budget and Taxation (Senator Brinkley)
2586.title: Satellite Simulcast Betting - Instant Horse Racing Machines
2586.description: Broadening the scope of satellite simulcast betting on horse races to include instant racing; and specifying that instant racing involves a bettor viewing a self-serve totalizator machine that displays a previously run horse race in digitized form and specified information before and after the race.

2588.title: Budget Reconciliation and Balancing Act
2588.description: Altering or repealing specified required appropriations; repealing provisions of law regarding stem cell research; altering or repealing specified grant programs; altering or repealing specified funding requirements; repealing inflation adjustments for the calculation of specified State funding requirements; altering State aid provided to community colleges and to specified nonpublic institutions of higher education; altering the distribution of specified revenues; etc.

2593.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2007 - St. Mary's County - St.
2593.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2007 to expand the authorized purposes of a grant to the Board of Supervisors of the St. Mary's Soil Conservation District to include acquisition, planning, and design of the St. Mary's Agriculture Service Center, located in Leonardtown.

2598.title: Education - Maintenance of Effort Requirement - Waiver and Appeal Process
2598.description: Altering the date by which a county governing body must make a request to the State Board of Education for a waiver from the maintenance of effort requirement; clarifying the maintenance of effort requirement for which a county or Baltimore City may apply for a waiver; requiring the State Board to grant a waiver, subject to specified limitations, under specified circumstances; etc.

2605.title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - License Fees
2605.description: Requiring specified establishments in Baltimore City for which specified alcoholic beverages licenses have been issued to pay additional fees if live entertainment or specified services are provided; altering specified license fees for establishments according to seating capacity; and altering specified 1-day license fees under specified circumstances.

2607.title: Members of the General Assembly - Limitation of Terms
2607.description: Proposing an amendment to the Maryland Constitution to impose a limit of four consecutive terms that a person may serve in the office of Senator or Delegate in the General Assembly; making stylistic changes; and submitting the amendment to the qualified voters of the State of Maryland for their adoption or rejection.

2609.title: Vehicle Laws - Required Security - Increase in Minimum Amounts
2609.description: Increasing the minimum amounts of required security for the payment of claims for bodily injury or death arising from a motor vehicle accident.

2615.title: Health Insurance - Surgical Treatment of Morbid Obesity - Repeal of Reporting
2615.description: Repealing a specified requirement that the Maryland Insurance Administration report annually to specified committees of the General Assembly on complaints relating to the denial of coverage for the surgical treatment of morbid obesity.

2619.title: Card Games - Prince George's County
2619.description: Authorizing a qualified organization to operate a card games facility in Prince George's County; limiting the number of licenses that the State may issue to operate a card games facility; limiting the number of locations at which card games facilities may be located; requiring legislation under specified circumstances; and submitting the Act to a referendum of the legally qualified voters of Maryland for their adoption or rejection.

2626.title: Evidence - Separate Act of Sexual Misconduct Involving a Minor - Admissibility
2626.description: Authorizing a court to admit evidence of a defendant's commission of a separate act of sexual misconduct involving a minor in the defendant's trial for a crime involving a sexual offense to a minor; specifying that the admission of the evidence is subject to a specified rule of evidence; requiring the court to hold a closed hearing to determine if specified evidence is admissible; etc.

2628.title: Homeowner's Insurance - Coverage for Other Structures
2628.description: Prohibiting an insurer that issues a policy of homeowner's insurance from requiring the policy to include coverage for other structures such as sheds or outbuildings if the policyholder does not have a shed or outbuilding on the property.

2632.title: State Racing Commission - Expansion of Membership
2632.description: Expanding the membership of the State Racing Commission to 13; altering the minimum number of members needed to meet specified qualifications; altering the maximum number of members allowed to exercise specified privileges; and requiring at least 3 members to be residents of Prince George's County.

2633.title: State Highway Administration - Clearing Sidewalks of Snow at Transit Stations -
2633.description: Requiring the State Highway Administration, under specified circumstances, to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding or any other agreement regarding the clearing of snow from the sidewalks serving specified transit stations after a declaration of a snow emergency; requiring the Memorandum of Understanding or agreement to include specified terms; etc.

2638.title: Raymond Scott Brown II Vehicle Towing Notification Act
2638.description: Requiring a person who undertakes the towing or removal of vehicles from parking lots to provide specified notice to specified police departments; altering the time frame within which a tower is required to provide notice to specified police departments after towing a vehicle from a parking lot; altering the information that a tower is required to provide to specified police departments after towing a vehicle from a parking lot; and establishing specified methods of providing the notice.

2639.title: Health Occupations - Restricted Volunteer Dentist's License - Restricted
2639.description: Establishing a restricted volunteer dentist's license and a restricted volunteer dental hygienist's license under the State Board of Dental Examiners; establishing specified procedures to apply for specified licenses; establishing the scope of practice of specified licenses; providing that the holders of specified licenses may not be required to complete specified continuing education requirements as a condition of renewal of the licenses; defining terms; etc.

2640.title: Real Property - Indemnity Mortgage - Effect of Foreclosure on Payment of
2640.description: Establishing that the requirement for the payment of public taxes, assessments, and charges before property may be transferred on the assessment books or records does not apply to the payment of recordation taxes; clarifying that a purchaser of foreclosed residential property is not required to pay the recordation tax for an indemnity mortgage securing the property unless the purchaser is the grantor of the indemnity mortgage; etc.

2641.title: Criminal Law - Leaving Dogs Outside and Unattended by Use of Restraint -
2641.description: Prohibiting a person from leaving a dog outside and unattended by use of a specified restraint during a specified time period or during a snow emergency declared by the Maryland State Police; and establishing penalties for a violation of the Act.

2647.title: Task Force to Study Unlicensed and Deceptive Real Estate Practices
2647.description: Establishing the Task Force to Study Unlicensed and Deceptive Real Estate Practices; providing for the composition, chair, and staffing of the Task Force; prohibiting a member of the Task Force from receiving compensation but entitling a member to reimbursement of specified expenses; requiring the Task Force to study and make recommendations regarding fraudulent and deceptive real estate practices within Maryland; etc.

2648.title: Real Property - Residential Property - Condemnation Procedures
2648.description: Requiring specified displacing agencies to provide a written notice to an owner of record of residential property at least 60 days before filing a specified condemnation action; requiring the notice to be sent by certified mail; specifying the information to be included in the written notice; establishing that an affected homeowner may bring an action against a displacing agency for damages sustained because of the failure of the agency to provide the written notice to the homeowner; etc.

2650.title: Health Occupations - Facilities for Dental Radiology
2650.description: Authorizing a licensed dentist to own and operate specified facilities; authorizing the staffing of specified facilities and the operation of specified equipment without the availability of a licensed dentist under a specified circumstance; authorizing certified dental radiation technologists to practice dental radiation technology in specified facilities under specified circumstances; requiring specified protection of a patient's body during the use of radiation; requiring the adoption of specified regulations; etc.

2651.title: Task Force on Solar Hot Water Systems in Prince George's County
2651.description: Establishing a Task Force on Solar Hot Water Systems in Prince George's County; providing for the members of the Task Force; providing for the designation of a chair of the Task Force; requiring the Prince George's County government to provide staff for the Task Force; prohibiting a member of the Task Force from receiving specified compensation; providing that a member of the Task Force may receive reimbursement of specified expenses; etc.

2659.title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Membership
2659.description: Increasing the number of members on the Health Services Cost Review Commission; specifying that specified members of the Commission shall represent specified interests; requiring members of the Commission to devote full-time duties to office; requiring the Governor, to the extent practicable, when making appointments to the Commission, to assure geographic balance and promote specified diversity in the Commission membership; authorizing the Governor to remove a member in a specified manner under specified circumstances; etc.

2660.title: Drunk and Drugged Driving - Subsequent Offenders - Prior Convictions
2660.description: Clarifying that prior convictions for specified alcohol- or drug-related driving offenses in this State and specified convictions under a federal law or a law of another state shall be considered prior convictions for the purpose of specified subsequent offender penalties; making a technical change; making stylistic changes; etc.

2663.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2003, 2004, and 2007 - Montgomery
2663.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2003, 2004, and 2007 to extend the deadline for a specified grantee to present evidence of a specified matching fund; extending the deadline for a specified grantee to expend or encumber the proceeds of a specified loan; etc.

2665.title: Rebate Programs for Retail Sales - Collection of Sales and Use Tax
2665.description: Requiring a State agency or nongovernment entity to require a buyer of a household appliance to make a specified certification before issuing or authorizing the issuance of rebates to reduce the cost of retail sales of household appliances under a program to promote energy efficiency.

2666.title: Stormwater Management - Development Projects - Redevelopment and Preliminary
2666.description: Establishing requirements for a specified redevelopment project design; authorizing a developer to make a fee-in-lieu payment to a local government to offset specified stormwater management requirements; requiring the fee-in-lieu payment to be in an amount determined by a local government and used for specified purposes; authorizing a person to submit a stormwater management plan that complies with specified laws and regulations if a development project receives specified approvals before May 4, 2010; etc.

2668.title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Review of Program Proposals
2668.description: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to review program proposals; requiring the Commission to adopt regulations that provide for the receipt of comments and objections from appropriate parties following submission of a completed proposal and the review of objections received by the Commission in accordance with a specified process; etc.

2672.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
2672.title: Property Tax Credit - Disabled State Troopers and Natural Resources Police
2672.description: Including in the definition of law enforcement officer, under a specified existing property tax credit program for permanently and totally disabled law enforcement officers, State Troopers and members of the police forces of the Department of Natural Resources who reside in Baltimore County; and providing that the Act applies retroactively to the local law enacted by Baltimore County under the authority of the specified property tax credit program.

2675.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
2675.title: Religious Corporations - Laws Governing Assets of United Methodist Church -
2675.description: Repealing requirements for the holding of specified assets owned by a specified Methodist Church; repealing provisions of law providing for the effect of the absence of a trust clause in a specified deed or other conveyance executed before a specified date; repealing a provision of law providing for the effect of provisions of law on the retention of title to assets controlled by specified churches in Garrett County; etc.

2676.last_action: Hearing 3/30 at 1:00 p.m. (Education Health and Environmental Affairs)
2676.title: Snowstorm and Related Climate Change Preparation Act
2676.description: Requiring, on or before December 1, 2010, the Maryland Commission on Climate Change, in cooperation with the Department of Transportation and the Maryland Emergency Management Agency, to submit a specified report to the Governor and the General Assembly on specified investments necessary for the State to respond to specified weather emergencies; requiring the report to include specified information; etc.

2678.title: Public Service Commission - Restriction on the Construction of Overhead
2678.description: Prohibiting the Public Service Commission from authorizing, and an electric company from undertaking or exercising a right of condemnation in relation to, the construction of an overhead transmission line designed to carry in excess of 69,000 volts if the electric company is owned in whole or in part by one or more entities that are not electric companies or do not have specified authority; and providing that the Act applies retroactively to applications filed or pending on or after February 1, 2010.

2679.title: Public Utility Companies - Energy Efficiency and Demand Response Programs -
2679.description: Requiring, as part of a specified review, the Public Service Commission to make a determination concerning procedures for the competitive selection of heating, ventilation, air conditioning, or refrigeration service providers; requiring the Commission to review annual updates of electricity savings and demand reduction plans and make a specified determination; requiring the Commission to approve or affirm specified electricity savings and demand reduction plans at a specified interval; etc.

2680.title: Natural Resources - Fishery Management Reform Act - Task Force and Sunset
2680.description: Repealing the termination provision relating to the Fishery Management Reform Act; and repealing provisions that established the Task Force on Fishery Management because of the completion of the work of the Task Force and the submission of a report of its findings and recommendations dated December 1, 2008.

2682.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 - Baltimore City - NACA
2682.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2008 to extend the deadline by which the Board of Directors of The Freedom and Democracy Schools Foundation, Inc. must present evidence of a specified matching fund.

2684.title: Workers' Compensation - Average Weekly Wage - Compensation
2684.description: Authorizing an employer, an employer's insurer, or the Uninsured Employers' Fund to make a specified assertion regarding the average weekly wage of a covered employee by submitting a specified wage statement to the State Workers' Compensation Commission before a specified decision is issued by the Commission; and prohibiting an employer, an employer's insurer, or the Uninsured Employers' Fund from receiving a credit for a specified overpayment of compensation under specified circumstances.

2686.title: Officers of the Court - Criminal Offenses - Reporting and Investigation
2686.description: Requiring the Commission on Judicial Disabilities and the Attorney Grievance Commission to refer specified matters to the Office of the State Prosecutor if there are reasonable grounds to believe that an officer of the court may have committed a criminal offense; requiring specified evidence to be made available to the Office of the State Prosecutor; authorizing the State Prosecutor to investigate a criminal offense alleged to have been committed by an officer of the court; etc.

2688.title: Environment - Heating Oil - Sulfur Content
2688.description: Prohibiting, on or after July 1, 2014, a person from selling number 2 heating oil with a sulfur content exceeding 500 parts per million in the State to a consumer for end use.

2696.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2009 - Prince George's County -
2696.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2009 to expand the scope of a specified grant.

2698.title: State Personnel - Equal Employment Opportunity Program - Revisions
2698.description: Requiring the Secretary of Budget and Management to establish an independent equal employment opportunity unit in the Department of Budget and Management to oversee the administration of the Equal Employment Opportunity Program in a specified manner; requiring the unit to report directly to the Equal Employment Opportunity Coordinator; requiring the Secretary, in consultation with a specified committee, to establish by regulation a specified mediation or arbitration process; etc.

2701.title: Environment - Maryland Oil Disaster Containment, Clean-Up and Contingency Fund
2701.description: Expanding the uses and altering the basis for calculating a license fee credited to the Maryland Oil Disaster Containment, Clean-Up and Contingency Fund; extending the deadline by which the owner of a heating oil tank may apply for reimbursement from the Oil Contaminated Site Environmental Cleanup Fund; authorizing, in fiscal year 2011, the transfer of up to $500,000 from the Oil Contaminated Site Environmental Cleanup Fund to the Maryland Oil Disaster Containment, Clean-Up and Contingency Fund; etc.

2703.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Senate Rules Withdrawn
2703.title: Family Law - Registration of Family Day Care Homes - Exemption
2703.description: Providing that a specified family day care home that provides care to children whose parents or guardians are friends of the provider and who provides day care on a nonregular basis for less than 25 hours a month is not required to register with the State Department of Education.

2705.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - Low Impact Development
2705.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $150,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of The Low Impact Development Center, Inc. for the planning, design, and construction of green roof projects of The Low Impact Development Center, located in Prince George's County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

2707.title: Political Subdivisions - Collective Bargaining Agreements - Binding Arbitration
2707.description: Authorizing retroactively a county or municipal corporation to adopt a specified local law or ordinance regarding binding arbitration in specified collective bargaining disputes; and making the Act an emergency measure.

2708.title: Public Senior Higher Education Institutions - Audits - Communicating
2708.description: Requiring the Legislative Auditor to send a copy of the discussion notes of an examination conducted by the Office of Legislative Audits of a public senior higher education institution to the appropriate governing board of the institution.

2710.title: Criminal Law - Fraud - Fraudulent Misrepresentation Made to a Nonprofit
2710.description: Prohibiting a person from making false or fraudulent pretenses, promises, or misrepresentations to a nonprofit organization concerning a written contract or lease for goods of a specified value; providing that a violation of the Act is a misdemeanor; establishing penalties; providing for restitution; providing that prosecution under the Act does not preclude prosecution for theft; providing for a merger of penalties under specified circumstances; etc.

2711.last_action: Motion Rules Suspended for late introduction (Senator Conway) Adopted
2711.title: Public Health - Sales of Previously Sold Undergarments and Bathing Suits -
2711.description: Prohibiting a retail establishment from selling an undergarment that has been previously sold and returned to the retail establishment; providing for the application of the Act; providing exceptions to the Act for a retail establishment that markets its merchandise as used or secondhand and for undergarments sealed in unopened packaging; providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $500; and defining the terms "retail establishment" and "undergarment".

2713.title: Baltimore County Revenue Authority - Conveyance, Sale, or Transfer of a Parking
2713.description: Requiring the Baltimore County Revenue Authority, after offering the conveyance, sale, or transfer of a parking facility to the county, to next offer the conveyance, sale, or transfer of the facility to a bona fide local association of businesses representing two or more businesses, if any, for its acceptance or rejection; requiring the authority to hold the offer open for at least 180 days; etc.

2716.title: Maryland American Legion Day
2716.description: Supporting the goals and ideals of American Legion Day and calling on the people of Maryland to observe American Legion Day with appropriate programs and activities.
